 [![Skywalker, proving himself to be the Chosen One](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/TestOfTheOne-Overlords.png/revision/latest?cb=20130524212013) [![Skywalker, proving himself to be the Chosen One](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/TestOfTheOne-Overlords.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130524212013)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/10/TestOfTheOne-Overlords.png/revision/latest?cb=20130524212013) 

Skywalker, proving himself to be the Chosen One

 

Shaken by the encounter, he confronted the Father, who told of his family's history, and wondered if he was truly the Chosen One. Though Skywalker dismissed the prophecy as a myth, the Father arranged a test to see whether the Jedi Knight was fit to fulfill his [destiny](/wiki/Destiny "Destiny"). Ordering his children to kill Tano and Kenobi, the Father goaded Skywalker into choosing between his master and his apprentice, but Skywalker instead controlled the two beings, bringing them to their knees. Having proved himself to be the Chosen One, the Father pleaded with him to stay, but Skywalker refused, leaving with Tano and Kenobi on their [shuttle](/wiki/Jedi_shuttle_634 "Jedi shuttle 634").[[59]](#cite_note-Overlords-59)

They were interrupted when the Son kidnapped Tano, prompting Skywalker to pursue him, at the cost of damaging their ship near Son's cathedral. Despite Kenobi's reservations, Skywalker went after his Padawan and climbed the tower to find Tano, corrupted by the dark side. Skywalker fought her, soon to be joined by Kenobi, only to be interrupted by the Father's arrival. Kenobi tried to hand Skywalker the [Dagger of Mortis](/wiki/Dagger_of_Mortis "Dagger of Mortis"), but Tano grabbed it and gave it to the Son, who killed her, for she was no longer useful; the dark side user then mortally wounded his sister as she stepped in to save her Father. Skywalker begged the Father to save Tano, and the dying Daughter used Skywalker as a conduit to channel the last of her life force into Tano, resurrecting her. The Father told them to leave the planet before the Son used their ship to do so.[[142]](#cite_note-Altar_of_Mortis-142)

 [![Skywalker's vision of his future self, consumed by the dark side](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6e/AnakinVaderVision-GOM.png/revision/latest?cb=20130525233341) [![Skywalker's vision of his future self, consumed by the dark side](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6e/AnakinVaderVision-GOM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/249?cb=20130525233341)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6e/AnakinVaderVision-GOM.png/revision/latest?cb=20130525233341) 

Skywalker's vision of his future self, consumed by the dark side

 

The ship's repairs forced them to stay a bit longer, though, and Skywalker went to the Father for guidance. On their meeting, the Father was determined to kill Son, but refused Skywalker's offer of aid, telling the Jedi Knight to look inside himself for the answer for what was to be done. Leaving him, Skywalker encountered the [Force spirit](/wiki/Force_spirit "Force spirit") of his first mentor, Qui-Gon Jinn. Though Skywalker sought his advice, Jinn advised him to remember his training and trust his instincts, and to go to the [Well of the Dark Side](/wiki/Well_of_the_Dark_Side "Well of the Dark Side") to face his most personal challenge. There, the Son forced Skywalker to confront his future, one consumed by the dark side. Horrified, Skywalker submitted to the Son as he promised him the power to avert this [destiny](/wiki/Destiny "Destiny"). Soon, Kenobi arrived, and Skywalker left him trapped at the well, claiming to have seen the truth—that it was the Jedi who would stand in the way of peace.[[31]](#cite_note-Ghosts_of_Mortis-31)

Skywalker arrived as his Padawan disabled the ship and went to rescue Kenobi, while the Son went to steal the Dagger. As Skywalker waited, the Father appeared before him and recognized that his son had broken the rules of [time](/wiki/Time "Time"); he wiped Skywalker's memory of these future visions, leaving him unconscious, and brought him to his monastery. Skywalker awoke to find the Father, Kenobi, and Tano, moments before the Son arrived with the Dagger. To end the conflict, the Father impaled himself to distract his Son, while Skywalker killed the Son with his lightsaber. As the Father also died, he warned Skywalker to be wary of his feelings as they could lead to his downfall. As was noted by the Father,[[31]](#cite_note-Ghosts_of_Mortis-31) Skywalker had brought balance to the Force[[7]](#cite_note-Join_the_Battle-7) on Mortis through the deaths of the Force wielders, and he still had a chance to do so for the full galaxy.[[31]](#cite_note-Ghosts_of_Mortis-31)

After the Father's death, the three Jedi were transplanted back to the galaxy to finally rendezvous with Rex. Surprised to learn that, to Rex and the others, they had only been gone for a moment, they returned to the Star Destroyer.[[31]](#cite_note-Ghosts_of_Mortis-31) They would later report this encounter to the Council, with Skywalker even mentioning that he had spoken with Jinn to Yoda. Even though Skywalker was not entirely convinced, they came to believe it had merely been an illusion of the old mentor.[[143]](#cite_note-Voices-143) In reality, it had truly been the spirit of Jinn.[[144]](#cite_note-SWCVD,NE-144)

#### The Citadel

:   "*I'm not sure what to think of your new ally.*"  
    "*Well, I think we need people like him. This is a war. If we aren't willing to do what it takes to win, we risk losing everything we try to protect.*"
:   ―Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker, on Wilhuff Tarkin[[145]](#cite_note-Citadel_Rescue-145)

More than one year and nine months into the war,[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) following the [capture](/wiki/Capture_of_Even_Piell "Capture of Even Piell") of Jedi Council member [Even Piell](/wiki/Even_Piell "Even Piell") by the Separatists, Skywalker and Kenobi were briefed by Master Plo Koon and sent along with their team—which included Rex, Cody, Echo, and Fives—to infiltrate the [Citadel](/wiki/Citadel "Citadel") on [Lola Sayu](/wiki/Lola_Sayu "Lola Sayu") to retrieve Master Piell, who held the information on the [Nexus Route](/wiki/Nexus_Route "Nexus Route"). Refusing to let Tano risk her life on such a dangerous mission, Skywalker devised a strategy to bypass the lifeform scanners of the prison; the whole team underwent [carbon-freezing](/wiki/Carbon-freezing "Carbon-freezing") and were transported to the Citadel by Commander R2-D2 and his reprogrammed battle droid squadron.[[147]](#cite_note-The_Citadel-147)

After landing, Skywalker was thawed out and he found, to his surprise, that Tano had disobeyed orders and followed him. Forced to take her along, the team made its way to the facilities, leaving the astromech to guard their shuttle. After free-climbing to the entry point through a cliff wall blasted by a strong gale and littered with [electro-mines](/wiki/Electro-mine "Electro-mine"), and after Tano deactivated the ray-shield on the entrance, the team was able to enter, except for [Charger](/wiki/Charger "Charger"), who fell to his death and alerted the prison staff, led by [Osi Sobeck](/wiki/Osi_Sobeck "Osi Sobeck"), of their presence. Inside, they lost [Longshot](/wiki/Longshot "Longshot"), but finally made it to Master Piell, whom they freed and who told them they needed to rescue his officers.[[147]](#cite_note-The_Citadel-147)

 [![Skywalker putting Captain Tarkin in his place](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/AnakinClashesWithTarkin-TC.png/revision/latest?cb=20130526230425) [![Skywalker putting Captain Tarkin in his place](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/AnakinClashesWithTarkin-TC.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/271?cb=20130526230425)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/AnakinClashesWithTarkin-TC.png/revision/latest?cb=20130526230425) 

Skywalker putting Captain Tarkin in his place

 

Despite the many traps laid through the [fortress](/wiki/Fortress "Fortress"), the team rescued the officers, when they met the other carrier of the Nexus Route coordinates, Captain [Wilhuff Tarkin](/wiki/Wilhuff_Tarkin "Wilhuff Tarkin"). The team was split into two—while Kenobi's team created a diversion, Skywalker would lead the others away. In Tarkin's company, Skywalker and his team escaped through the cavern system below the prison, when Tarkin expressed some skepticism about the Jedi's plan, to which Skywalker told Tarkin that he reserved his trust to those who understood gratitude.[[147]](#cite_note-The_Citadel-147) However, they soon found common ground, for they both believed the Jedi Code prevented the Order from going far enough to achieve victory in the ongoing war,[[148]](#cite_note-Counterattack-148) and Tarkin developed a grudging appreciation for Skywalker.[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146)

As they made their way out of the fuel line to rendezvous with R2-D2 and the shuttle, they were attacked by droids and forced to join Kenobi at their pick-up point, with the shuttle heavily guarded. During the skirmish, Echo tried to defend the shuttle, but its destruction and subsequent explosion seemingly killed him. As they ran into the cave system, Skywalker and Kenobi contacted the Council, telling them they needed to escape, and Koon immediately departed to pick them up.[[148]](#cite_note-Counterattack-148) They contacted the Council again to be informed of the extraction point; as they proceeded to the location, Sobeck sent [anoobas](/wiki/Anooba "Anooba") after them. The creatures claimed Master Piell's life, who passed his intel on to Tano, and the group took a moment to honor his death. Ultimately, they got to the extraction point on time, and fled on Plo Koon's rescue shuttle, with [Saesee Tiin](/wiki/Saesee_Tiin "Saesee Tiin")'s fleet [covering](/wiki/Battle_of_Lola_Sayu "Battle of Lola Sayu") them to allow their escape back to Coruscant.[[145]](#cite_note-Citadel_Rescue-145)

#### Padawan lost

:   "*When I was out there, alone, all I had was your training and the lessons you taught me. And because of you, I did survive. And not only that, I was able to lead others to survive as well.*"  
    "*I don't know what to say.*"  
    "*I do. Thank you, Master.* "  
    "*You're welcome, my Padawan.*"
:   ―Ahsoka Tano and Anakin Skywalker[[149]](#cite_note-Wookiee_Hunt-149)

 [![Skywalker searching for Ahsoka Tano with the Jedi Temple star charts.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/Anakinsearching.png/revision/latest?cb=20130529235311) [![Skywalker searching for Ahsoka Tano with the Jedi Temple star charts.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/Anakinsearching.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130529235311)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/Anakinsearching.png/revision/latest?cb=20130529235311) 

Skywalker searching for Ahsoka Tano with the Jedi Temple star charts.

 

Skywalker, Tano, and 501st forces fought on Felucia alongside Plo Koon and his clones in [taking out](/wiki/Second_Battle_of_Felucia "Second Battle of Felucia") a reinforced [Separatist outpost](/wiki/Separatist_outpost_(Felucia) "Separatist outpost (Felucia)"). Breaking their forces into three groups, Skywalker and Rex's team were responsible for attacking the front gate and destroying the [tactical droid](/wiki/Tactical_droid "Tactical droid"), [TZ-33](/wiki/TZ-33 "TZ-33"), securing the outpost together with Koon and Tano's teams.[[150]](#cite_note-Padawan_Lost-150)

However, Skywalker then noticed that Tano had disappeared during the battle, and ordered a perimeter sweep. Skywalker had his men search around the outpost, to no avail several times over. Master Koon then informed that he had alerted all forces throughout the Outer Rim and assured Skywalker that she would be found eventually, but also firmly told him that their mission on Felucia was finished and that they had to return to Coruscant. However, Skywalker refused to abandon her, to which Koon observed his emotions were clouding his judgment. Skywalker countered "I will not leave her fate up to others." Koon insisted, "It's time to go." Only then did Skywalker comply and call everybody in to leave the planet.[[150]](#cite_note-Padawan_Lost-150)

Back at the Temple, Skywalker relentlessly searched for possibilities in the star charts, which prompted Koon to suggest that he should trust in Tano's abilities.[[150]](#cite_note-Padawan_Lost-150) Following the [events](/wiki/Battle_on_Wasskah "Battle on Wasskah") on [Wasskah](/wiki/Wasskah "Wasskah"), Skywalker's search for his Padawan came to an end when she arrived to the Temple on the *[Halo](/wiki/Halo "Halo")*, in company of her [Wookiee](/wiki/Wookiee "Wookiee") allies and the younglings [O-Mer](/wiki/O-Mer "O-Mer") and [Jinx](/wiki/Jinx "Jinx"). Upon seeing her, Skywalker profusely apologized for all that happened, heavily blaming himself for his apparent inability to protect her. Tano, however, assured him that his instruction gave her the skills necessary to survive and thanked him for his guidance. The two bowed to each other in newfound mutual respect under the delighted eye of Master Yoda.[[149]](#cite_note-Wookiee_Hunt-149)

#### Battle of Horain

:   "*Stand down! It's General Kenobi. And it looks like he's bringing a new friend.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker[[151]](#cite_note-Roger_Roger-151)

Sometime later Skywalker participated in the [Battle of Horain](/wiki/Battle_of_Horain "Battle of Horain"), alongside Kenobi and Rex. Skywalker was contacted by Rex, who was requesting assistance, though he was already preoccupied with a group of Vulture Droids. Skywalker later met Kenobi and Rex in disbelief, noticing they had hijacked an AAT alongside faulty battle droid [Bats](/wiki/B1-0516 "B1-0516").[[151]](#cite_note-Roger_Roger-151)

#### Skirmish on Retta

On [Retta](/wiki/Retta "Retta"), Skywalker ambushed a group of B1 battle droids alongside Grand Master Yoda. Skywalker was soon attacked by [Kreeda](/wiki/Kreeda "Kreeda"), a [Segredo](/wiki/Segredo "Segredo") who was attempting to scare the Jedi away. However, Kreeda soon became friendly to the Jedi, as she was an old friend of Yoda. When Skywalker attempted to recruit Kreeda as a spy, the Segredo left, and Skywalker and Yoda were attacked by battle droids soon after. After being separated with Yoda, he met the Jedi Master and Kreeda again, the latter of whom explained she was protecting refugees of the Clone Wars. Using a hat from one of the individuals she was protecting, Skywalker pretended to be using the "[cloaking cap](/wiki/Cloaking_cap "Cloaking cap")" to distract General [Flebek](/wiki/Flebek "Flebek"), allowing Yoda to take out a B1. Believing there was no secret to invisibility and that it had been a trick, Flebek fled the area and boarded her ship. Upon asking what his report would entail, Yoda told Skywalker that he would tell Mace Windu there was nothing of interest on Retta.[[152]](#cite_note-Hide_and_Seek-152)

#### Battle of Mon Cala

:   "*Alright. I think I'm getting the hang of this.*"  
    *[Skywalker gets electrocuted]*  
    "*Less talking helps.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker and Kit Fisto, restrained by Mon Calamari eels[[153]](#cite_note-Prisoners-153)

After the assassination of [King Kolina](/wiki/Yos_Kolina "Yos Kolina") of [Mon Cala](/wiki/Mon_Cala "Mon Cala") and new discord in the fragile peace between the [Mon Calamari](/wiki/Mon_Calamari "Mon Calamari") and the [Quarren](/wiki/Quarren "Quarren"), Skywalker and Amidala, sent as representatives of the Republic, arrived to the planet at the behest of Captain [Gial Ackbar](/wiki/Gial_Ackbar "Gial Ackbar") of the [Mon Calamari Guard](/wiki/Mon_Calamari_Guard "Mon Calamari Guard") and protector of young [Prince](/wiki/Prince "Prince") [Lee-Char](/wiki/Lee-Char "Lee-Char"), but so did [Riff Tamson](/wiki/Riff_Tamson "Riff Tamson"), Separatist [ambassador](/wiki/Ambassador "Ambassador"). Though Skywalker and Amidala tried to mediate between the parties, the Quarren left the council hall, dissatisfied with the Mon Calamari rule. Along with Ackbar, they contacted Yoda and Windu, who dispatched a company of clone troopers equipped for underwater combat under the command of Kit Fisto and Tano.[[154]](#cite_note-Water_War-154)

 [![Skywalker, alongside Gial Ackbar and Kit Fisto, during the Battle of Mon Cala](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7b/SWCW_Ackbar.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110917154139) [![Skywalker, alongside Gial Ackbar and Kit Fisto, during the Battle of Mon Cala](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7b/SWCW_Ackbar.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/288?cb=20110917154139)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7b/SWCW_Ackbar.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20110917154139) 

Skywalker, alongside Gial Ackbar and Kit Fisto, during the Battle of Mon Cala

 

In the meantime, during the [Quarren attack](/wiki/Battle_of_Mon_Cala "Battle of Mon Cala") assisted by Separatist aqua droids, Skywalker and Amidala accompanied Lee-Char, who in turn was [bodyguarded](/wiki/Bodyguard "Bodyguard") by Ackbar. He engaged the Quarren soldiers until he was recalled by his wife to help Senator [Meena Tills](/wiki/Meena_Tills "Meena Tills"), while leaving Tano to cover the prince and rescue him from Tamson. As the first Separatist/Quarren assault came to an end, Skywalker reunited with Amidala, Tano, Fisto, Ackbar, Lee-Char, and Tills to await the second assault, this time assisted by the [Hydroid Medusas](/wiki/Hydroid_Medusa "Hydroid Medusa"), which proved incredibly effective against the Republic-Mon Calamari army. Forced to retreat into the caves below, they regrouped to decide their next course of action—to retreat to the surface, only return to the [sea](/wiki/Ocean "Ocean") floor as their [frigate](/wiki/Consular-class_cruiser_(Charger_c70_retrofit) "Consular-class cruiser (Charger c70 retrofit)") was destroyed and they were attacked by more enemies.[[155]](#cite_note-Gungan_Attack-155)

They split into two groups: Skywalker went with his wife, Ackbar, and Tills, whereas Fisto, Tano, and two troopers accompanied the Prince. Expecting Republic reinforcements to come soon, Skywalker and his group proceeded to the Mon Calamari central planetary scanner facility, where the Jedi Knight collapsed the entire structure with the Force, rendering planetary defenses blind to upcoming Republic reinforcements—the Gungan Grand Army, and Representative Binks, sent at the behest of the High Council. However, Tamson used *Trident*-class assault ship to create whirlpools, disorienting the Republic-Gungan forces, and though Skywalker managed to destroy one of them, all but Tano and Lee-Char were captured.[[155]](#cite_note-Gungan_Attack-155)

Brought before Riff Tamson, Skywalker and Fisto were restrained by [electric eels](/wiki/Mon_Cala_eel "Mon Cala eel"), whereas Amidala and Jar Jar Binks were imprisoned within [containment devices](/wiki/Mon_Cala_crab "Mon Cala crab"), interrogating the two Jedi about the whereabouts of Prince Lee-Char. During the interrogation, Tamson attempted to force them to talk by biting a tiny hole into Amidala's helmet, allowing her suit to fill up with [water](/wiki/Water "Water"). However, Tamson left to see the located Prince in person, Skywalker and Fisto used the Force to remove the water from her helmet, while Binks used his saliva to seal the puncture, saving her from drowning. The four were soon taken to witness Prince Lee-Char's execution, in which [Nossor Ri](/wiki/Nossor_Ri "Nossor Ri"), the Quarren leader, saved the prince at the critical moment and turned his people against the Separatists, resulting in the victory of the Mon Cala people. With the peace restored, Skywalker and his friends were present for the [coronation of Lee-Char](/wiki/Coronation_of_Lee-Char "Coronation of Lee-Char"), now recognized by both Mon Calamari and Quarren as their new monarch.[[153]](#cite_note-Prisoners-153)

#### Naboo

:   "*Padmé, I'm sorry.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker, after being traded for Grievous[[156]](#cite_note-Shadow_Warrior-156)

Following rumors that the Gungans planned to aid the Separatists in an attack on Theed, Skywalker accompanied Amidala to Theed and later, to the Gungan territory near [Lake Paonga](/wiki/Lake_Paonga "Lake Paonga") where they met with Binks, who confirmed the troubling rumors. He took the couple to Otoh Gunga, where they spoke to Boss [Lyonie](/wiki/Lyonie "Lyonie"), and realized he was under the influence of a mind-controlling [necklace](/wiki/Necklace "Necklace"), which Skywalker telekinetically snatched, making him recover; Lyonie told them that new [minister](/wiki/Minister "Minister"), [Rish Loo](/wiki/Rish_Loo "Rish Loo"), had given it to him.[[156]](#cite_note-Shadow_Warrior-156)

 [![Anakin gets captured by Dooku](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/49/DookuEnjoysHisJob-SW.png/revision/latest?cb=20121122162637) [![Anakin gets captured by Dooku](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/49/DookuEnjoysHisJob-SW.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/264?cb=20121122162637)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/49/DookuEnjoysHisJob-SW.png/revision/latest?cb=20121122162637) 

Anakin gets captured by Dooku

 

Skywalker, Amidala, and Binks assisted Lyonie as he confronted Loo, only to face droid commandos, and for Lyonie to be stabbed by Loo before the minister's escape. Taking the Boss to an infirmary, the couple noticed the uncanny resemblance between the unconscious Lyonie and Binks, who they convince to impersonate Lyonie and cancel the Gungan assault on Theed. As he did so, uncovering Loo's deception to the army, Skywalker pursued the fugitive minister to a trap set by Count Dooku in [Loo's laboratory](/wiki/Rish_Loo%27s_laboratory "Rish Loo's laboratory"). As Dooku killed Loo and revealed his secret input in the Battle of Naboo, Skywalker dueled the Count, only to be overwhelmed by Dooku's powers and his four MagnaGuards.[[156]](#cite_note-Shadow_Warrior-156)

Dooku then contacted Amidala and offered an exchange—the Jedi Knight for General Grievous, who had been [captured](/wiki/Skirmish_on_Naboo "Skirmish on Naboo") by the Gungan Grand Army, thanks to Gungan General [Tarpals's](/wiki/Roos_Tarpals "Roos Tarpals") sacrifice. An hour later, Skywalker was brought and handed over to Amidala, Queen [Neeyutnee](/wiki/Neeyutnee "Neeyutnee") and the Gungans, while Grievous was allowed to remain free.[[156]](#cite_note-Shadow_Warrior-156)

#### Battle of Umbara

:   "*Does my battalion have to do everything?*"  
    "*You seem to always volunteer.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi[[64]](#cite_note-Darkness_on_Umbara-64)

 [![Skywalker leading the 501st Legion on Umbara, before leaving it to Pong Krell](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/79/RexSkywalker-Umbara.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20111103074304) [![Skywalker leading the 501st Legion on Umbara, before leaving it to Pong Krell](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/79/RexSkywalker-Umbara.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/266?cb=20111103074304)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/79/RexSkywalker-Umbara.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20111103074304) 

Skywalker leading the 501st Legion on Umbara, before leaving it to Pong Krell

 

During the [campaign](/wiki/Battle_of_Umbara "Battle of Umbara") on [Umbara](/wiki/Umbara "Umbara"), Skywalker and Kenobi discussed their attack strategy against the [Umbaran capital city](/wiki/Umbaran_capital_city "Umbaran capital city"), which was being defended by Confederate and [local militia](/wiki/Umbaran_Militia "Umbaran Militia") forces. Together with Rex and Fives, Skywalker prepared to repel enemy reinforcements striking against Kenobi's joint attack with Jedi Masters Saesee Tiin and [Pong Krell](/wiki/Pong_Krell "Pong Krell"), who would be supporting Kenobi from the south whereas Skywalker and 501st Legion would advance from the north.[[64]](#cite_note-Darkness_on_Umbara-64)

Amidst heavy fire, Skywalker and his [battalion](/wiki/Battalion "Battalion") made it to the landing site, and then to a ridge which they used as a staging area. As he and Rex awaited the rest of their men, hoping to move out soon and reinforce General Kenobi's battalion, [Dogma](/wiki/Dogma "Dogma") reported that all platoons had reported in, and Skywalker told him to get some rest. Dogma replied that he was fine, but Rex told him it was a direct order, prompting Dogma to do as he was told. As Rex observed Dogma was "wound tight but loyal," Skywalker joked that he reminded him of Rex, who disagreed, saying that was him in the old days.[[64]](#cite_note-Darkness_on_Umbara-64)

Shortly after this, the [Umbarans](/wiki/Umbaran "Umbaran") ambushed Skywalker and his troops, but an airstrike by Master Krell and [Odd Ball](/wiki/Davijaan "Davijaan") saved them. After the quick save, Krell approached Skywalker with a disconcerting message: the Council had ordered Skywalker back to Coruscant, effective immediately, as requested by Supreme Chancellor Palpatine, for reasons unknown. Though reluctant to leave his troops in the midst of battle, Skywalker was forced to relinquish command over his troops to Master Krell and make the journey back to Coruscant.[[64]](#cite_note-Darkness_on_Umbara-64) Despite Krell's efforts to sabotage the Republic effort by tricking the 501st and the [212th battalions](/wiki/212th_Attack_Battalion "212th Attack Battalion") into attacking each other, Kenobi was successful in taking the capital and routing the remaining Umbaran forces, securing all sectors of the planet for the Republic.[[157]](#cite_note-Carnage_of_Krell-157)

#### Kiros

:   "*Zygerrian* scum! *I'll handle that slaver…*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker, on Darts D'Nar[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158)

 [![Tano, taken aback by her master's intensity](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e1/Anakin_interrogates_DNar.png/revision/latest?cb=20151119054351) [![Tano, taken aback by her master's intensity](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e1/Anakin_interrogates_DNar.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/259?cb=20151119054351)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e1/Anakin_interrogates_DNar.png/revision/latest?cb=20151119054351) 

Tano, taken aback by her master's intensity

 

After ten rotations of Yoda's last contact with the Togruta colonists on [Kiros](/wiki/Kiros "Kiros"), Skywalker, Tano, Rex, Cody, Kenobi, and their forces arrived at the world to investigate its silence, with Skywalker particularly worried they would be too late. After landing, suspicious of the lack of colonists in the [town](/wiki/Artisan_colony "Artisan colony"), they used [BARC speeders](/wiki/BARC_speeder "BARC speeder") to [break through](/wiki/Battle_on_Kiros "Battle on Kiros") the city and surround the [governor's tower](/wiki/Governor%27s_tower "Governor's tower"), used as the Separatist Headquarters. The enemy commander, [Darts D'Nar](/wiki/Darts_D%27Nar "Darts D'Nar"), then sent a message to Kenobi to discuss terms of surrender. Skywalker then took the holoprojector out of Cody's hand and called D'Nar "[Zygerrian](/wiki/Zygerrian "Zygerrian") scum." Though Skywalker wanted to deal with the slaver himself, Kenobi told him to locate the missing colonists while he negotiated. As Skywalker contacted Admiral Yularen to conduct a planetary bioscan to find them, Kenobi explained Skywalker's behavior to Tano.[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158)

Overhearing from Kenobi's negotiations that D'Nar had planted [bombs](/wiki/Thermal_annihilator_bomb "Thermal annihilator bomb") throughout the city, Skywalker and Tano set out to disarm them. Despite [sniper droids](/wiki/Droideka_Sharpshooter "Droideka Sharpshooter"), they destroyed the bombs in the nick of time, just for Kenobi to tell them D'Nar was escaping on the *[Tecora](/wiki/Tecora "Tecora")*. With some effort, they managed to board the ship, inside which D'Nar pitted a [blixus](/wiki/Blixus "Blixus") against them, but Skywalker managed to throw it off the ship, while Tano bested D'Nar in the cockpit. Soon, Skywalker joined her and, with frightening intensity, threatened the Zygerrian into revealing the colonists' location, much to Tano's surprise. However, it proved effective as D'Nar revealed that his Queen would hold the Royal Slave Auction.[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158)

#### Zygerria

:   "*A most curious Jedi who cares more about his friends than his own mission. Hero. General. And now, my servant.*"
:   ―Miraj Scintel[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159)

When Skywalker, Kenobi, Yularen, and Tano told the Jedi Council of their findings, they were [tasked](/wiki/Mission_to_Zygerria "Mission to Zygerria") with locating the colonists.[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158) On the *Tecora*, and disguised as Zygerrian, they land on the capital city of [Zygerria](/wiki/Zygerria "Zygerria"); splitting into two teams (Kenobi and Rex went to located the colonists), Skywalker and Tano went to meet Queen [Miraj Scintel](/wiki/Miraj_Scintel "Miraj Scintel"), with Skywalker posing as "Lars Quell" and bringing news of [Bruno Denturri](/wiki/Bruno_Denturri "Bruno Denturri")'s supposed death, and presenting Tano as a present. He quickly won Scintel's favor, with the Queen inviting him to accompany her during the slave auction, where she intended to have Skywalker prove himself a slaver by torturing Kenobi.[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159)

Instead, he freed Kenobi and tried to escape with R2-D2 returning their lightsabers, Rex providing cover fire and Tano confronting the Queen. Despite their efforts, however, they were subdued, but Scintel saw Skywalker's determination, for five [electro-whips](/wiki/Electro-whip "Electro-whip") were needed to reduce him. Despite Dooku and half her kingdom demanding his death, Scintel had Skywalker brought to her quarters. There he woke up and interrogated Scintel about his friends' whereabouts, while he throttled the Queen with the Force. However, Scintel gasped that his friends would die unless he obeyed her, and Skywalker was forced to comply and become her bodyguard and escort, just as she became infatuated by him.[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159)

 [![Dooku blasts Skywalker with Force lightning](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/86/Burst_of_Lightning_AtG.png/revision/latest?cb=20181206074916) [![Dooku blasts Skywalker with Force lightning](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/86/Burst_of_Lightning_AtG.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/236?cb=20181206074916)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/86/Burst_of_Lightning_AtG.png/revision/latest?cb=20181206074916) 

Dooku blasts Skywalker with Force lightning

 

After a few days, Dooku would arrive, and Skywalker observed that she too was a slave to the Count, before she left to receive the Sith Lord. With the help of R2-D2, he escaped his guards and freed Tano from her cage and sent her to prep the ship, while he interrogated Scintel to tell him Kenobi and Rex's location. However, he found himself before [Atai Molec](/wiki/Atai_Molec "Atai Molec"), who had betrayed Scintel, and Dooku, with whom Skywalker futilely dueled before Dooku blamed him of killing Scintel before her guards. Skywalker then took Scintel and escaped to the *Tecora*, aboard which she told him Kenobi was in the [Kadavo system](/wiki/Kadavo_system "Kadavo system") and that she, just like Skywalker, was a slave, before dying.[[160]](#cite_note-Escape_from_Kadavo-160)

After contacting Plo Koon to send reinforcements, Skywalker and Tano soon reached [Kadavo](/wiki/Kadavo "Kadavo") and entered the [slave-processing facility](/wiki/Kadavo_slave_processing_facility "Kadavo slave processing facility"). During the [battle](/wiki/Battle_of_Kadavo "Battle of Kadavo") that ensued, Skywalker disabled the turrets that were attacking Koon and his forces, while Tano saved the Togruta colonists from falling to their death (as caused by [Keeper](/wiki/Keeper "Keeper") [Agruss](/wiki/Agruss "Agruss")) by placing Admiral [Barton Coburn](/wiki/Barton_Coburn "Barton Coburn")'s [*Arquitens*-class light cruiser](/wiki/Arquitens-class_light_cruiser "Arquitens-class light cruiser") *[Hand of Justice](/wiki/Hand_of_Justice "Hand of Justice")* underneath the facility. Along with Rex and Kenobi, Skywalker evacuated the facility before it was destroyed on Koon's orders, before returning to the rest of Koon's fleet.[[160]](#cite_note-Escape_from_Kadavo-160)

#### Palpatine kidnapped

:   "*Skywalker, a powerful Jedi you are, yet unpredictable and dangerous you can be, to both your friends and enemies. For Obi-Wan, on your patience, everything depends.*"
:   ―Yoda, to Anakin Skywalker[[161]](#cite_note-The_Box-161)

 [![Skywalker and Tano, searching for Kenobi's "killer"](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/46/SW_and_AT_at_a_bar.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120306152644) [![Skywalker and Tano, searching for Kenobi's "killer"](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/46/SW_and_AT_at_a_bar.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/276?cb=20120306152644)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/46/SW_and_AT_at_a_bar.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120306152644) 

Skywalker and Tano, searching for Kenobi's "killer"

 

After the capture of [Moralo Eval](/wiki/Moralo_Eval "Moralo Eval"), rumored to be the mastermind of a plot to kidnap Supreme Chancellor Palpatine, Skywalker, Tano, and Kenobi were recalled to an emergency meeting by the High Council while they walked through the nightly streets of Coruscant. On their way to the Temple, however, a [sniper](/wiki/Sniper "Sniper") opened fire at them, which prompted the three Jedi to chase their aggressor. However, the sniper killed Kenobi before escaping on a speeder, prompting Skywalker to return to his master, to find Tano crying and his old master dead, whom he called several times trying to get him to respond. Becoming withdrawn and grim, Skywalker would not say a word since then, until after the [funeral](/wiki/Funeral_of_Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Funeral of Obi-Wan Kenobi") held to honor Kenobi, when he went on a self-imposed mission to locate his murderer, [Rako Hardeen](/wiki/Rako_Hardeen "Rako Hardeen"), at [Trueping's](/wiki/Trueping%27s "Trueping's"). Though Skywalker would rather kill him, he arrested Hardeen and ferried him to the Republic Detention Center.[[122]](#cite_note-Deception-122)

After hearing that Hardeen had [escaped](/wiki/Riot_at_the_Republic_Judiciary_Central_Detention_Center "Riot at the Republic Judiciary Central Detention Center") from jail, Skywalker held a meeting with his friend, Palpatine, when Windu informed the Chancellor that they would remove the bounty on Hardeen and the two other escapees, Eval and Cad Bane; a decision did not sit well with Skywalker. Palpatine suggested that the Council perhaps did not trust him to control his feelings, and Skywalker felt the Council was doing nothing to catch the murderer of his master—his best friend. Exploiting this to his advantage, Palpatine told him not to deny his feelings, for they were what made him special, and deliberately sent Skywalker and Tano to [Nal Hutta](/wiki/Nal_Hutta "Nal Hutta"). There, two Jedi harshly interrogated locals for information, which led them to [Orondia](/wiki/Orondia "Orondia"), the fugitives last known location.[[162]](#cite_note-Friends_and_Enemies-162)

After spotting their quarry as they prepare to leave, Skywalker rammed [their ship](/wiki/YV-666_light_freighter "YV-666 light freighter") into submission and board it in midflight, but was foiled by Bane and a subsequent crash-landing of both parties resulting from the chase. Surrounded by smoke, Hardeen left the ship, and Skywalker [confronted](/wiki/Showdown_on_Orondia "Showdown on Orondia") him, ready to kill Hardeen when Bane interrupted him. Hardeen intervened then and wrestled with Skywalker, whispering to Skywalker's ear "Anakin, don't follow me." As he felt a connection, Skywalker passed out, only for Tano to protect him for Bane's attempts to execute him.[[162]](#cite_note-Friends_and_Enemies-162) As they returned to Coruscant, Yoda summoned Skywalker to his chambers and revealed the truth to him—that Kenobi was "Rako Hardeen."[[161]](#cite_note-The_Box-161)

 [![Skywalker and Count Dooku rematch on Naboo.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Theed_banquet_hall.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140117112348) [![Skywalker and Count Dooku rematch on Naboo.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Theed_banquet_hall.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/288?cb=20140117112348)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/04/Theed_banquet_hall.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140117112348) 

Skywalker and Count Dooku rematch on Naboo.

 

Afterwards, Skywalker was briefed along his Padawan about the security plans the Council had for the Chancellor during the [Festival of Light](/wiki/Festival_of_Light "Festival of Light") on Naboo. Skywalker, Tano, and Windu would escort the Palpatine and Mas Amedda to Theed, where Skywalker was greeted by his wife. At the festival itself, the abduction was initially successful with Cad Bane and Moralo Eval ferrying Palpatine away, while Skywalker and Windu captured Embo and [Twazzi](/wiki/Twazzi "Twazzi"); however, Kenobi stopped Eval and Bane, long enough for Windu and Skywalker to arrive and take the two into custody.[[163]](#cite_note-Crisis_on_Naboo-163)

As he reunited with his old master, he voiced his resentment for the Council's lack of trust in him as well as Kenobi's decision to hide the truth from him. Wondering how many other lies he had been told by the Council, he set out on his own to bodyguard Palpatine, who continued to place seeds of doubt in Skywalker until they were greeted by Dooku. After destroying two of his MagnaGuards, Skywalker [dueled](/wiki/Plan_to_kidnap_Chancellor_Palpatine "Plan to kidnap Chancellor Palpatine") the Count with ferocity, until Kenobi arrived to help him rescue the Chancellor, whereas Dooku fled.[[163]](#cite_note-Crisis_on_Naboo-163)

#### A phantom menace

:   "*I sense a disturbance. Something sinister.*"  
    "*All the way out here?*"  
    "*Yes.*"  
    "*Do you know what…or* who *it is?*"  
    "[sigh] *No. But whatever it is, it feels familiar.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker and Ahsoka Tano[[164]](#cite_note-Brothers-164)

Sometime later, when Skywalker and Tano were on their way to rendezvous with a cruiser, they decided to land at the [Stobar Spaceport](/wiki/Stobar_Spaceport "Stobar Spaceport"), as Skywalker was hungry and tired of government rations. The two walked into [Plop Dribble's](/wiki/Plop_Dribble%27s "Plop Dribble's"), only to find [police droids](/wiki/Spaceport_police_droid "Spaceport police droid") and an unconscious [waitress](/wiki/Waiter "Waiter"). Though they attempted to investigate the assault, both the police and its owner, [Loubo](/wiki/Loubo "Loubo"), told not to worry; instead, he offered them a free meal. However, Skywalker sensed a [disturbance in the Force](/wiki/Disturbance_in_the_Force "Disturbance in the Force"), something sinister and familiar—which, unbeknownst to him, heralded the return of the now renegade Sith Lord Maul.[[164]](#cite_note-Brothers-164)

#### Onderon Rebellion

:   "*I feel responsible for them.*"  
    "*I know you do, Snips, but remember, purpose must come before feelings.*"
:   ―Ahsoka Tano and Anakin Skywalker[[165]](#cite_note-The_Soft_War-165)

Following a plea made by a [rebel cell](/wiki/Onderon_rebels "Onderon rebels") on Onderon, the Jedi Council considered how to help them fight the Separatists. Skywalker suggested training the rebels in subversive combat tactics; though it verged on terrorism, which the Jedi would not support, the High Council decided to send advisors to the rebel cell for the upcoming [battle](/wiki/Onderonian_Civil_War "Onderonian Civil War"). On the [*Nu*-class transport](/wiki/Nu-class_attack/transport_shuttle "Nu-class attack/transport shuttle") [*Valkyrie 2929*](/wiki/Valkyrie_2929_(Nu-class) "Valkyrie 2929 (Nu-class)"), Skywalker, Tano, Rex, and Kenobi reached the planet during the night, when they met [Steela Gerrera](/wiki/Steela_Gerrera "Steela Gerrera") and were guided to their rebel secret base, where they met her brother, [Saw](/wiki/Saw_Gerrera "Saw Gerrera"). The team trained the rebels to combat droids, until Separatist [probe droids](/wiki/Probe_droid "Probe droid") discovered their outpost and attacked, which prompted the cell to enter [Iziz](/wiki/Iziz "Iziz").[[166]](#cite_note-A_War_on_Two_Fronts-166)

After some successful operations, Skywalker, Kenobi, and Rex decided to return to Coruscant and report to the Council, while Tano stayed behind as a liaison to the rebels, without revealing herself as a Jedi.[[167]](#cite_note-Front_Runners-167) They kept in frequent communication with her, to provide guidance,[[167]](#cite_note-Front_Runners-167)[[165]](#cite_note-The_Soft_War-165) but also to provide help by hiring Hondo Ohnaka to deliver [missile launchers](/wiki/Missile_launcher "Missile launcher") to the Onderon rebels for the final assault. Skywalker attended the [funeral service](/wiki/Funeral_of_Steela_Gerrera "Funeral of Steela Gerrera") for Steela Gerrera.[[168]](#cite_note-Tipping_Points-168)

#### Losing Satine, saving R2

Skywalker was later present when the Jedi High Council met up with the chancellor to discuss Maul's return, during which they decided to leave him alone even though they knew he was still alive.[[169]](#cite_note-Revival-169) Skywalker lent the *Twilight* to Kenobi, who used it to travel to Mandalore to rescue Satine Kryze. With all its technical problems, after landing on Mandalore, Kenobi vowed not to borrow another ship from Skywalker. However, as he escaped, the ship was shot down by [Mandalorian commandos](/wiki/Mandalorian_super_commando "Mandalorian super commando") and destroyed, moments before Kryze was murdered by Maul during the [Mandalorian civil war](/wiki/Mandalorian_Civil_War_(19_BBY) "Mandalorian Civil War (19 BBY)").[[170]](#cite_note-The_Lawless-170) Skywalker was waiting for Kenobi when the Jedi Master returned to the Temple hangar, where Skywalker saw through Kenobi's attempt to hide his sorrow. Kenobi explained he had lost someone important to him and that he had struggled with his rage, something Skywalker knew all too well. Skywalker offered to come with him for a report to the Council, which Kenobi happily agreed to.[[171]](#cite_note-Kenobi's_Shadow-171)

Skywalker was later present when the Jedi Council sent [Meebur Gascon](/wiki/Meebur_Gascon "Meebur Gascon") and a team of Republic droids to steal an [encryption module](/wiki/Encryption_module "Encryption module") from the Separatists.[[172]](#cite_note-Secret_Weapons-172) Later Skywalker participated in the [Republic strategy conference](/wiki/Republic_strategy_conference "Republic strategy conference") on the [space station](/wiki/Space_station "Space station") [Valor](/wiki/Valor_(space_station) "Valor (space station)"), while on the station he noticed the *[Renown](/wiki/Renown "Renown")* was going a little too fast. Tarkin told Skywalker that they are scanning [Rhydonium](/wiki/Rhydonium "Rhydonium") on the ship, Skywalker instantly realized it was a bomb, Skywalker was later contacted and informed by Gascon of R2's sacrifice. However, Skywalker refused to believe that his friend was gone. He sent out salvage teams to scour the wreckage, who retrieved R2's remains and repaired him. The two reunited, and Anakin was happy to have him back.[[173]](#cite_note-Point_of_No_Return-173)

### Nearing the end

#### Tano's trial

:   "*I know you believe in me, Anakin, and I'm grateful for that. But this isn't about you. I can't stay here any longer, not now.*"  
    "*The Jedi Order is your life. You can't just throw it away like this. Ahsoka, you are making a mistake.*"  
    "*Maybe, but I have to sort this out on my own, without the Council and without you.*"  
    "*I understand. More than you realize, I understand wanting to walk away from the Order.*"  
    "*I know.*"
:   ―Ahsoka Tano and Anakin Skywalker[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174)

 [![Skywalker and Tano were assisted by Russo-ISC in analyzing the crime scene and collecting eyewitness accounts.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/JediAndRusso-S.png/revision/latest?cb=20131026220405) [![Skywalker and Tano were assisted by Russo-ISC in analyzing the crime scene and collecting eyewitness accounts.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/JediAndRusso-S.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20131026220405)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/JediAndRusso-S.png/revision/latest?cb=20131026220405) 

Skywalker and Tano were assisted by Russo-ISC in analyzing the crime scene and collecting eyewitness accounts.

 

During the [defense of Cato Neimoidia](/wiki/Defense_of_Cato_Neimoidia "Defense of Cato Neimoidia"), Skywalker and Tano engaged Separatist forces on their [Eta-2 *Actis*-class interceptors](/wiki/Eta-2_Actis-class_light_interceptor "Eta-2 Actis-class light interceptor"), until they received an urgent mission recalling them to the Jedi Temple. Its hangar had been [bombed](/wiki/Bombing_of_the_Jedi_Temple_hangar "Bombing of the Jedi Temple hangar") and, as the two had been off-world during the attack, Skywalker and Tano were to lead the investigation to uncover the criminal—likely to be a Jedi. As they entered the Temple's hangar, they discussed the possibilities a Jedi was behind the attack. Tano doubted a Jedi could bomb such a sacred location to the Jedi,[[175]](#cite_note-Sabotage-175) and in the process, kill their own colleagues and employees.[[176]](#cite_note-Sabotage_Rewatch-176) However, Skywalker told Tano to keep an open mind, and he reminded her there were Jedi that did not agree with their methods, and went rogue, such as Dooku and Krell. As a result, everyone who was at the Temple during the bombing were potential suspects, including Jedi.[[175]](#cite_note-Sabotage-175)

As Skywalker and Tano walked across the burning hangar, they met [Russo-ISC](/wiki/Russo-ISC "Russo-ISC"), whom Skywalker sent alongside Tano to interview the witnesses, whereas he meditated at the hangar. Unable to discover anything, Skywalker met up with Tano and Russo, who told him about their missing suspect, [Jackar Bowmani](/wiki/Jackar_Bowmani "Jackar Bowmani"). With this clue, Skywalker went to speak with [Chief of Security](/wiki/Chief_of_Security "Chief of Security") [Cin Drallig](/wiki/Cin_Drallig "Cin Drallig"). As Skywalker approached Drallig on the Jedi Temple's steps, he witnessed a crowd of angry protestors, rallying against the Jedi for their violence during the war. After Skywalker showed Drallig the hologram of Bowmani on an [imagecaster](/wiki/Imagecaster "Imagecaster"), [Letta Turmond](/wiki/Letta_Turmond "Letta Turmond") identified Bowmani in the hologram and informed the Jedi she was Bowmani's [wife](/wiki/Marriage "Marriage"). Later Skywalker and Tano cornered Turmond near [her home](/wiki/Jackar%27s_home "Jackar's home"), and she under pressure admitted to feeding Bowmani [nano-droids](/wiki/NM-K_reconstitutor "NM-K reconstitutor") but would not reveal her motives.[[175]](#cite_note-Sabotage-175)

Skywalker was present at [Yoda's eulogy for the six Jedi who died during the explosion](/wiki/Funeral_of_the_Jedi_Temple_bombing_victims "Funeral of the Jedi Temple bombing victims"), and later took the opportunity to speak with Tarkin. Skywalker and his Padawan were then summoned to the war room to be briefed about a Separatist attack on Saleucami, when Tarkin informed them that Turmond had requested to speak with Tano. When she was framed with Turmond's death and imprisoned, he was forbidden to see her, and only returned to track her down on her [escape](/wiki/Escape_from_the_Republic_military_base "Escape from the Republic military base"), following Tano into the pipelines.[[177]](#cite_note-The_Jedi_Who_Knew_Too_Much-177)

 [![Skywalker tries to convince Tano to stay.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/Anakin_and_Ahsoka-TJWKTM.png/revision/latest?cb=20151119055825) [![Skywalker tries to convince Tano to stay.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/Anakin_and_Ahsoka-TJWKTM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/287?cb=20151119055825)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/Anakin_and_Ahsoka-TJWKTM.png/revision/latest?cb=20151119055825) 

Skywalker tries to convince Tano to stay.

 

Alone, they revealed that their trust in each other was absolute, but as Skywalker pleaded for her to surrender herself and make her case to the Council, she refused to take the blame for something she had not done and asked Skywalker to trust her, just as she jumped onto a passing ship, thus escaping to the Coruscant underworld.[[177]](#cite_note-The_Jedi_Who_Knew_Too_Much-177)

As Tarkin declared she was being accused of sedition, Yoda assigned Skywalker and Plo Koon to search for Tano, with some resistance from Windu—who did not believe Skywalker to be emotionally detached to do what had to be done. Nevertheless, when she was [captured](/wiki/Capture_of_Ahsoka_Tano "Capture of Ahsoka Tano"), Skywalker escorted her to the Temple,[[178]](#cite_note-To_Catch_a_Jedi-178) where he was later summoned to the [Chamber of Judgment](/wiki/Chamber_of_Judgment "Chamber of Judgment") along with his Padawan. He was outraged to learn that the Council had already made their decision and that the meeting was simply a formality, and they proceeded to expel her from the Order. Resentful of the Council, he asked his wife, Amidala, to defend Tano at her [trial](/wiki/Trial_of_Ahsoka_Tano "Trial of Ahsoka Tano") before leaving to capture Ventress himself.[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174)

Skywalker soon found and interrogated Ventress, who admitted she was about to turn in Tano to the authorities, until she realized Tano had been abandoned by Skywalker and the Jedi Order, just like she had been forsaken by Dooku.[[139]](#cite_note-Nightsisters-139) She also said that whoever had attacked Tano had stolen [her lightsabers](/wiki/Asajj_Ventress%27s_lightsabers "Asajj Ventress's lightsabers") and that Tano had contacted Barriss Offee for help. Promising to kill Ventress if she lied, Skywalker left for the Temple, where he went to Offee's quarters and questioned her, only to engage her in a [duel](/wiki/Duel_at_the_Jedi_Temple "Duel at the Jedi Temple"). After subduing her, Skywalker brought Offee to the [Republic military base](/wiki/Imperial_Inspectorate_HQ "Imperial Inspectorate HQ") where Tano was being judged. As the [Mirialan](/wiki/Mirialan "Mirialan") Padawan confessed, all charges against Tano were lifted.[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174)

 [![Tano leaving Skywalker and the Order behind](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a1/AhsokaLeavesTheOrder.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140730183031) [![Tano leaving Skywalker and the Order behind](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a1/AhsokaLeavesTheOrder.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20140730183031)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a1/AhsokaLeavesTheOrder.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20140730183031) 

Tano leaving Skywalker and the Order behind

 

Back at the Temple, Skywalker and the Council apologized to Tano and invited her back into the Order, with Skywalker offering her severed [Padawan braid](/wiki/Padawan_braid "Padawan braid"). However, Tano apologized, leaving him in possession of her braid, and declined the offer. As she left the Temple, Skywalker followed her and asked her to reconsider. Tano, however, declared that she felt she could not stay with the Order, due to their lack of trust in her. Despite Skywalker's heartfelt protests and his mentioning that he himself had considered leaving the Order before, she chose to walk away.[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174) Tano's departure had a deep impact on Skywalker, leaving him feeling more alone than ever in bearing the expectations of being the prophesied Chosen One.[[100]](#cite_note-Ultimate_SW-100) The circumstances surrounding her departure also served to intensify his frustration with the High Council, as he felt they had betrayed her by not backing her innocence.[[4]](#cite_note-backstories-4) Without Tano as the counterbalance to his concerns and passions, Skywalker's attentions also focused ever more upon Amidala.[[179]](#cite_note-Skywalker:_A_Family_at_War-179)

#### Kamino conspiracy

:   "*He's in on it! I don't know to what extent. But I know he orchestrated much of this. He told me in the medical bay!*"  
    "*He told you? When you tried to assassinate him? You have gone too far, Fives. The Chancellor isn't capable of what you claim.*"  
    "*He is! I swear to you, General. You've no idea—*"
:   ―Fives and Anakin Skywalker, before being interrupted by the Coruscant Guard[[180]](#cite_note-Orders-180)

A short time after Tano left the Jedi Order,[[181]](#cite_note-FactFile_Kenobi_112-181) Skywalker, alongside Jedi Generals [Tiplar](/wiki/Tiplar "Tiplar") and [Tiplee](/wiki/Tiplee "Tiplee"), and the 501st were sent to [take control](/wiki/Battle_of_Ringo_Vinda "Battle of Ringo Vinda") of [Ringo Vinda](/wiki/Ringo_Vinda "Ringo Vinda")'s [planet-wide station](/wiki/Ringo_Vinda_space_station "Ringo Vinda space station") back from Admiral Trench. Only after seven rotations of stalemated combat, did they manage to push Trench's forces to a breaking point. However, one of Skywalker's troopers, [Tup](/wiki/Tup "Tup"), intentionally killed General Tiplar, forcing Skywalker to order his and Tiplee's troops to fall back. He then had Tup checked out to see if he had been brainwashed by the Separatists, only to find nothing in him, even as he repeated nonstop "Good soldiers follow orders" as well as apparent [amnesia](/wiki/Amnesia "Amnesia"). Though he did not find anything in him, Skywalker had Tup sent to Kamino for further examination.[[182]](#cite_note-The_Unknown-182)

After Tup's shuttle was destroyed and he was taken prisoner by Trench, Skywalker investigated the wreckage. Seeing that Tup was not among the dead, Skywalker decided to infiltrate the Separatist lines. Alongside Rex and Fives, Skywalker reached the Separatists' hangar and saw that Commander [Kraken](/wiki/Kraken "Kraken") had Tup aboard [his shuttle](/wiki/Kraken%27s_Maxillipede_shuttle "Kraken's Maxillipede shuttle"). Skywalker and the others the boarded the shuttle and took out Kraken's crew, including Kraken himself, who refused to reveal why they had abducted Tup. Skywalker then had Tup transported to Kamino with Fives and Rex as escorts.[[182]](#cite_note-The_Unknown-182)

Following the end of Skywalker and the 501st Legion's participation on Ringo Vinda,[[180]](#cite_note-Orders-180) and the death of Tup,[[183]](#cite_note-Conspiracy-183) Skywalker and the High Council were informed by Shaak Ti that Fives [attempted to kill](/wiki/Escape_from_the_Grand_Republic_Medical_Facility "Escape from the Grand Republic Medical Facility") the Chancellor. Windu, aware that the Jedi were not requested to participate in the manhunt, allowed Skywalker and Rex to secretly search for the clone. They soon were contacted by [Kix](/wiki/Kix "Kix"), who told them that Fives wanted to [meet](/wiki/Mission_to_Level_1325 "Mission to Level 1325") the two at a warehouse in [Level 1325](/wiki/Level_1325 "Level 1325"). As Anakin and Rex entered the warehouse, they dropped their weapons on Fives' request. After doing so, they were encircled by a ray shield, which prompted Skywalker to question Fives' actions, but he and Rex listened to the fugitive's side of the story. Skywalker refused to believe that the Chancellor was involved in this conspiracy about the [inhibitor chips](/wiki/Behavioral_modification_biochip "Behavioral modification biochip"), but their conversation was cut short by the arrival of the [Coruscant Guard](/wiki/Coruscant_Guard "Coruscant Guard"). Skywalker watched as they gunned Fives down, dying in Rex's arms.[[180]](#cite_note-Orders-180)

He would report the event to Yoda, Windu, Ti, and the Chancellor, who was swift to lie to the Jedi that all had been the product of a parasite from Ringo Vinda, one that had caused the decay of Fives and Tup's chips; Palpatine urged the Jedi to leave the matter behind, for each day, they grew "closer and closer to victory."[[180]](#cite_note-Orders-180) From that point onward, Skywalker was faced with the fact that Tup and Fives, two of his best men, had died under mysterious circumstances, which became another weight on his emotional health.[[181]](#cite_note-FactFile_Kenobi_112-181)

#### Clovis returns

:   "*Anakin, I understand to a degree what is going on. You've met Satine. You know I once harbored feelings for her. It's not that we're not allowed to have these feelings. It's natural.*"  
    "*Senator Amidala and I are simply friends.*"  
    "*And friends you must remain. As a Jedi, it is essential you make the right choice, Anakin, for the Order.*"
:   ―Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184)

Upon his wife's [mission](/wiki/Mission_to_Scipio "Mission to Scipio") to [Scipio](/wiki/Scipio "Scipio") and subsequent reencounter with Rush Clovis, when she was accused of sabotage and her [aide](/wiki/Aide "Aide") [Teckla Minnau](/wiki/Teckla_Minnau "Teckla Minnau") was killed, Skywalker was sent to protect Amidala, but was upset to hear that Clovis was involved. Nevertheless, he agreed to help her, and together, they went to [Clovis's residence](/wiki/Rush_Clovis%27s_residence "Rush Clovis's residence") to assist in exposing the Banking Clan's corruption. As they were about to depart along with Clovis, Skywalker defended both Senators from the bounty hunter Embo and his pet anooba, [Marrok](/wiki/Marrok_(anooba) "Marrok (anooba)"). The trio were able to escape Embo, thanks to R2-D2, and make their way to Coruscant.[[185]](#cite_note-An_Old_Friend-185) Escorted by Yoda, they met with Palpatine and other members of the Jedi Council, and Senator Bail Organa, during which Skywalker's animosity towards Clovis was perceived by Yoda.[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184)

 [![Skywalker separates Rush Clovis from his wife.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c7/Anakin_about_to_kill_Clovis.png/revision/latest?cb=20151119054533) [![Skywalker separates Rush Clovis from his wife.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c7/Anakin_about_to_kill_Clovis.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/309?cb=20151119054533)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c7/Anakin_about_to_kill_Clovis.png/revision/latest?cb=20151119054533) 

Skywalker separates Rush Clovis from his wife.

 

As Amidala was appointed by the Chancellor to work closely alongside Clovis to investigate the Banking Clan, Skywalker questioned her decision, as he wanted her away from Clovis, whom he greatly distrusted. Though he demanded that she step away from her assignment, she refused and left with Clovis. Frustrated, Skywalker went to his quarters, where Kenobi (at the behest of Yoda) spoke to him, revealing that he was well aware of Skywalker's feelings for Amidala, and asked his former apprentice not to let himself carried away by them before leaving. Later that night, Skywalker went to his wife's apartment, where he found Clovis about to kiss her, for which Skywalker briefly Force choked him—before giving him a one-sided beatdown despite Amidala's protests, willing to kill Clovis in his jealousy.[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184)

Before it was too late, he realized his mistake and stopped, only for Captain Typho to enter. Much to his surprise, Clovis lied about the attack. As they carried Clovis to Amidala's bedroom, Skywalker tried to apologize to his wife, but she told him to stay away from her. Only when they were alone afterward, she questioned their marriage, too steeped in lies and deception, and decided that they take a break from one another after admitting to not feeling safe around Skywalker—who, in turn, admitted to being unable to control himself, even though he did not know why.[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184)

[Clovis](/wiki/Rush_Clovis "Rush Clovis") was accepted as the new head of the Banking Clan by the Senate, and Skywalker confided to the Chancellor of his distrust in Clovis, which Palpatine shared.[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184) Soon, when Clovis apparently joined the Separatists the day after (which Skywalker found strange), and Scipio was occupied by Separatists, Skywalker was then sent to [retake](/wiki/Invasion_of_Scipio "Invasion of Scipio") Scipio. After landing, Skywalker went to [Clovis's office](/wiki/Main_Vault "Main Vault") and tried to reason with Clovis to make him let go of Amidala. At that very moment, though, a vulture droid crashed into the office, making it unstable and causing Amidala and Clovis to fall, but Skywalker grabbed them both, each with one hand. As he could not hold the two, Clovis told Skywalker to let go of him, but he would not; Clovis apologized to Amidala and then let go of Skywalker, falling to his death. Though Skywalker and Amidala reconciled, the Banking Clan came under the control of the Chancellor.[[186]](#cite_note-Crisis_at_the_Heart-186)

#### Sifo-Dyas' secret

:   "*The creation of the clone army, kept secret from us Sifo-Dyas did. How this was done we know not, yet now a new piece of the puzzle we have. Perhaps clarity it will bring us, yes.*"
:   ―Yoda[[187]](#cite_note-The_Lost_One-187)

After Jedi Master Plo Koon intercepted a distress call from a [lost shuttle](/wiki/775519 "775519") and discovered [Sifo-Dyas](/wiki/Sifo-Dyas "Sifo-Dyas")'s lightsaber, its late owner being responsible for the secret creation of the Clone Army. Relaunching the investigation of Sifo-Dyas's death, Skywalker and Kenobi were sent to Felucia, where they spoke to the tribal leaders to find out what happened to the late Jedi Master. Kenobi was told that the Felucians had cremated his body and that another [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") had been with him when he was killed and reported their findings to Master Yoda.[[187]](#cite_note-The_Lost_One-187)

 [![Kenobi and Skywalker's meeting with the leader of the Pyke Syndicate](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/31/EpGuide610.png/revision/latest?cb=20140702093829) [![Kenobi and Skywalker's meeting with the leader of the Pyke Syndicate](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/31/EpGuide610.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/288?cb=20140702093829)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/31/EpGuide610.png/revision/latest?cb=20140702093829) 

Kenobi and Skywalker's meeting with the leader of the Pyke Syndicate

 

The two were then [sent](/wiki/Mission_to_Oba_Diah_(Clone_Wars) "Mission to Oba Diah (Clone Wars)") to [Oba Diah](/wiki/Oba_Diah "Oba Diah") when former Chancellor, [Finis Valorum](/wiki/Finis_Valorum "Finis Valorum") told Yoda that Sifo-Dyas had been [sent](/wiki/Mission_to_Oba_Diah_(Sifo-Dyas) "Mission to Oba Diah (Sifo-Dyas)") to negotiate with the [Pyke Syndicate](/wiki/Pyke_Syndicate "Pyke Syndicate") to stop an underground war. Valorum, however, said that there was no other Jedi sent alongside Syfo-Dyas, but rather his personal aide [Silman](/wiki/Silman "Silman"). On Oba Diah, Kenobi and Skywalker met [Lom Pyke](/wiki/Lom_Pyke "Lom Pyke"), who denied any involvement until Kenobi noticed that he was wearing the crest of Valorum and Skywalker grabbed the necklace and told the [Pyke](/wiki/Pyke "Pyke") to "stop playing games." Lom finally complied with the Jedi, and told them that they had been paid by a man called Tyranus to shoot Sifo-Dyas's shuttle down. However, as they feared that anyone who paid for the death of a Jedi was dangerous, they kept Silman locked away for ten years as insurance.[[187]](#cite_note-The_Lost_One-187)

Once they met Silman, they realized he had gone mad after being locked up for so long, and were unable to learn much from him before Dooku arrived to kill him before Skywalker and Kenobi's eyes. After engaging Dooku in combat, they learned that the man called Tyranus was, in fact, the Count. Although Skywalker pursued the count after he tried to escape on a [Coruscant Freighter](/wiki/Coruscant_Freighter "Coruscant Freighter"), Dooku escaped aboard his [solar sailer](/wiki/Solar_sailer "Solar sailer"), leaving the Jedi without the chance to learn more about the clone army. Nevertheless having learned the identity of Tyranus, they informed the Council of their findings, only for them to question why Dooku had been behind the creation of the clone army, and what the game of the yet-unidentified [Dark Lord of the Sith](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith") was playing.[[187]](#cite_note-The_Lost_One-187)

#### Yoda's journey

:   "*Help me to escape. Yes.*"  
    "*Escape? But you're not in prison.*"  
    "*No, perhaps, but perhaps I am. Already, all around us, the cage may be. A journey I must make alone.*"  
    "*The Council will not want you to travel at all, alone even less.*"  
    "*Disobeying the Council your expertise is. That is why I ask for your help. It is the spontaneity you find so easily which others do not. That is what sets you apart. Now, a walk you will take me on. Come, come.*"
:   ―Yoda and Anakin Skywalker[[143]](#cite_note-Voices-143)

Upon Yoda's brief contact with Qui-Gon Jinn, Yoda requested that Skywalker meet him on the Temple's training grounds to speak about their experience on Mortis, where both he and Kenobi had spoken to Jinn. As Skywalker, too, was in disbelief of the idea that an individual could retain its identity after death, Yoda left him to rest. Later, when Yoda submitted himself for medical examination by Rig Nema, Skywalker informed them that Chancellor Palpatine wanted to hold an emergency meeting with Yoda, to which Windu responded, leaving the Grand Master free to undergo a [deprivation ritual](/wiki/Deprivation_ritual "Deprivation ritual"). Skywalker, Mundi, Kenobi, Koon, and Nema watched over the old master until Kenobi interrupted it before it was too late, and Yoda claimed to have spoken with the dead.[[143]](#cite_note-Voices-143)

With the Council worried for his health, Yoda was placed under the surveillance of [guards](/wiki/Jedi_Temple_Guard "Jedi Temple Guard"), so the Jedi Master asked to Skywalker to see him. Yoda asked Skywalker to help him escape, which Skywalker did. Accompanying Yoda to [his fighter](/wiki/Yoda%27s_fighter "Yoda's fighter"), Skywalker even lent R2-D2 to Yoda to accompany him on a journey that would take him to [Dagobah](/wiki/Dagobah "Dagobah"), a [mysterious planet](/wiki/Wellspring_of_Life "Wellspring of Life") and [Moraband](/wiki/Moraband "Moraband"),[[143]](#cite_note-Voices-143)[[188]](#cite_note-Destiny-188)[[189]](#cite_note-Sacrifice-189) to learn that the Jedi Order would not win the war, and that there was "another Skywalker."[[189]](#cite_note-Sacrifice-189)

#### An Excuse to Fight

After a [skirmish](/wiki/Skirmish_against_Tofen%27s_Raiders "Skirmish against Tofen's Raiders") against [Tofen's Raiders](/wiki/Tofen%27s_Raiders "Tofen's Raiders"), in which Kenobi's starfighter malfunctioned, a Republic fleet was attacked by Separatists. Skywalker and Kenobi were present alongside the young wookiee Viiveenn during the attack. They both argued about who should be the one to join the fight and who should be the one to deliver Viiveenn to safety. When a missile that entered the hangar bay exploded near the three, Skywalker and Kenobi were separated, with Kenobi left with Viiveenn. Skywalker used the wreckage that landed in his way as an excuse to join the fight. As another explosive entered the hangar, Kenobi reluctantly took the wookiee into his starship and told her that Skywalker did that sort of thing all the time.[[190]](#cite_note-Hyperspace_Stories_10-190)

#### Mission to Batuu

##### Alliance with a Chiss "commander"

 [![General Skywalker and "Commander" Thrawn](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/Thrawn_Alliances_Anakin_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20200223163431) [![General Skywalker and "Commander" Thrawn](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/Thrawn_Alliances_Anakin_art.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/248?cb=20200223163431)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/Thrawn_Alliances_Anakin_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20200223163431) 

General Skywalker and "Commander" Thrawn

 

Skywalker was told by Senator Amidala that one of her former handmaidens, [Duja](/wiki/Duja "Duja"), had found something near [Batuu](/wiki/Batuu "Batuu") that she and Skywalker should investigate. Unfortunately, Skywalker was unable to join her due to being sent to battle. Skywalker allowed her to travel to Batuu by herself. Upon his return to Coruscant after the battle, Skywalker could find records of Amidala's travels in the Outer Rim. After another battle, Skywalker received a message that Amidala's ship was found on Batuu. Skywalker, along with [R2-D2](/wiki/R2-D2 "R2-D2"), took his [interceptor](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker%27s_Eta-2_Actis-class_interceptor "Anakin Skywalker's Eta-2 Actis-class interceptor") to Batuu. En route to Batuu, Skywalker encountered a [freighter](/wiki/Freighter "Freighter"). Skywalker spoke with the freighter's captain, [Chiss](/wiki/Chiss "Chiss") [Defense Fleet](/wiki/Chiss_Expansionary_Defense_Fleet "Chiss Expansionary Defense Fleet") Commander [Mitth'raw'nuruodo](/wiki/Mitth%27raw%27nuruodo "Mitth'raw'nuruodo"), known simply as Thrawn.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) Unknown to Skywalker, Thrawn was actually a [Senior Captain](/wiki/Senior_Captain "Senior Captain").[[192]](#cite_note-Chaos_Rising-192) Skywalker accepted Thrawn's assistance in finding Amidala and Duja.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

Skywalker found Amidala's ship near Batuu's [Black Spire Outpost](/wiki/Black_Spire_Outpost "Black Spire Outpost"). There, he stopped a group of smugglers who were angry about the ship being in their landing spot. Skywalker fought them until Thrawn broke up the fight. Together, they investigated Amidala's ship and learned about Duja's ship, Nomad Four. The two then went to a nearby cantina. After speaking with the bartender, Skywalker and Thrawn came under attack by four assailants. The two of them were able to kill the assailants. Thrawn suspected the assailants were sent to kill Skywalker and that there was the fifth nearby. Skywalker and Thrawn came up with a plan to capture the last assailant. After Skywalker took one of the assailant's body, he pretended to suffer engine damage in his interceptor. After landing, Skywalker came under attack by an assassin droid but was to destroy it. Thrawn was able to capture the assailant and found his freighter, which belonged to the Separatists.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

##### Mission to Mokivj

 [![Skywalker investigated his wife's disappearance.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f7/PadmeAmidala-ThrawnAlliancesBNExclusivePoster.png/revision/latest?cb=20180713035357) [![Skywalker investigated his wife's disappearance.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f7/PadmeAmidala-ThrawnAlliancesBNExclusivePoster.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/141?cb=20180713035357)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f7/PadmeAmidala-ThrawnAlliancesBNExclusivePoster.png/revision/latest?cb=20180713035357) 

Skywalker investigated his wife's disappearance.

 

Skywalker and Thrawn took out the droids guarding the freighter. Together, they found out the freighter was headed to [Cermau](/wiki/Cermau "Cermau"). As they returned to Black Spire, they came under attack by several thugs. Thrawn was able to use their speeder, to capture the thugs. Skywalker and Thrawn questioned the cargo inspector [Oenti](/wiki/Oenti "Oenti"), who reveals that the cantina's bartender, [Janott](/wiki/Janott "Janott") had ties to the Separatists' Duke [Solha](/wiki/Solha "Solha"). They learned that they were shipping supplies to a droid [factory](/wiki/Mokivj_droid_factory "Mokivj droid factory"). After learning of Duja's death, Skywalker told Thrawn about the politics behind the Clone Wars. Skywalker and Thrawn traveled to [Mokivj](/wiki/Mokivj "Mokivj"). There, they discovered that the Separatists were mining [Cortosis](/wiki/Cortosis "Cortosis") and discovered a factory.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

Following Skywalker's and Thrawn's location of the factory, and later their change of clothing, Skywalker contacted the duke, to infiltrate the factory and informed him that Captain [Boroklif](/wiki/Boroklif "Boroklif") was indisposed, that there was trouble at Black Spire, and that the he and the others were losing. The Serennian was shocked when he heard this news and asked if the Separatist captain and his companions were dead, to which Skywalker replied that he did not know as he was not there at the end of the battle.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

The Jedi Knight offered the Separatist to bring the cargo he had lost to his factory, Solha accepted and told him he'd open the shield when he was on the coordinates of the courtyard, that he was not stupid and he would not open it until it was truly necessary, just when he was in position to land. Following their arrival, the Jedi Knight and the Chiss commander were hailed by the Serennian duke escorted by a pair of B2-series super battle droids and two squads of B1-series battle droids, who inquired their possession of an astromech droid that belonged to the Republic, R2-D2. In response, the Jedi explained that he had found the droid and believed it could be worth something if he desired to purchase it.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

The Chiss commander and the Jedi Knight asked the Serennian what happened to Amidala's former handmaiden, Duja. They also told him how they acquired Boroklif's ship, the *[Larkrer](/wiki/Larkrer "Larkrer")*, that they came to Mokivj because there was a preset hyperspace course on the ship, the Serennian asked who had put in that course, to which they replied they assumed the Separatist captain did. The duke then warned the pair that they did not have anything else to bargain with and that he could have them shot. However, the pair told them there was another preset hyperspace course locked below the current one, which was locked by a two-stage encryption passcode, and that each of them had one half, Skywalker then presented his Chiss companion as "Brix." The Serennian ordered all of his droids to lower their weapons and to escort them while they entered the factory. The lights went off while the group was entering the building, and the Jedi sliced a droid squad and threw his lightsaber to the top of the building so the duke would not be aware that Skywalker was in fact, a Jedi. Then two B2s blocked the courtyard's opening to prevent any escape.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

Solha knew that there was a Jedi loose on the factory, however, he didn't know who Skywalker was, he then sent Thrawn and Skywalker to some improvised [prison](/wiki/Prison "Prison") cells. Calling the Jedi a [thief](/wiki/Thief "Thief"), the Serennian aimed at Skywalker from the corridor in front of his cell with his blaster, and said that the Jedi wanted to be here and that he got here thanks to Skywalker, and for that alone he should be shot. He then revealed he was the Duke Solha of the Free System of Serenno, to which the Jedi Knight replied if he should be impressed, Solha said he should be, and that he would be at some point. One B2-series super battle droid took all of their weapons and communication devices, even taking Thrawn's small [hold-out blaster](/wiki/Hold-out_blaster "Hold-out blaster") located in his boot. Solha and the droids left with R2, who was dropping [oil](/wiki/Oil "Oil") so Skywalker knew where they had taken him. They left the room and locked the cell's doors.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

The pair agreed on running a test, which would discover if Skywalker's wife had been captured, if she was free or was not on the factory by waiting two [hours](/wiki/Standard_hour "Standard hour") as Amidala, and if she did not join them on the detention block, they would break out and try to locate her. Thrawn asked the Jedi that if he recognized the ship in the courtyard, telling him it was an [ore carrier](/wiki/Ore_carrier "Ore carrier"), which was full of [ore](/wiki/Ore "Ore"), so this was not a [staging ground](/wiki/Staging_area "Staging area") but a manufacturing facility, he also told Skywalker where was there more activity and where was there less activity, as Chiss could see more [infrared](/wiki/Infrared "Infrared") than humans, and he noticed the heat signatures, and that where they were in was the most active section.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

Following the completion of Thrawn's and Skywalker's test, the Chiss crafted a cord from the clothing he got from the *Larkrer* and unlocked their cells from the inside. Meanwhile, the senator had entered the building and was accompanied by a group of locals, consisting of maintenance workers of the factory, [Cimy](/wiki/Cimy "Cimy"), [Huga](/wiki/Huga "Huga"), and [LebJau](/wiki/Nodlia "Nodlia"). They had entered the factory through the service level, which was usually unprotected and only them and the Separatists knew of. Amidala had promised the group a fortune, which would be given to them by her Uncle Anakin if they helped her access the factory. The group later arrived at the detention block, defeated the droid guards and found the Chiss and Jedi Knight inside.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)
