    "*Anakin... I won't leave you. Not this time.*"  
    "*...Then you will* die*.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Ahsoka Tano[[317]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-317)

Afterwards, Vader [dispatched](/wiki/Mission_to_Malachor "Mission to Malachor") the Fifth Brother, the Seventh Sister, and the [Eighth Brother](/wiki/Eighth_Brother "Eighth Brother") to hunt down Maul, who had been stranded on [Malachor](/wiki/Malachor "Malachor") and had been studying its [Sith temple](/wiki/Sith_temple "Sith temple") for years; he himself arrived after Bridger had activated the [superweapon](/wiki/Malachor_superweapon "Malachor superweapon") with the [Sith holocron](/wiki/Sith_holocron "Sith holocron"). With his Inquisitors having all been killed by Maul, Vader chose to personally retrieve the holocron and take possession of the superweapon. Perched on the roof of his TIE Advanced x1, he leaped from the fighter and landed in front of Bridger. After a brief verbal exchange, Vader quickly disarmed the young Jedi by destroying [his lightsaber](/wiki/Ezra_Bridger%27s_lightsaber "Ezra Bridger's lightsaber") and prepared to execute him, but before he could do so, he was interrupted by Ahsoka Tano.[[317]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-317)

 [![Vader duels with his former apprentice, Ahsoka Tano.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/Master_versus_the_apprentice.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160403150039) [![Vader duels with his former apprentice, Ahsoka Tano.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/Master_versus_the_apprentice.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20160403150039)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/Master_versus_the_apprentice.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160403150039) 

Vader duels with his former apprentice, Ahsoka Tano.

 

Vader offered his former apprentice clemency in exchange for the location of any surviving Jedi, but Tano claimed that there were no more Jedi; that Vader and his [Inquisitors](/wiki/Inquisitor "Inquisitor") had [killed](/wiki/Jedi_hunter "Jedi hunter") them all. Skeptical of her claim, Vader obliquely threatened to torture the information out of Bridger instead. This prompted Tano to proclaim in disgust that while she had begun to suspect that Vader and her former master were one and the same, she could no longer believe that due to Vader's cruelty. Vader replied that Skywalker had been weak and that he himself had destroyed her former master. Tano then swore to avenge Skywalker, but Vader reminded her that revenge was not the Jedi way. But Tano no longer considered herself to be a Jedi, and after informing Vader of this, she attacked him. However, she proved ultimately to be no match for her former master who, after several minutes of intense swordplay, used the Force to [blast](/wiki/Force_push "Force push") Tano off a ledge. Believing her to have been neutralized, Vader went to retrieve the holocron.[[317]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-317)

Vader managed to catch up to Jarrus and Bridger before they could board their ship, and used the Force to begin pulling both the holocron and the two Jedi towards him. But before he could seize it, Tano ambushed Vader and managed to slice off the upper right portion of his mask with [her lightsabers](/wiki/Ahsoka_Tano%27s_white_lightsabers "Ahsoka Tano's white lightsabers"). With his mask damaged, Vader's voice filter began to malfunction, causing him to wheeze, and when he next spoke, calling out to his former apprentice, it was in a distorted mixture of his real voice and the mechanical baritone imposed by the filter. This and his partially exposed face confirmed to Tano that Vader was indeed her former master. As the Temple locked down, Tano proclaimed she would not abandon him as she had before. Vader paused at this and stared wordlessly at Tano, seemingly conflicted on how he should respond to his old Padawan. However, he quickly regained his composure and snarled that she would die for her choice. The two engaged in combat once more, while Jarrus and Bridger escaped from the chamber enclosing Vader and Tano.[[317]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-317)

 [![Vader's face beneath his damaged mask](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Then_you_will_die.png/revision/latest?cb=20160507203555) [![Vader's face beneath his damaged mask](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Then_you_will_die.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/272?cb=20160507203555)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Then_you_will_die.png/revision/latest?cb=20160507203555) 

Vader's face beneath his damaged mask

 

After a few moments of battle, locked his blade with Tano's and began to push through her guard. As he prepared to kill her, the energy discharges from the overloading holocron stand suddenly intensified, and Vader glanced up. As he did, a massive blast of power struck the ceiling of the chamber, and Tano used the distraction to push Vader back a step with the Force. She then drove both of her lightsabers into the ground at her feet, causing the floor of the chamber to begin crumbling. Vader quickly recovered from his distraction and aimed a killing stroke at Tano. Unbeknownst to the two combatants, however,[[318]](#cite_note-A_World_Between_Worlds-318) two years later,[[2]](#cite_note-Timelines-2) Ezra Bridger entered the temple on Lothal and found himself in the [World Between Worlds](/wiki/World_Between_Worlds "World Between Worlds") realm, where he was guided to a portal, which exited at the Sith temple[[318]](#cite_note-A_World_Between_Worlds-318) in 3 BBY,[[2]](#cite_note-Timelines-2) by the convor Morai,[[318]](#cite_note-A_World_Between_Worlds-318) the very same bird Vader had seen on the snowy moon outside Tano's crashed Venator.[[277]](#cite_note-Victory_and_Death-277) Bridger witnessed the conclusion of Vader's battle with Tano even as his younger self was locked out of the holocron chamber. As Vader swung his lightsaber at Tano, Bridger reached through the portal and yanked her backward into the temple. As a result, Vader's strike missed and the temple floor crumbled, sending Vader plummeting into a pool of light.[[318]](#cite_note-A_World_Between_Worlds-318)

From Vader's perspective,[[318]](#cite_note-A_World_Between_Worlds-318) a hand had reached from a portal from nowhere[[319]](#cite_note-Alter_Fate-319) to save Tano. Vader survived the fall and managed to make his way back to the surface, where he was watched by Morai.[[317]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-317) After Morai guided Tano[[320]](#cite_note-Artist_series_3-320)—who escaped back to her place in time after Sidious reached into the World Between Worlds[[318]](#cite_note-A_World_Between_Worlds-318)—through the depths of the temple[[320]](#cite_note-Artist_series_3-320)[[321]](#cite_note-Artist_series_7-321) to reach another portal to the World Between Worlds,[[322]](#cite_note-Artist_series_10-322) the convor exited the temple and flew out, with Vader watching the bird from the surface.[[323]](#cite_note-Artist_series_9-323) Believing Tano dead, Vader departed Malachor and returned to his duties in the Empire. Tano's supposed demise marked the end of the Great Jedi Purge.[[324]](#cite_note-Odyssey-324)

#### Continued rebellion

In [2 BBY](/wiki/2_BBY "2 BBY")[[2]](#cite_note-Timelines-2) and shortly after the Empire's [victory](/wiki/Batonn_insurgency "Batonn insurgency") over the [Batonn sector insurgency](/wiki/Batonn_sector_insurgency "Batonn sector insurgency"), Vader arrived at the Imperial Palace on Coruscant and was introduced to the newly promoted [Grand Admiral](/wiki/Grand_Admiral "Grand Admiral") Thrawn, the very same Chiss officer he had met during the Clone Wars, by the Emperor. When Thrawn stated he was pleased to finally meet the Dark Lord, Vader claimed to feel the same.[[325]](#cite_note-Thrawn_novel-325) A short time later in 2 BBY,[[2]](#cite_note-Timelines-2) amid Thrawn's [ongoing campaign](/wiki/Lothal_campaign "Lothal campaign")[[326]](#cite_note-Secret_Cargo-326) to root out and destroy the growing rebel threat,[[327]](#cite_note-Steps_Into_Shadow-327) the rebellious senator of [Chandrila](/wiki/Chandrila "Chandrila"), Mon Mothma, formally rallied numerous rebel cells together under a single banner, the [Alliance to Restore the Republic](/wiki/Alliance_to_Restore_the_Republic "Alliance to Restore the Republic").[[326]](#cite_note-Secret_Cargo-326) Fulfilling the fears of Imperials like Tarkin[[309]](#cite_note-Call_to_Action-309) and Thrawn,[[327]](#cite_note-Steps_Into_Shadow-327) once disconnected rebel cells began to act as a unified force,[[326]](#cite_note-Secret_Cargo-326) marking an official beginning point to the [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War"),[[328]](#cite_note-POV_203-328) although true open warfare would not break out for sometime still.[[329]](#cite_note-In_the_Name-329)

During the Galactic Civil War era, stormtrooper lieutenant [TK-289](/wiki/TK-289 "TK-289") served with Vader.[[330]](#cite_note-FDMSP_Asmodee-330) During or after 2 BBY,[[331]](#cite_note-Hard_Shutdown_Date-331) at some point after the Alliance was formed, Darth Vader was lured to HS-197, an abandoned ore-mining moon in the Horox system, by Cyn, the son of Sig Sendvall, a cyberneticist who had worked on Vader’s suit.[[332]](#cite_note-Hard_Shutdown-332) At another point in that time frame,[[333]](#cite_note-Power_Date-333) on an unidentified astronomical object, Vader accompanied stormtroopers in their search for a Rebel fugitive. As the troopers destroyed a village to frighten its inhabitants, the Sith Lord interrogated Noegaud, a local bully. A youngling named Niko, whom Noegaud often harassed, witnessed this interaction, leading him to conclude that Noegaud was correct in his belief that the only thing that mattered was power.[[334]](#cite_note-Power-334)

Vader once destroyed Blue Squadron, a diaspora of X-wings and A-wings, in his TIE Advanced x1. The Sith Lord then landed, engaging DF.9 turret emplacements and Rebel infantry before bringing down the *Vellus*, the GR-75 medium transport that the starfighter escort had been protecting. Only one Rebel was left standing, who Vader promptly killed.[[335]](#cite_note-Annihilated-335)

#### Investigating a disturbance

:   "*Anakin Skywalker is dead.*"  
    "*I know.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Grand Admiral Thrawn[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

 [![Darth Vader was teamed with Grand Admiral Thrawn to look into a disturbance felt around where the two had first met decades prior.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/44/Thrawn_Alliances_cover_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20201003175022) [![Darth Vader was teamed with Grand Admiral Thrawn to look into a disturbance felt around where the two had first met decades prior.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/44/Thrawn_Alliances_cover_art.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201003175022)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/44/Thrawn_Alliances_cover_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20201003175022) 

Darth Vader was teamed with Grand Admiral Thrawn to look into a disturbance felt around where the two had first met decades prior.

 

Vader and Thrawn crossed paths on Coruscant once more after Thrawn suffered a strategic [defeat](/wiki/Battle_of_Atollon "Battle of Atollon") on [Atollon](/wiki/Atollon "Atollon").[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) Although the battle had been a tactical victory, a number of rebels had escaped the Grand Admiral after the [Bendu](/wiki/Bendu "Bendu") appeared.[[336]](#cite_note-Zero_Hour-336) As a result of allowing the rebels to slip through his grip, Vader now held a disdain for the Grand Admiral. Though during this meeting, the two were ordered by the Emperor to the planet Batuu to locate a disturbance in the Force that the Emperor had sensed. While Thrawn brought his own forces on board his Star Destroyer, the *[Chimaera](/wiki/Chimaera "Chimaera")*, Vader brought a contingent of his personal stormtroopers from the 501st Legion, the [1st Legion](/wiki/1st_Legion "1st Legion") with him to assist in tracking down this disturbance at the edge of known space.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

During their mission, they [combated](/wiki/Imperial%E2%80%93Grysk_conflict "Imperial–Grysk conflict") the [Grysk](/wiki/Grysk "Grysk") species and learned the disturbance was caused by a group of young Chiss Force-sensitives known as, to the surprise of Vader, the "[Sky-walkers](/wiki/Sky-walker "Sky-walker")." Afterward, Vader came to doubt Thrawn's loyalty to the Empire because of the threats growing against the Chiss in the Unknown Regions. While Thrawn managed to deduce that Skywalker and Vader were one in the same, the Grand Admiral came to think of Vader as being a separate person mentally and that his old ally Skywalker was dead. After telling Thrawn to ensure he kept his promise to the Emperor by ordering him to stay in Imperial space instead of leaving to save his people, Vader came to respect Thrawn's [TIE/d "Defender" Multi-Role Starfighter](/wiki/TIE/d_%22Defender%22_Multi-Role_Starfighter "TIE/d \"Defender\" Multi-Role Starfighter") project, stating he would speak on its behalf to Palpatine and suggesting upgrades for the craft.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) On Batuu, Vader's presence near Black Spire was spoken of by locals, with rumors of the legendary Imperial enforcer's visit to Batuu being spoken of for years to come.[[337]](#cite_note-TGTB-337)

#### Submission to Ahr

:   "*You* hate *it. Every time you* kneel*. Even before* me*.* Good*. But this bureaucrat* knows *his sector, Lord Vader. With his* knowledge*, we will* subdue *it. So in* my *service…you will obey the governor's* every order*…to the* letter*…until you have* learned *your* lesson*.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Darth Vader[[259]](#cite_note-Age_of_Rebellion-259)

During the Empire's efforts to [subdue](/wiki/Pacification_of_the_Esuain_sector "Pacification of the Esuain sector") anti-Imperial forces in a [Mid Rim sector](/wiki/Esuain_sector "Esuain sector") under Imperial Governor [Ahr](/wiki/Ahr "Ahr"), Vader participated in an [attack](/wiki/Attack_on_Namzor "Attack on Namzor") on the planet [Namzor](/wiki/Namzor "Namzor"), where he eliminated a group of [insurgents](/wiki/Namzor_insurgents "Namzor insurgents"). In the process, he destroyed the rebels' stores of [coaxium](/wiki/Coaxium "Coaxium"), violating the command of Ahr, who was charged with securing the hyperfuel. The governor brought his frustrations to the Emperor. Sensing Vader's anger, the Emperor commanded his apprentice to follow any and all orders from the governor until Vader had learned his lesson.[[259]](#cite_note-Age_of_Rebellion-259)

 [![Darth Vader single-handily defeats a Rebel fortress.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/13/VaderOnPhelzepham-AORDarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200206053311) [![Darth Vader single-handily defeats a Rebel fortress.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/13/VaderOnPhelzepham-AORDarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/214?cb=20200206053311)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/13/VaderOnPhelzepham-AORDarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200206053311) 

Darth Vader single-handily defeats a Rebel fortress.

 

Ahr took great pleasure in his newfound power, sending Vader on increasingly dangerous missions throughout his [sector](/wiki/Esuain_sector "Esuain sector"). He sent Vader to [fight](/wiki/Attack_on_Ahn_Krantarium "Attack on Ahn Krantarium") alone against the renegade droids of [Ahn Krantarium](/wiki/Ahn_Krantarium "Ahn Krantarium"), and later retracted his forces on [Phelzepham](/wiki/Phelzepham "Phelzepham"), leaving Vader to [battle](/wiki/Attack_on_Phelzepham "Attack on Phelzepham") the moon's [insurgents](/wiki/Phelzepham_insurgents "Phelzepham insurgents") by himself. Though he wished to kill the governor, Vader continued to obey Ahr's commands.[[259]](#cite_note-Age_of_Rebellion-259)

Governor Ahr brought his [ship](/wiki/Ahr%27s_Venator-class_Star_Destroyer "Ahr's Venator-class Star Destroyer") to the [Kankalo Belt Containment Zone](/wiki/Kankalo_Belt_Containment_Zone "Kankalo Belt Containment Zone"), an [asteroid field](/wiki/Asteroid_field "Asteroid field") in which a [great creature](/wiki/Unidentified_creature_(Kankalo_Belt_Containment_Zone) "Unidentified creature (Kankalo Belt Containment Zone)") resided. He commanded Vader to eliminate "the greatest threat" he could find. Seeing an opportunity, Vader confronted Ahr, recognizing him as his true threat. Before Vader could strike, Ahr ordered the Dark Lord to kneel before him. Vader obeyed, but the creature attacked the vessel, pulling the governor out into the void of space and freeing Vader from his submission.[[259]](#cite_note-Age_of_Rebellion-259)

#### Cianap

:   "*Vader to command. Minor system malfunction. I can't fly it back through the battle. Landing on the planet for repairs. End this swiftly or suffer the consequences.*"
:   ―Darth Vader radios in from his TIE fighter[[338]](#cite_note-Dark_visions_1-338)

 [![Vader rode the Cianap riding creature to fight the Ender.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/VaderHorse-VaderDarkVisions1.png/revision/latest?cb=20200914223204) [![Vader rode the Cianap riding creature to fight the Ender.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/VaderHorse-VaderDarkVisions1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200914223204)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/VaderHorse-VaderDarkVisions1.png/revision/latest?cb=20200914223204) 

Vader rode the Cianap riding creature to fight the Ender.

 

Vader led Imperial forces at [Cianap](/wiki/Cianap "Cianap") in a [battle](/wiki/Battle_above_Cianap "Battle above Cianap") against the rebels. During the battle, Vader was targeted by several X-wings but was able to take them out. However, his TIE was damaged when one purposely crashed into him and was forced to crash land on Cianap. Vader then exited his TIE and awoke an [Ender](/wiki/Ender "Ender") from its [Slumber](/wiki/Slumber "Slumber"). The Ender then tried to kill Vader; however, he stabbed one of the Ender's eyes out and tried to cut its back open, only for the Ender to grab him. Vader started to slice the Ender's fingers, but the Ender pushed him into a building and dropped him. The Ender then started to go after a [native](/wiki/Unidentified_Cianap_native "Unidentified Cianap native"), but Vader rode a [creature](/wiki/Unidentified_Cianap_riding_creature "Unidentified Cianap riding creature") and saved the native from the Ender. Vader then decapitated the Ender, finally killing it. The native thanked Vader, who then returned to his TIE and was taken aboard a Star Destroyer via tractor beam.[[338]](#cite_note-Dark_visions_1-338)

#### An unwelcome romance

:   "*Darth Vader to the bridge. Come get this garbage out of my quarters.*"
:   ―Darth Vader, upon killing the nurse[[339]](#cite_note-Dark_Visions_3-339)

At some point, Vader had arrived at the Death Star, and made his way to his personal medical bay. As he made way, he barged through a medical cart being tended to by a [nurse](/wiki/Unidentified_Imperial_nurse "Unidentified Imperial nurse"), who was flustered due to her infatuation with Vader. Vader underwent treatment from a [doctor](/wiki/Unidentified_Imperial_doctor "Unidentified Imperial doctor") while in the medical bay, but became angered when the nurse from the prior encounter entered the medical bay as Vader was putting his helmet back on. In his anger, Vader force pushed the doctor into the wall, demanding that he control the medical bay or be replaced. The nurse, however, saw Vader's anger as reciprocation of her feelings for him, misconstruing his actions as protection of her. After his bout of rage, Vader exited the medical bay, admonishing the doctor as he attempted to excuse why the appointment had taken so long. The nurse, upon being told to clean up the medical bay, instead stole pieces of Vader's armor as a keepsake, storing it among other discarded pieces of Vader's armor, as well as a vial of his blood.[[339]](#cite_note-Dark_Visions_3-339)

 [![An obsessive nurse imagined herself in a romance with Darth Vader.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/VaderDarkVisions3-CoverArt.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250807083048) [![An obsessive nurse imagined herself in a romance with Darth Vader.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/VaderDarkVisions3-CoverArt.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250807083048)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/VaderDarkVisions3-CoverArt.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250807083048) 

An obsessive nurse imagined herself in a romance with Darth Vader.

 

A proceeding incident resulted in Vader crash landing on the Death Star in his TIE Advanced x1. Vader made his way to the medical bay once more, demanding the nurse to call in the doctor. The nurse briefly aided Vader, perceiving the moment as intimate, before the doctor himself returned, ordering the nurse to leave as he tended to Vader instead. Vader, impatient, cut his appointment short, leaving to rejoin his prior battle. However, Vader had left his cape behind, which the nurse proceeded to steal and take to her quarters. After the doctor discovered her, he dumped the bits of Vader's armor into the trash compactor. Driven mad, the nurse walked into Vader's quarters, which he had left unlocked out of a belief that no one would enter. Upon seeing the nurse enter his chambers, a helmetless Vader simply stared at her as she confessed her infatuation with him. Momentarily after, Vader stabbed the nurse with his lightsaber, killing her. Vader then put his helmet back on and exited his quarters, contacting the bridge and ordering them to remove her corpse.[[339]](#cite_note-Dark_Visions_3-339)

#### Hunting the Hidden Hand

On the orders of the Emperor, Vader attacked and killed three lower-level clans working for the [Hidden Hand](/wiki/Hidden_Hand "Hidden Hand"), a crime syndicate known to sell weapons to the Rebellion. He then attacked the [Lower Bay Docks](/wiki/Lower_Bay_Docks "Lower Bay Docks") on [Fikari](/wiki/Fikari "Fikari"), killing most there, questioning the Weequay [Holaq](/wiki/Holaq "Holaq") about the whereabouts of the Hidden Hand. Holaq told Vader that none of them would know where the Hidden Hand was. Detailing the way they maintained secrecy, he pled with Vader to believe him. Vader replied that he did and blew up the docks, killing him. He then reported the failure to Palpatine over hologram, who reiterated the importance of taking down the Hidden Hand. The [Tarsunt](/wiki/Tarsunt "Tarsunt") [Gwi](/wiki/Gwi "Gwi"), who worked for the crime syndicate, overheard this conversation, and hired a [team](/wiki/Beilert_Valance%27s_crew "Beilert Valance's crew") to [hunt down and kill Darth Vader](/wiki/Hunt_for_Vader "Hunt for Vader"). At some point, Vader learned of this plot and traveled to the [Dark Quarter](/wiki/Dark_Quarter "Dark Quarter") on [Yuw](/wiki/Yuw "Yuw") to kill bounty hunters and find answers.[[340]](#cite_note-Target_Vader_1-340) Later, the captain of the bounty hunter team, Beilert Valance, amplified a signal near [Arvina](/wiki/Arvina "Arvina"), disguising it as a Hidden Hand signal. Vader arrived on a Star Destroyer in response and it fired on the city below. He then got into his TIE fighter and chased after Valance's team. Their sniper, the Rebel agent [Gita](/wiki/Gita "Gita"), currently disguised as the Tusken Raider "Urrr'k", managed to shoot down two of Vader's support TIEs. This gave the team enough time to escape, leaving Vader to investigate the damage in the city below. Valance had planned to leave data banks behind that would reveal the Hidden Hand's secret outposts, allowing him to get the jump on Vader. However, an informant of Vader's within the crew revealed the bounty hunters' next destination.[[341]](#cite_note-Target_Vader_2-341)

 [![Darth Vader was subject to an assassination attempt by Beilert Valance and his crew during his hunt for the Hidden Hand.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/82/KillDarthVader-TargetVader3.png/revision/latest?cb=20240519151752) [![Darth Vader was subject to an assassination attempt by Beilert Valance and his crew during his hunt for the Hidden Hand.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/82/KillDarthVader-TargetVader3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240519151752)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/82/KillDarthVader-TargetVader3.png/revision/latest?cb=20240519151752) 

Darth Vader was subject to an assassination attempt by Beilert Valance and his crew during his hunt for the Hidden Hand.

 

Vader followed them to a [Hidden Hand outpost](/wiki/Heva_Hidden_Hand_outpost "Heva Hidden Hand outpost") on [Heva](/wiki/Heva "Heva") aboard the *[Formidable](/wiki/Formidable "Formidable")*. Upon arriving, an [Imperial general](/wiki/Unidentified_Imperial_general_(Formidable) "Unidentified Imperial general (Formidable)") informed Vader that Valance's ship, the *[Broken Wing](/wiki/Broken_Wing "Broken Wing")*, had been located, and that their informant had gone silent. Vader abruptly told the general to scramble all fighters, much to the general's confusion. Valance's crew had begun remotely piloting a fleet of [bot-drones](/wiki/Bot-drone "Bot-drone") towards the *Formidable*. Vader got into his TIE fighter and pursued the drones as well as the *Broken Wing*. He shredded the drone fleet, but the drones started to pull away. Vader told his pilots to stay on the leader, as he took out its laser cannons. The drones then formed a large cannon that fired, destroying the *Formidable*. Despite this Vader stayed locked on the *Broken Wing*, taking out its engines and causing it to crash-land. Vader landed his TIE fighter and entered the ship, lightsaber drawn. After finding the ship empty, he stood on the roof. [Dengar](/wiki/Dengar "Dengar") and [Honnah](/wiki/Honnah "Honnah"), both members of Valance's crew, fired on the TIE fighters near Vader's ship and destroys them. Vader looks in their direction as the bounty hunters takes aim.[[295]](#cite_note-Target_Vader_3-295) However, Valance had a plan that involved an [electro-pulse](/wiki/Electro-pulse "Electro-pulse"), an [E.M.P.](/wiki/Electromagnetic_pulse "Electromagnetic pulse") device that only worked on contact, so they withheld their fire. Vader used the force to kick up dust around him so that the bunty hunters didn't have a straight shot. One of the bounty hunters, Chio Fain, charges and shoots at him. Vader blocks his fire as well as fire from the other bounty hunters. Fain continued to fight Vader, intent on avenging his partner Rone. As the [Ardennian](/wiki/Ardennian "Ardennian") taunted him, Vader chopped his arms off. Fain then asked Vader how good he was against a [Gamorrean battle-ax](/wiki/Gamorrean_war_ax "Gamorrean war ax"), to which Honnah started to attack. Dodging the [Gamorrean](/wiki/Gamorrean "Gamorrean")'s swings, Vader took a hit from Fain, using his last remaining arm to fire at him. Vader then used the force to push Fain into Honnah's battle-ax, killing him. After taking a shot from Gita, Vader incapacitated her and killed Honnah. Valance took the opportunity and tried to stick the electro-pulse to Vader but was unable to. He was then shocked by Dengar, who had in actuality been working for the Empire and had been Vader's informant.[[307]](#cite_note-Target_Vader_4-307)

 [![Darth Vader let Valance go so that he would lead him to the Hidden Path's outpost.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/89/ValanceChorinReturn-TargetVader5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191204142211) [![Darth Vader let Valance go so that he would lead him to the Hidden Path's outpost.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/89/ValanceChorinReturn-TargetVader5.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20191204142211)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/89/ValanceChorinReturn-TargetVader5.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191204142211) 

Darth Vader let Valance go so that he would lead him to the Hidden Path's outpost.

 

Vader brought Valance on his Star Destroyer *[Vengeance](/wiki/Vengeance "Vengeance")* along with Dengar. He gave the bounty hunter his reward and asked abut the Hidden Hand. Dengar said that he had told Vader everything he knew, and that Valance would not tell him anything more. Vader dismissed him and told him that he knew where to find him, if the Empire ever required his services again. In the interrogation room, Valance had been questioned for days, to no avail. Vader arrived, dismissed interrogation staff and started torturing Valance for answers until he passed out. Once awake, Valance escaped his constraints and killed two guards. Exiting out using their armor and weapons, he was greeted by his ship and Vader. Vader took him to [Chorin](/wiki/Chorin "Chorin") and Valance told him how both he and the Empire failed to protect Chorin, creating the Hidden Hand. Vader told him that what remained of his people would be safe. Knowing his history as an Imperial cadet, Vader welcomed him back to the Empire.[[296]](#cite_note-Target_Vader_5-296)

Valance was able to locate the [Hidden Hand's hideout](/wiki/Hidden_Hand_asteroid_base "Hidden Hand asteroid base") and lead Vader and his troops there. Vader fought through the Hidden Hand's forces until reaching its leader. Gwi, the Tarsunt that initially hired Valance to kill Vader, was now held at gunpoint by him. Vader used the force to lift Gwi to safety, he was ordered to bring the Emperor's prize to him alive. As stormtroopers dragged Gwi away, Vader detailed to the Tarsunt how he and each member of his cabal would be hunted and killed. He then asked a stormtrooper to bring him Valance. When the trooper told him that Valance was missing, Vader force choked him and sent troops to Chorin to raze [Valance's settlement](/wiki/Unidentified_village_(Chorin) "Unidentified village (Chorin)") and kill everyone in it. When troops arrived, all the inhabitants had been evacuated. Valance had successfully escaped Vader and saved his people.[[342]](#cite_note-Target_Vader_6-342)

#### Another attempt to resurrect Padmé

:   "*She was almost within reach. Now she is lost to me again—because of you!*"
:   ―Darth Vader, to the Corvax descendent[[343]](#cite_note-Vader_VR_3-343)

Despite his previous failure to restore his wife, Vader was eventually tempted to try again when he discovered the [Aeon Engine](/wiki/Aeon_Engine "Aeon Engine") and with it the tale of Lady [Corvax](/wiki/Corvax "Corvax"), who had attempted to restore her husband to life when he fell in battle using the most sacred artifact in Mustafar, [Bright Star](/wiki/Bright_Star "Bright Star"), to power the Engine. Although the process was a failure, Vader, believing Corvax failed due to her lack of power, was confident that if he could get the Bright Star, he could successfully use the Bright Star and the Aeon Engine, and thus made efforts to find the Bright Star, but discovered Lady Corvax had protected her devices so only those with her blood could access it.

 [![Darth Vader talked with the Black Bishop about the Bright Star and how it could give him the ability to resurrect Padmé.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/VaderBlackBishop-VaderImmortal.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240519155219) [![Darth Vader talked with the Black Bishop about the Bright Star and how it could give him the ability to resurrect Padmé.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/VaderBlackBishop-VaderImmortal.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240519155219)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/ba/VaderBlackBishop-VaderImmortal.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240519155219) 

Darth Vader talked with the Black Bishop about the Bright Star and how it could give him the ability to resurrect Padmé.

 

Undeterred, Vader searched for any survivors in Lady Corvax's bloodline, which he eventually discovered with the help of Imperial Admiral [Gable Karius](/wiki/Gable_Karius "Gable Karius") use an Interdictor vessel to pull a starship named [Windfall](/wiki/Windfall "Windfall") out of hyperspace above Mustafar and capture the smuggler who was [the descendant](/wiki/Corvax_descendant "Corvax descendant") he had been looking for. Vader proceeded to demand the smuggler to open a configuration box to confirm their relation to Lady Corvax, and once they succeeded, Vader left with a reminder that he would need their services later. He communicated with the [Black Bishop](/wiki/Dorwin_Corvax "Dorwin Corvax"), who had been his ally in his search for the Aeon Engine, where they discussed about how the Bright Star would give Vader the incredible powers needed to even resurrect the dead and that with Corvax's descendant in his grasp, the final component needed to achieve his goals was now Vader's. Dismissing the Bishop once he sensed Padmé's soul echo through the Aeon Engine, Vader let out a wail of fury and sorrow once she quickly disappeared after announcing her pregnancy. Catching up to the smuggler and the [ZO-E3](/wiki/ZO-E3 "ZO-E3") in their attempts to escape, Vader tossed aside the droid before getting the smuggler to open the lock to the sanctum beneath his fortress. Successful in activating the lift to access the lower levels of Fortress Vader where his ultimate prize lay, his Stormtroopers were killed by a number of [ancient droids](/wiki/Corvax_Sentinel "Corvax Sentinel"), but Vader and the smuggler swiftly cut down the droids before he confiscated the smuggler of their lightsaber and telling them that they had handled their own well. Seeing that the smuggler needed training in the ways of the Force, Vader decided to provide instruction to the smuggler.[[30]](#cite_note-Vader_VR_1-30)

Reaching the inner sanctum of [Corvax Fortress](/wiki/Corvax_Fortress "Corvax Fortress"), Vader demonstrated the power of the Force on a nearby broken statue while proclaiming the Force as powerful beyond their imagination, as it "discloses the enigmas that will cause the fragile and broken to turn away in horror and agitation", and could grant them access to the secrets of both life and death, and that the smuggler had power, but would need to learn more about the Force to overcome the challenges ahead. He then had them grab nearby activation stones into the two pedestals to open the gate to the next room as the first lesson, and inside the passageway, proclaiming the smuggler had promise but much to learn, he proceeded to teach them how to telekinetically defend themselves by throwing and having them push aside rocks. Seeing the smuggler had glimpsed the power of the Force, Vader decided to resume their training later and viewed a message left behind by Lady Corvax for one of her descendants, dismissing Lady Corvax's plea to fix her mistake as her never understanding the true extent of that which she had created. Treading down the pathway, the third test for the smuggler came when they came across a large room populated by nests of [Lava nymphs](/wiki/Lava_nymph "Lava nymph"), Vader demanding them to tap into the [dark side](/wiki/Dark_side_of_the_Force "Dark side of the Force") and exterminate the vermin. Unimpressed by their difficulties in doing so, Vader stated their abilities were hardly acceptable and lacking in much regards. but before he could work on the Smuggler more, activating the pedestal with a key caused a large portion of the floor begins to break apart, and despite Vader's efforts to keep the Smuggler under his watch, lifting up the floor, a [darkghast](/wiki/Darkghast "Darkghast") attacked him, forcing him to let go of the Smuggler to fight the creature. Despite the separation, Vader caught up to the Smuggler just as they had retrieved the Bright Star with a tipoff from the Mole. Seeing that the Smuggler had intended to backstab him, Vader beat them to the punch, retrieved the Bright Star, and left them and their friends stranded on the cave after coldly making it clear their betrayal meant nothing as they had outlived their usefulness.[[344]](#cite_note-Vader_VR_2-344)

Placing the Bright Star on the Aeon Engine, Vader began the ritual to resurrect Padmé, determined to save his wife at the cost of everyone else, willing to even sacrifice other planets if necessary. Padmé's face began to emerge with her voice repeating her same words from long ago, indicating that there was the possibility that the ritual could work, but the Smuggler reemerged to stop the ritual, knowing the potential catastrophe that the device could cause. Although surprised by the smuggler's survival, Vader believed it didn't matter, and engaged his brief apprentice in a duel as he vowed that he would succeed where Lady Corvax had failed. As the smuggler managed to resist Vader's attacks, the Bright Star's energies coalesced, finally causing a bluish projection of Amidala in full-bodied form to appear, as she began to utter some of the last words that Vader had heard her tell him long ago. Vader then paused the duel in its tracks, holding the smuggler in a choke hold, as he realized that their presence was affecting the Aeon Engine. However, it was too late as her projection faded. Realizing the ritual had failed, Vader became furious, blaming his failure on the smuggler, and proceeded to easily overpower him. However, before he could kill his opponent, the Black Bishop intervened, stopping Vader temporarily and giving the smuggler the opening needed to destroy the Aeon Engine. By the time Vader was free, he could only beheld the Engine's destruction in horror, and before he could strike down the smuggler, the Engine exploded, sending the two far away from one another.[[343]](#cite_note-Vader_VR_3-343)

#### Downed by Red Four

During a [battle](/wiki/Unidentified_battle_(Darth_Vader) "Unidentified battle (Darth Vader)"), Vader's ship was downed when an X-wing intentionally crashed into it. Using the callsign [Red Four](/wiki/Red_Four "Red Four"), [Micha](/wiki/Micha "Micha")'s sacrifice is momentarily thought to have killed the Dark Lord, that is until Vader emerges from the wreckage alive. He activated his lightsaber, facing the Rebel troops.[[345]](#cite_note-Red_Four-345)

#### Visit on Mustafar

:   "*Be careful not to choke on your aspirations, Director.*"
:   ―Darth Vader to Orson Callan Krennic — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/47/Vader-BeCareful.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250406161030)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:Vader-BeCareful.flac "File:Vader-BeCareful.flac"))[[346]](#cite_note-Rogue1-346)

 [![Vader Force-choking Orson Krennic](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/Vader_Force_choking_Krennic.png/revision/latest?cb=20170908082755) [![Vader Force-choking Orson Krennic](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/Vader_Force_choking_Krennic.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/311?cb=20170908082755)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/Vader_Force_choking_Krennic.png/revision/latest?cb=20170908082755) 

Vader Force-choking Orson Krennic

 

When Ezra Bridger managed to enter the [World Between Worlds](/wiki/World_Between_Worlds "World Between Worlds"), he heard Anakin Skywalker's voice when he was on Christophsis. Vader's voice was then heard telling an individual to not underestimate the power of the dark side.[[318]](#cite_note-A_World_Between_Worlds-318) As had been suggested by Grand Admiral Thrawn[[347]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Treason-347) shortly before his, the *Chimaera*'s, and Bridger's disappearance in the [Liberation of Lothal](/wiki/Liberation_of_Lothal "Liberation of Lothal"),[[258]](#cite_note-Family&Farewell-258) Vader served as part of the Death Star project despite his dislike of the battle station,[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) as Thrawn had noted he was the one individual in the Empire who could recognize and deal with all threats to the station. Thrawn had also used this appointment to force [Assistant Director](/wiki/Assistant_Director "Assistant Director") [Brierly Ronan](/wiki/Brierly_Ronan "Brierly Ronan") to join the Chiss Ascendancy, as this Imperial official would not have been able to hide his contempt for the Emperor from the Sith Lord.[[347]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Treason-347)

Shortly after the [destruction](/wiki/Destruction_of_Jedha_City "Destruction of Jedha City") of [Jedha City](/wiki/Jedha_City "Jedha City"), while floating in the tank, Vader was approached by his servant [Vaneé](/wiki/Vane%C3%A9 "Vaneé"). He informed Vader that [Director](/wiki/Director "Director") Krennic, the Imperial in charge of the construction of the Death Star, had arrived as summoned to explain a number of recent problems involving the battle station. The most pressing of these problems was the discovery that Galen Erso, an engineer who had played a pivotal role in the creation of the Death Star's superlaser, had been a traitor and that there was a distinct possibility that he had leaked information about the weapon to the Rebellion.[[346]](#cite_note-Rogue1-346)

 [![Vaneé approaching Vader's bacta tank](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/63/Vanee-RogueOne4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20210807181956) [![Vaneé approaching Vader's bacta tank](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/63/Vanee-RogueOne4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20210807181956)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/63/Vanee-RogueOne4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20210807181956) 

Vaneé approaching Vader's bacta tank

 

Krennic had been recently informed by Governor Tarkin that he was no longer in command of the Death Star project, and was keen to impress upon Vader his need for an audience with the Emperor, ostensibly to discuss the weapon's destructive capabilities. Vader instead chastised Krennic for the destruction of [Jedha](/wiki/Jedha "Jedha") City, the city where the Empire had been mining the kyber crystals needed for the Death Star's primary weapons systems to function. Krennic attempted to shift the blame for the city's destruction to Tarkin, but Vader was unmoved. He informed Krennic that the [Imperial Senate](/wiki/Imperial_Senate "Imperial Senate") had been told that Jedha had been destroyed in a mining disaster and that the Death Star did not exist. He then impressed upon the director in no uncertain terms that he was to make certain that Galen Erso had not compromised the Death Star in any way. Taking this as confirmation from Vader that he was still in command of the project, Krennic began to ask Vader if he would speak to the Emperor on his behalf. But before he could finish his question, Vader cut him off by telekinetically closing his throat, with a sardonic warning to not "choke" on his aspirations.[[346]](#cite_note-Rogue1-346)

#### Stolen plans

:   "*The rebel flagship is disabled, my Lord. But it has received transmissions from the surface.*"  
    "*Prepare a boarding party.*"
:   ―[Shaef Corssin](/wiki/Shaef_Corssin "Shaef Corssin") and Darth Vader[[346]](#cite_note-Rogue1-346)

 [![Darth Vader on the Profundity](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/54/VaderProfundity.png/revision/latest?cb=20230213210357) [![Darth Vader on the Profundity](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/54/VaderProfundity.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/303?cb=20230213210357)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/54/VaderProfundity.png/revision/latest?cb=20230213210357) 

Darth Vader on the *Profundity*

 

Shortly afterwards, [Rebel spies](/wiki/Rogue_One "Rogue One") [attacked](/wiki/Battle_of_Scarif "Battle of Scarif") the [Imperial security complex](/wiki/Imperial_Center_of_Military_Research "Imperial Center of Military Research") on the planet Scarif, stole the [technical readouts](/wiki/Death_Star_plans "Death Star plans") of the Death Star, and transmitted a copy to the Rebel flagship *[Profundity](/wiki/Profundity "Profundity")*. As the Rebels began to flee to hyperspace, Vader arrived at the scene of the battle in the [Star Destroyer](/wiki/Imperial_I-class_Star_Destroyer "Imperial I-class Star Destroyer") *[Devastator](/wiki/Devastator "Devastator")* and quickly crippled the already damaged Rebel flagship. He and a small group of stormtroopers then boarded the vessel and began searching for the plans. As the Rebel crew began to evacuate the *Profundity*, a small group of [Rebel troopers](/wiki/Rebel_trooper "Rebel trooper") copied the Death Star schematics onto a data disk and attempted to board the [Corellian corvette](/wiki/CR90_corvette "CR90 corvette") *[Tantive IV](/wiki/Tantive_IV "Tantive IV")* and escape. Mere meters away from one of the corvette's airlocks, the *Profundity* experienced a power loss, jamming an automatic door in the path of the Rebel soldiers.[[346]](#cite_note-Rogue1-346)

Unable to get the door to open more than a few centimeters, the Rebels were intercepted by Vader,[[346]](#cite_note-Rogue1-346) who unleashed his fury[[348]](#cite_note-221_Launchpad-348) in the enclosed space to slaughter the helpless Rebels. As Vader reached the trooper with the plans, the Rebel managed to pass the data disk to a [compatriot](/wiki/Toshma_Jefkin "Toshma Jefkin") of his behind the door before Vader impaled him and telekinetically wrenched the door open. While Vader finished eliminating the remaining soldiers, the trooper to whom the plans had been passed dove through the open airlock to the *Tantive IV*, and the Rebels managed to launch the ship mere moments before Vader was able to board it. Once the ship was away, the plans were given to Vader's estranged daughter, Princess Leia Organa, who had been tasked by her adoptive father to find Obi-Wan Kenobi on Tatooine.[[346]](#cite_note-Rogue1-346)

#### Pursuing the plans

:   "*I don't know what you're talking about. I'm a member of the Imperial Senate on a diplomatic mission to Alderaan.*"  
    "*You are part of the Rebel Alliance, and a traitor! Take her away!*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Leia Organa[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

 [![Darth Vader boards the Tantive IV over Tatooine.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/50/TributetoStarWars-Vader-boards.png/revision/latest?cb=20230207001152) [![Darth Vader boards the Tantive IV over Tatooine.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/50/TributetoStarWars-Vader-boards.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230207001152)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/50/TributetoStarWars-Vader-boards.png/revision/latest?cb=20230207001152) 

Darth Vader boards the *Tantive IV* over Tatooine.

 

Despite their daring escape, the Rebels aboard the *Tantive IV* did not get far. After failing to capture the plans aboard the *Profundity*, Vader had immediately re-boarded the *Devastator* and pursued the Rebel corvette. The *Devastator* intercepted the *Tantive IV* in orbit above Tatooine, and quickly disabled and captured it. Vader and his troops boarded the ship, killing many Rebel troopers and gaining complete control of the blockade runner. Vader interrogated its captain, [Raymus Antilles](/wiki/Raymus_Antilles "Raymus Antilles"), before killing him for not revealing the location of the plans. Vader's troops captured the princess, but not before she placed the plans inside R2-D2 and sent him in an escape pod to the planet's surface. Although the Princess tried to use her diplomatic immunity as a member of the Imperial Senate, Vader had her arrested as a rebel and a traitor.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

As she was escorted to the *Devastator*,[[349]](#cite_note-TPtSatFB-349) Vader was informed that an escape pod had been jettisoned during the fighting but that no life forms were aboard. Believing that the Princess had hidden the plans there, Vader sent a battalion to Tatooine to recover the plans while he took the Princess to the Death Star for interrogation.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) In hyperspace, Vader would catch Organa when she had escaped her guards and made her way to one of the *Devastator*'s shuttles, and announced that the Emperor was disbanding the Senate as they spoke, leaving her defenseless. Vader then had her follow him to the ship's bridge shortly before arriving at the Death Star, where he had her sent to her [cell](/wiki/Cell_2187 "Cell 2187") in [Detention Block AA-23](/wiki/Detention_Block_AA-23 "Detention Block AA-23").[[349]](#cite_note-TPtSatFB-349)

Meanwhile, Vader accompanied Tarkin to attend a meeting with the [Joint Chiefs](/wiki/Joint_Chiefs_of_the_Imperial_Military "Joint Chiefs of the Imperial Military"), including General [Cassio Tagge](/wiki/Cassio_Tagge "Cassio Tagge") and Admiral [Conan Antonio Motti](/wiki/Conan_Antonio_Motti "Conan Antonio Motti"), who mocked Vader's reliance on an "ancient religion," only to have Vader Force-choke him. Before he could kill him, Tarkin intervened and instructed Vader to find the location of the Rebel base from Organa. Subsequently, Vader went to torture her with a [mind probe](/wiki/Mind_probe "Mind probe")-equipped [interrogator droid](/wiki/Interrogation_droid "Interrogation droid"), but as she resisted, he and Tarkin turned to coercion—by bringing the Death Star to the [Alderaan system](/wiki/Alderaan_system "Alderaan system"), they threatened to destroy her homeworld if she refused to disclose the location of the Rebel base. Eventually, she told him that the Rebels were on Dantooine, yet Tarkin ordered Alderaan to be destroyed anyway, to make an effective demonstration of the Death Star's power. Vader restrained the Princess as the Death Star's [superlaser](/wiki/Superlaser "Superlaser") [destroyed](/wiki/Destruction_of_Alderaan "Destruction of Alderaan") her planet.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) Vader then took Organa back to her cell to await her execution.[[349]](#cite_note-TPtSatFB-349)

### Enter Luke Skywalker

#### Duel on the Death Star

:   "*I've been waiting for you, Obi-Wan. We meet again at last. The circle is now complete. When I left you, I was but a learner. Now* I *am the Master.*"  
    "*Only a master of evil,* Darth*.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Obi-Wan Kenobi, before their fourth and final duel[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

After the [scout](/wiki/Scout "Scout") ships sent to Dantooine found the base abandoned, Tarkin ordered Vader to kill her immediately, but the *[Millennium Falcon](/wiki/Millennium_Falcon "Millennium Falcon")* was captured in the ruins of Alderaan by the Death Star's tractor beam. Identified as a suspicious ship from [Mos Eisley](/wiki/Mos_Eisley "Mos Eisley"), Vader concluded that they were trying to return the stolen plans to the Princess and went to inspect the freighter himself. Told that the crew had apparently abandoned ship after take-off, Vader gave orders for the ship to be scanned to be sure. At the same time, Vader sensed the presence of his old master, Obi-Wan Kenobi. When news reached him that the Princess had been [released](/wiki/Rescue_of_Princess_Leia "Rescue of Princess Leia") from her cell, Vader decided to confront Kenobi alone.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

 [![Vader strikes down his former master and friend, Kenobi.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/11/Vaderstrike.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105354) [![Vader strikes down his former master and friend, Kenobi.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/11/Vaderstrike.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/248?cb=20201008105354)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/11/Vaderstrike.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105354) 

Vader strikes down his former master and friend, Kenobi.

 

Vader found Kenobi after he had deactivated a tractor beam terminal to allow the *Falcon* escape the battle station, and the two engaged in one final duel. During the fight, Vader noted that Kenobi's age had made him weak. However, Kenobi told his former apprentice that he would not win because he would become more powerful than Vader could ever imagine, even if he managed to kill him. As they fought, the two reached Bay 327 just as Kenobi's companions and the Princess reunited to board the *Falcon*, only for Kenobi to see his latest apprentice, Luke Skywalker, Vader's son.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

As his former master gave him a mysteriously knowing smile, Vader struck him down when Kenobi raised his blade in surrender. Much to Vader's surprise, Kenobi's body disappeared, for his spirit had become one with the Force, and Vader tried to find remains in his robes but found none.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) As he did so, General [Moradmin Bast](/wiki/Moradmin_Bast "Moradmin Bast") asked who he was, and Vader answered "An old man who thought he could help gifted children. He was mistaken."[[350]](#cite_note-DV1-350) Vader then tried to stop the Rebels from escaping but was prevented from doing so by the closing of the hangar doors by Luke's shot. After the *Falcon*'s escape, Vader met with Tarkin and confirmed that a [homing beacon](/wiki/Homing_beacon "Homing beacon") had been placed upon the ship and that they could follow the ship to the Rebel base.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

Kenobi's warning to Vader came true;[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) his consciousness survived his death, and he became a [Force spirit](/wiki/Force_spirit "Force spirit"). Meanwhile, still remaining hidden on [Dagobah](/wiki/Dagobah "Dagobah"), Yoda felt Kenobi and Vader's duel through the Force, especially noticing, for the first time, the loneliness in the man who had once been Anakin Skywalker. Yoda noticed that Vader's loneliness only grew after he struck down his former mentor, which nearly made Yoda pity the former Jedi and wish he could counsel him. As he continued his journey, Yoda reflected on his past, blaming himself for not noticing Skywalker's path to the dark side.[[351]](#cite_note-There_is_Another-351)

#### Yavin 4

:   "*The Force is strong with this one.*"
:   ―Darth Vader, about Luke Skywalker during the Battle of Yavin[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

Vader's plan worked and the Death Star followed the *Falcon* to the hidden Rebel base on [Yavin 4](/wiki/Yavin_4 "Yavin 4"). In the [Death Star's conference room](/wiki/Death_Star_conference_room "Death Star conference room"), Vader awoke Tarkin from a vision about [his father](/wiki/Wilhuff_Tarkin%27s_father "Wilhuff Tarkin's father") just as the battle station approached [Yavin Prime](/wiki/Yavin_Prime "Yavin Prime"), with an officer informing them that Yavin 4 was located on the far-side of the planet.[[352]](#cite_note-THoGMT-352) As the Death Star prepared to destroy the moon, Rebel [X-wings](/wiki/T-65B_X-wing_starfighter "T-65B X-wing starfighter") and [Y-wings starfighters](/wiki/BTL-A4_Y-wing_assault_starfighter/bomber "BTL-A4 Y-wing assault starfighter/bomber") [attacked](/wiki/Battle_of_Yavin "Battle of Yavin") the Death Star, having identified a weakness: a [thermal exhaust port](/wiki/Thermal_exhaust_port "Thermal exhaust port") which led to the reactor systems; a direct hit on the port would cause a chain reaction and the destruction of the station. Although Tarkin remained convinced in the station's invulnerability, Vader was informed[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) by Lieutenant [Tanbris](/wiki/Tanbris "Tanbris")[[353]](#cite_note-Spacecraft_Origami-353) that the thirty attacking Rebel starfighters were small enough to avoid the turbolaser defenses. As such, Vader ordered fighters to launch. When [Gold Squadron](/wiki/Gold_Squadron_(Rebel_Alliance) "Gold Squadron (Rebel Alliance)") broke off from the main group and begun a trench run towards the exhaust port, Vader boarded his TIE Advanced and, flanked by two TIE fighters, managed to terminate three of the last four Gold Squadron pilots. He continued to destroy most ships of [Red Squadron](/wiki/Red_Squadron_(Rebel_Alliance) "Red Squadron (Rebel Alliance)"), killing [Red Leader](/wiki/Red_Leader "Red Leader") [Garven Dreis](/wiki/Garven_Dreis "Garven Dreis").[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

 [![Vader in his TIE Advanced x1 during the Battle of Yavin](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/Death_star_trench.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017141806) [![Vader in his TIE Advanced x1 during the Battle of Yavin](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/Death_star_trench.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/279?cb=20201017141806)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b2/Death_star_trench.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017141806) 

Vader in his TIE Advanced x1 during the Battle of Yavin

 

As the last members of Red Squadron engaged in a trench run while the Death Star was preparing the destroy the moon, Vader damaged [Wedge Antilles](/wiki/Wedge_Antilles "Wedge Antilles")'s X-wing, forcing him to break off formation, and killed [Biggs Darklighter](/wiki/Biggs_Darklighter "Biggs Darklighter"), leaving only the leader of the group, Luke. Vader quickly realized that the Force was powerful in the young pilot, but nevertheless proceeded to get him into range. When he finally succeeded, he was just about to destroy the young pilot when the newly arrived *Millennium Falcon* intervened and destroyed one of Vader's escorts. Before the *Falcon* could destroy Vader, his other escort accidentally bumped into Vader's craft, destroying the other escort and causing Vader's craft to veer off course and send him plunging into space. This prevented him from stopping the Death Star's destruction, which killed Tarkin and was a major defeat for the Empire.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)

 [![Vader is picked up by Ciena Ree and Berisse Sai.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/VaderAboardGozanti.png/revision/latest?cb=20191016064458) [![Vader is picked up by Ciena Ree and Berisse Sai.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/VaderAboardGozanti.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/204?cb=20191016064458)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e7/VaderAboardGozanti.png/revision/latest?cb=20191016064458) 

Vader is picked up by Ciena Ree and Berisse Sai.

 

Shortly after the battle, Vader sent a distress signal to the *Devastator* to send a ship to pick him up and bring him back from the [Yavin system](/wiki/Yavin_system "Yavin system") to the Star Destroyer. Sometime later, he would fly just beyond the ever-expanding debris field that once was the Death Star, when Imperial pilots [Ciena Ree](/wiki/Ciena_Ree "Ciena Ree") and [Berisse Sai](/wiki/Berisse_Sai "Berisse Sai") arrived in a [*Gozanti*-class cruiser](/wiki/Gozanti-class_cruiser "Gozanti-class cruiser"). Docking his TIE Advanced x1 with the freighter, Vader passed through the airlock door and met Ree. Then, he ordered Ree and Sai to remain in the hold for the remainder of the voyage while he took command of the freighter until they returned to the *Devastator*.[[354]](#cite_note-LS-354) As the rebels quickly [abandoned their base](/wiki/Evacuation_of_Yavin_4 "Evacuation of Yavin 4") in the wake of the battle,[[355]](#cite_note-Princess_Leia_1-355) Vader joined the Imperial retaliatory attack, but the rebels were largely able to escape.[[356]](#cite_note-Legends_Alliance-356) Vader ordered for a [blockade of the Yavin system](/wiki/Blockade_of_the_Yavin_system "Blockade of the Yavin system") to begin at one point.[[357]](#cite_note-Republic,_Rebel,_and_Resistance_Encyclopedia-357)

#### Post-Yavin ventures

Sometime later, an Imperial officer managed to obtain one of two [lightsabers](/wiki/Darth_Atrius%27_lightsabers "Darth Atrius' lightsabers") formerly owned by the Sith [Darth Atrius](/wiki/Darth_Atrius "Darth Atrius"). Vader arrived on [Hradreek](/wiki/Hradreek "Hradreek"), where the officer welcomed him, supported by a contingent of stormtroopers. Vader looked at the lightsaber and asked where the other one was. The officer was confused by his question, and Vader Force-choked him. As he gagged, he claimed that he bought the lightsaber from a smuggler and that she must have tricked him. Vader told a stormtrooper to divert all divisions to finding the smuggler and the other lightsaber. Vader then killed the officer as the stormtroopers scattered to begin the search.[[358]](#cite_note-SW_annual_4-358)

A squad of stormtroopers found the smuggler, [Sana Starros](/wiki/Sana_Starros "Sana Starros"), and they chased her down the streets. Starros paid a gang of [Aqualish](/wiki/Aqualish "Aqualish") to stall them, and they got in the way of the stormtroopers. However, Vader appeared and cut them down using his lightsaber and Darth Atrius'. Vader then followed Starros' path to a cargo bay, and he used the Force to move the crates and block her from a clear exit. Starros then shot at Vader, and he used the Force to disperse the plasma bolts. Starros rigged one of the crates and then waited for Vader to follow before detonating it, throwing Vader to the side and burying him. Vader soon freed himself and made his way to the nearby podracing track. Vader entered the seating area, and the audience scattered at his presence. Vader noticed one of the podracers, who was grabbing the attention of the commentary. The human, despite being biologically unequipped for a race like this, was winning the race, and Vader used the Force to cause one of the engines to malfunction, crashing the podracer. The pilot of the racer was none other than Luke Skywalker, who had obtained the other of Atrius' lightsabers. Luke decided to destroy the lightsaber, as it overwhelmed him with anger whenever he needed it. Vader watched him escape in his X-wing, and he decided to crush Atrius' other lightsaber.[[358]](#cite_note-SW_annual_4-358)

According to a tale later told by Vaneé, at another point after the Battle of Yavin, Vader's Star Destroyer was contacted by [Cranwell](/wiki/Cranwell "Cranwell"), the assistant to [Tarkin Initiative](/wiki/Tarkin_Initiative "Tarkin Initiative") scientist [Restin](/wiki/Restin "Restin"), to warn them that Doctor Restin had betrayed the Empire. Restin, who wanted a weapon to use against Vader as revenge for the destruction of Alderaan, had created a [genetic serum](/wiki/Gamorrean_Serum "Gamorrean Serum") that would turn those injected with it into rampaging Gamorreans, who could then spread the infection by touch. Vader decided to deal with Restin himself, so he arrived at Restin's base of operations with two stormtroopers and pretended to not know he was a traitor. After witnessing the doctor turn Cranwell into a Gamorrean with the serum, Vader suggested the serum could be used against the Rebellion. When Restin turned the infected Gamorrean against the Sith Lord, he effortlessly lifted it and his infected stormtroopers into the air with the Force. He did the same with Restin, forcing the scientist to confess his treachery before revealing he had already known he was a traitor. Intending to be a firsthand witness to his destruction, Vader forced the three Gamorreans and Restin to touch, transforming the doctor into one of his creations. Leaving the infected scientist to the mercy of the Gamorreans, Vader left aboard his *Lambda*-class shuttle. He had never feared Restin's experiments, as Vader already viewed himself as a different kind of monster.[[226]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_Vader's_Castle-226)

#### Cymoon 1

:   "*He's here. The Rebel pilot who destroyed the Death Star. I can feel his presence. He will not escape me again.*"
:   ―Darth Vader[[359]](#cite_note-SW1-359)

Several weeks after the Battle of Yavin, Darth Vader was called to [Weapons Factory Alpha](/wiki/Weapons_Factory_Alpha "Weapons Factory Alpha") on [Cymoon 1](/wiki/Cymoon_1 "Cymoon 1"). He was to [negotiate](/wiki/Assault_on_Cymoon "Assault on Cymoon"), or rather force an arrangement with an envoy of Jabba the Hutt about supplying raw materials through [Hutt-controlled space](/wiki/Hutt_Space "Hutt Space") to the factory. Vader arrived shortly after the envoy (secretly the *Millennium Falcon*'s captain, [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo")) and landed on a platform. As he was about to enter the facility, Vader was shot at by a sniper, [Chewbacca](/wiki/Chewbacca "Chewbacca"), but he deflected the blaster bolt and used two stormtroopers as human shields as the Wookiee rained down dozens of shots upon him. Unscathed, Vader located Chewbacca's position and used to the Force to collapse his vantage point, but the Wookiee survived.[[359]](#cite_note-SW1-359)

 [![Vader easily bests Luke Skywalker in combat.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/VaderBestsLuke-2015StarWars2.png/revision/latest?cb=20160430044241) [![Vader easily bests Luke Skywalker in combat.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/VaderBestsLuke-2015StarWars2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/302?cb=20160430044241)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/VaderBestsLuke-2015StarWars2.png/revision/latest?cb=20160430044241) 

Vader easily bests Luke Skywalker in combat.

 

Vader then ordered the arriving stormtrooper reinforcements to hunt him down. One of them informed the Dark Lord that [Overseer](/wiki/Overseer "Overseer") [Aggadeen](/wiki/Aggadeen "Aggadeen") was out of contact and the factory's main reactor was on meltdown. As he surmised these occurrences were the work of Rebels, Vader put the entire moon on alert but also felt the presence of the pilot who had destroyed the Death Star, Luke Skywalker. Although unaware of the boy's identity, Vader made his way into the factory at once and came face-to-face with the Jedi apprentice.[[359]](#cite_note-SW1-359) Vader soon realized that the boy had been cursorily trained by Kenobi, and after the briefest of duels, snatched Luke's lightsaber. As he prepared to execute Luke for his refusal to disclose information about the Rebellion, he realized that the boy's lightsaber had once been his own. Before he could question Luke further, the foot of a Rebel-hijacked [AT-AT walker](/wiki/All_Terrain_Armored_Transport "All Terrain Armored Transport") came hurtling down into the middle of their standoff, knocking the two apart.[[360]](#cite_note-SW2-360)

In the ensuing chaos, Vader sought to prevent the Rebels' escape, and mowed down the factory's runaway slaves, commanding his stormtroopers to execute all the escapees. Once Luke got away on a stolen [74-Z speeder bike](/wiki/74-Z_speeder_bike "74-Z speeder bike") and attacked Vader's troops (leading the Dark Lord to reconsider his initial dismissal of the boy and wonder exactly what Kenobi had been up to before his death), Vader personally saw to the walker's defeat. Solo and Organa, commanding the AT-AT, tried to step on him, but Vader used the Force to hold the walker's descending foot several meters above his head, and almost tore it apart.[[360]](#cite_note-SW2-360)

 [![Vader brings the AT-AT to its knees.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4e/VaderDestroysWalker-2015StarWars3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150317050158) [![Vader brings the AT-AT to its knees.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4e/VaderDestroysWalker-2015StarWars3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/247?cb=20150317050158)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4e/VaderDestroysWalker-2015StarWars3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150317050158) 

Vader brings the AT-AT to its knees.

 

He was foiled, however, when Solo and Organa unleashed a barrage of the AT-AT's laser fire upon him, causing him to lose his old lightsaber (which the current owner retrieved), and his mask and helmet. As he emerged from under a pile of rubble, a [stormtrooper](/wiki/Unidentified_stormtrooper_(Cymoon_1) "Unidentified stormtrooper (Cymoon 1)") approached; upon seeing Vader's scarred face, they tried to apologize. However, Vader killed them by twisting their head around using the Force, right before Aggadeen reached him via comlink and asked for the facility's evacuation. Vader vetoed his request, had him repair the core, and ordered to kill all the Rebel invaders, except for the boy, whom Vader would deal with personally.[[360]](#cite_note-SW2-360) As Aggadeen informed him that they had successfully defused the reactor, Vader personally felled the Rebel walker by slashing its legs with his lightsaber.[[361]](#cite_note-SW3-361)

As reinforcements arrived, Vader sent them after the Rebels on the trash fields, while he pursued the lone Rebel who was returning to the factory, Luke. Aboard a [combat speeder](/wiki/Imperial_combat_speeder "Imperial combat speeder"), Vader chased Luke into the facility, but the Rebel managed to destroy the power core with the speeder bike, leaving Vader as the only survivor among the factory's rubble following its explosion. The Sith Lord then saw Luke's abandoned speeder and the fleeing *Millennium Falcon*; as the *[Adjudicator](/wiki/Adjudicator "Adjudicator")*'s captain, [Kronn](/wiki/Kronn "Kronn"), informed him that they had been unable to catch the freighter, Vader Force-choked the captain. Then, as if he were talking to Kenobi, Vader vowed to find the boy's identity and to turn him to the dark side, so that the boy became his weapon, and not Kenobi's.[[361]](#cite_note-SW3-361)

#### Yavin's aftermath

:   "*But you are the only one living to suffer my anger. You, an isolated survivor of the greatest military disaster in all my Empire's history? Oh, you are truly the Chosen One, Lord Vader. Chosen to be the one responsible.*"  
    "*I will make it right. I will crush the Rebels.*"  
    "*No. I think not.*"
:   ―Sidious and Vader discuss Vader's failings[[350]](#cite_note-DV1-350)

Thereupon, Vader returned to the Imperial Palace on Coruscant to report to the Emperor, bringing Aggadeen with him. The Emperor bid Vader to explain the events of Weapons Factory Alpha, which along with the Death Star's destruction, had put the Empire very near disaster. Although Vader considered Aggadeen to be responsible for the failure on Cymoon 1 (and the Overseer was tortured accordingly), the Emperor claimed much of the responsibility lay in Vader's head, as he reminded him that he was the sole survivor of the greatest disaster in the Empire's history—one partially caused by his idea to tag the *Falcon* with a homing beacon and let it escape with the Death Star plans. He then informed Vader that Cassio Tagge, now [Grand General](/wiki/Grand_General "Grand General") of the [Imperial Army](/wiki/Imperial_Army "Imperial Army"), would be his commanding officer for some time.[[350]](#cite_note-DV1-350)

 [![Vader angrily leaves his master and the agent, Cylo-IV.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/PalpatineVaderCylo-2015DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160707051520) [![Vader angrily leaves his master and the agent, Cylo-IV.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/PalpatineVaderCylo-2015DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/287?cb=20160707051520)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/PalpatineVaderCylo-2015DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160707051520) 

Vader angrily leaves his master and the agent, Cylo-IV.

 

The Emperor then ordered Vader to continue the unfinished Cymoon 1 negotiations with Jabba the Hutt on Tatooine, right before going to Tagge. As they returned to his office, Sidious greeted one of his agents, Cylo, and Vader asked for his identity, but the Emperor denied him the knowledge. Instead, he asked Vader if there was anything else to report, but Vader chose not to tell him about Kenobi's mysterious disappearance, nor the Force-sensitive Rebel pilot who had destroyed the Death Star and left the office and palace altogether. He boarded an Imperial Star Destroyer and immediately left for Tatooine, sending the Imperial vessel back to collect the trade goods for the meeting.[[350]](#cite_note-DV1-350)

#### Tatooine negotiations

:   «*Hmmm. I see you know enough to tread carefully. But tell me... are you brave or foolish.*»  
    "*That is not the question, Hutt. The question is: Are you?*"  
    «*Oh, Jedi... always making everything so difficult.*»
:   ―Jabba the Hutt and Darth Vader[[350]](#cite_note-DV1-350)

Vader soon arrived at Jabba's Palace where, during the meeting, he had the Hutt dismiss his court. However, Jabba would rather claim the bounty on Vader's head and had his people shoot at him, but Vader killed them and forced Jabba to reconsider his position. After being Force choked, the Hutt admitted he found it hard not to respect him. The two then came to an agreement: Jabba would provide Vader with two of his best bounty hunters. Vader left the Hutt's palace and sought out a [Tusken Raider camp](/wiki/Unidentified_Tusken_Raider_village "Unidentified Tusken Raider village"), wherein he mercilessly slaughtered its inhabitants. He was then approached by Jabba's envoys: Boba Fett and [Krrsantan](/wiki/Krrsantan "Krrsantan"). While he sent Fett to find and capture the [Rebel pilot](/wiki/Rebel_pilot "Rebel pilot") from Yavin alive, Vader assigned the Wookiee to bring Palpatine's agent to him. Both [mercenaries](/wiki/Mercenary "Mercenary") agreed, and Vader departed Tatooine for his Star Destroyer.[[350]](#cite_note-DV1-350)

 [![Vader and Jabba on the latter's sail barge](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3d/VaderAndJabbaOnKhetanna-2015StarWars4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160707051825) [![Vader and Jabba on the latter's sail barge](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3d/VaderAndJabbaOnKhetanna-2015StarWars4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/226?cb=20160707051825)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/3d/VaderAndJabbaOnKhetanna-2015StarWars4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160707051825) 

Vader and Jabba on the latter's sail barge

 

The following day, Vader returned in his official capacity as the Emperor's envoy to negotiate as if nothing had happened the day before. Jabba welcomed Vader and claimed that his resources belonged to the Empire as long as he was paid. Vader then turned to leave, leaving his stormtroopers to tell Jabba what was required, but the Hutt invited him to a feast and entertainment in his honor, for he liked to seal his business ventures by watching someone die. Aboard the [sail barge](/wiki/Sail_barge "Sail barge") *[Khetanna](/wiki/Khetanna "Khetanna")*, Vader and Jabba watched as the latter's guards killed wild [banthas](/wiki/Bantha "Bantha") for the sport until Jabba's court [jester](/wiki/Jester "Jester"), [Salacious B. Crumb](/wiki/Salacious_B._Crumb "Salacious B. Crumb"), let out a loud cackle. Vader warned the Hutt to not let the [Kowakian monkey-lizard](/wiki/Kowakian_monkey-lizard "Kowakian monkey-lizard") do that again in his presence if he valued Crumb's life; Jabba merely laughed and told Vader he now regarded him as a "good friend." The Hutt then inquired whether his bounty hunters were adequately serving his needs; though Vader berated him for bringing up the private matter, he also told the Hutt that their missions were simple enough: to capture an Imperial agent and a boy. Jabba argued that the "boy" had destroyed the Death Star, and had possibly been trained by Kenobi. The name prompted Vader to request that Jabba tell him all he knew of Kenobi's exile on Tatooine.[[362]](#cite_note-SW4-362)

Jabba first required someone screaming, though, so he ordered his guards to pilot the *Khetanna* to the [Great Pit of Carkoon](/wiki/Great_Pit_of_Carkoon "Great Pit of Carkoon"). He expected Vader to be impressed by the [sarlacc](/wiki/Sarlacc "Sarlacc"), which he believed was one of the few treasures that Tatooine had to offer, and said he found it hard to believe that anyone of note (like the Yavin pilot) could have ever been born on Tatooine. In silence, Vader watched his homeworld's sunset.[[362]](#cite_note-SW4-362)

#### Servitude unto Tagge

:   "*You should think of yourself as your lightsaber. A singular weapon from an older time—and one that is dangerous to everyone around them without a skilled hand to wield it. In time you will understand that I am the skilled hand you've been waiting for.*"
:   ―Cassio Tagge to Darth Vader[[363]](#cite_note-DV2-363)

 [![Vader, under Cassio Tagge's administration](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/40/TaggeLooksOnVader-2015DarthVader2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150326043609) [![Vader, under Cassio Tagge's administration](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/40/TaggeLooksOnVader-2015DarthVader2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/228?cb=20150326043609)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/40/TaggeLooksOnVader-2015DarthVader2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150326043609) 

Vader, under Cassio Tagge's administration

 

After leaving Tatooine, Vader met with Tagge aboard his [*Executor*-class Star Dreadnought](/wiki/Executor-class_Star_Dreadnought "Executor-class Star Dreadnought"), [*Annihilator*](/wiki/Liberty%27s_Misrule "Liberty's Misrule"). During a time of many raids against ships carrying Jabba's weapons and equipment supplies, Vader was sent to protect an Imperial shuttle, *[CZ-246](/wiki/CZ-246 "CZ-246")*, from a pirate [attack](/wiki/Skirmish_over_an_unidentified_green_planet "Skirmish over an unidentified green planet"). With his TIE Advanced, Vader went to their aid, alongside [Black Two](/wiki/Black_Two "Black Two") and [Black Three](/wiki/Black_Three "Black Three"), and successfully disabled the automated CR90 corvette attacking the shuttle.
