He tracked Aphra to the other side of another wall, which he began to cut through until BT-1 tripped another trap, separating Vader from his troops, all of whom were soon massacred by the droid. Vader, however, quickly freed himself from the trap and came face-to-face with Aphra, whom he demanded kneel as he prepared to cut her down. When 0-0-0 suddenly attacked, Vader cut the droid down into several parts but was distracted for long enough that several explosive darts could hit his armor and knock him back. With Vader trapped under[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411) the kyberite confessional,[[414]](#cite_note-DV_2020_35-414) Aphra activated it and trapped Vader within. Under the weight of the many sinners who had confessed their own regrets in the temple over the course of centuries, Vader was forced to endure visions of his own past regrets,[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411) much like his less severe reaction to the altar at the Helix temple.[[408]](#cite_note-Doctor_Aphra_38-408)

 [![Doctor Aphra escapes Vader's grasp on Tython.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/VaderAphraTython-2020DoctorAphra13.png/revision/latest?cb=20231124110622) [![Doctor Aphra escapes Vader's grasp on Tython.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/VaderAphraTython-2020DoctorAphra13.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20231124110622)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/VaderAphraTython-2020DoctorAphra13.png/revision/latest?cb=20231124110622) 

Doctor Aphra escapes Vader's grasp on Tython.

 

After a moment of silence as he found himself trapped under his guilt, Vader reacted in anger and threw his lightsaber at Aphra, who dodged the blade and ordered BT-1 to fire on Vader's legs to knock him back down. Much of Vader's already damaged armor was ripped apart under the droid's barrage, including his legs, but the crawling Sith Lord ripped BT-1 apart with the Force, proving to Aphra the shrine would not keep his powers as suppressed as she had hoped. Having failed to escape the confessional and suddenly with failing cybernetics, however, Vader fell back to the ground as Aphra spoke to him about regrets, only for Vader to turn to Aphra and promise she would never succeed in killing him. Aphra, however, had no such plans and knew to stay outside of the confessional, thereby avoiding Vader's currently limited range. Attacked with a wave of regret when Aphra called him the "lost boy," Vader was hit by a cord fired by Aphra, who used it to hack into Vader's suit and contact[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411) a [comms jockey](/wiki/Unidentified_comms_jockey "Unidentified comms jockey")[[412]](#cite_note-Epilogue-412) on the *Executor*. Using Vader's voice, she scared the officer and ordered him to alter and delete numerous probe droid records, which she hoped would hold back Vader's search for [Echo Base](/wiki/Echo_Base "Echo Base") by several weeks.[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411)

While Aphra knew Vader would one day find the rebels, she was certain she had done something good and bid goodbye to Vader, who promised he would find her again one day.[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411) While she was still terrified of him[[415]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2020)_13-415) and knew he would never stop his hunt for her, Aphra left Vader with the hope he, too, would one day "do something good" and declared he had, from a certain point of view, been the best thing that had ever happened to her. Aphra soon escaped Tython aboard one of the TIE/rp Reaper attack landers with the remains of 0-0-0 and BT-1,[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411) both of whom would be rebuilt and dropped off by Aphra on the planet [Birukay](/wiki/Birukay "Birukay") outside of Imperial notice.[[416]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2020)_25-416) As Aphra made her escape, Vader broke out of the confessional by destroying it in a burst of rage.[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411) The Empire put out an arrest warrant for Aphra and tried to keep the damage she caused their search a secret, but the mess she left behind was set to keep Vader from his son and the rebels for long enough that[[412]](#cite_note-Epilogue-412) the rebels—Tolvan, Korin, and Klam among them—could finalize their defenses and set up an escape plan.[[411]](#cite_note-Aphra_40-411)

#### Hoth

:   "*Lord Vader, the fleet has moved out of lightspeed and we are preparing to—*"  
    "*You have failed me for the last time, Admiral.*"
:   ―Admiral Kendal Ozzel and Darth Vader — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/19/YouHaveFailedMeForTheLastTimeAdmiral.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250405134854)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:YouHaveFailedMeForTheLastTimeAdmiral.flac "File:YouHaveFailedMeForTheLastTimeAdmiral.flac"))[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

 [![Vader arrives at Echo Base on Hoth.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Vader-on-Hoth.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100512202331) [![Vader arrives at Echo Base on Hoth.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Vader-on-Hoth.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/243?cb=20100512202331)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Vader-on-Hoth.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100512202331) 

Vader arrives at Echo Base on Hoth.

 

Later, while the *Executor* and the rest of Death Squadron were stationed in the [Juris sector](/wiki/Juris_sector "Juris sector"),[[324]](#cite_note-Odyssey-324) the flagship received a fragmented report from probe droid [XJ9-CS14](/wiki/XJ9-CS14 "XJ9-CS14"), which had been sent to the [Hoth system](/wiki/Hoth_system "Hoth system"). Although Admiral Ozzel dismissed the news as a false lead, both Vader and Captain [Firmus Piett](/wiki/Firmus_Piett "Firmus Piett") agreed that they had found the Rebel base. Vader then gave orders for the fleet to depart for the system. As the fleet came out of hyperspace near [Hoth](/wiki/Hoth "Hoth"), Vader was informed by General Veers that orbital bombardment was impossible as an energy shield defended [Echo Base](/wiki/Echo_Base "Echo Base"). Vader guessed from this information that the Alliance knew of their presence because Ozzel had made the fleet exit hyperspace too close to the system. After ordering Veers to prepare his troops for a ground assault, Vader executed Ozzel for his incompetence and promoted Captain Piett to replace him as Admiral, and had him deploy the fleet so that no Rebel ship escaped the system.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

As the Imperial ground forces led by Veers [engaged](/wiki/Battle_of_Hoth "Battle of Hoth") the Alliance,Vader led an assault troop into the Rebel base and broke their lines, but they found it mostly deserted, for General [Carlist Rieekan](/wiki/Carlist_Rieekan "Carlist Rieekan") had ordered its evacuation pre-emotively.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) Vader entered the base and soon ran into a group of Rebels carrying their unconscious captain towards a hangar. They open fire, and Vader deflected their shots before leaping and cutting down a Rebel trooper named [Beak](/wiki/Beak_(individual) "Beak (individual)"). Another trooper, named [Roja](/wiki/Roja "Roja"), threw a grenade at Vader, who used the Force to deflect it. It knocked out their sergeant, [Hazram Namir](/wiki/Hazram_Namir "Hazram Namir"), and Roja was killed soon after. The last Rebel was the former Imperial governor of [Haidoral Prime](/wiki/Haidoral_Prime "Haidoral Prime"), [Everi Chalis](/wiki/Everi_Chalis "Everi Chalis"). She had been pursued by Imperial forces in the weeks following her defection and assumed Vader was there for her. Vader only asked her where Luke was, and when a trooper told him that they had located the *Millennium Falcon*, he pushed her aside and marched in the direction of his target.[[388]](#cite_note-TC-388)

Only the *Millennium Falcon* remained at the base's hangar, but the [light freighter](/wiki/Light_freighter "Light freighter") was able to escape before Vader could capture it. With the Alliance's forces on Hoth in complete retreat and the various transports scattered throughout the galaxy, Vader and his troops had secured a great victory for the Empire.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) Rather than pursuing the Rebel transports which had gotten away,[[354]](#cite_note-LS-354) Vader redirected his Death Squadron's efforts to capturing the *Millennium Falcon*, which had evaded Imperial forces in the [Hoth asteroid belt](/wiki/Hoth_asteroid_field "Hoth asteroid field") due to its faulty hyperdrive. Despite Piett's reservations, Vader ordered the fleet to pursue the ship into the asteroid field,[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) and told the *Executor*'s crew that he wanted the freighter towed aboard and its passengers taken alive.[[354]](#cite_note-LS-354) Even though the asteroids heavily damaged the Star Destroyers, Vader instructed every ship to sweep the field until the *Falcon* was found.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

 [![Vader and the Emperor discuss Luke Skywalker's growing power.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/Threatofskywalker.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017161704) [![Vader and the Emperor discuss Luke Skywalker's growing power.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/Threatofskywalker.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/277?cb=20201017161704)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6d/Threatofskywalker.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017161704) 

Vader and the Emperor discuss Luke Skywalker's growing power.

 

Piett then informed him that the Emperor commanded him to make contact, and Vader had the *Executor* move out of the field to have a clear transmission. Vader contacted his master; the Emperor told him that he had sensed a new threat in the Force: Luke Skywalker, who he feared could destroy them if he ever became a Jedi, and that he was Anakin's son. Feigning shock at the Emperor's revelation, Vader believed Luke could be turned to the dark side and prove a powerful ally. Although the Emperor was doubtful, Vader assured him that Luke would join them or die.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

Determined to find his son before the Emperor, Vader summoned several bounty hunters—[4-LOM](/wiki/4-LOM "4-LOM"), Bossk, [Zuckuss](/wiki/Zuckuss "Zuckuss"), Dengar, [IG-88](/wiki/IG-88B "IG-88B"), and Boba Fett—to the *Executor*, and promised a substantial [reward](/wiki/Bounty "Bounty") for the one who found the *Falcon*'s crew alive. As he was briefing the [hunters](/wiki/Hunting "Hunting"), Piett informed Vader that the *[Avenger](/wiki/Avenger "Avenger")* was tracking the *Falcon*. Vader requested an update from the ship's commander, Captain [Lorth Needa](/wiki/Lorth_Needa "Lorth Needa"), who reported that he had lost the *Falcon* and assumed full responsibility for this. Vader accepted his apology with a fatal Force choke, and then ordered Piett to alert all commands of the *Falcon*'s disappearance.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

#### Cloud City

:   "*Obi-Wan never told you what happened to your father.*"  
    "*He told me enough! He told me you killed him!*"  
    "*No.* I *am your father.*"
:   ―Darth Vader's revelation to Luke Skywalker — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/42/IAmYourFather-Full.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250405134535)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:IAmYourFather-Full.flac "File:IAmYourFather-Full.flac"))[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

As the *Falcon* traveled through realspace to try and repair its hyperdrive on [Bespin](/wiki/Bespin "Bespin"), Fett tracked and predicted Solo's movements, but also contacted Vader, whose *Executor* reached Bespin before the freighter.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) Along with a strike team comprising only a few individuals, Vader left the *Executor* for [Cloud City](/wiki/Cloud_City "Cloud City"), leaving its crew to do nothing but wait hidden.[[354]](#cite_note-LS-354) At the city, Vader contacted its [Baron Administrator](/wiki/Baron_Administrator "Baron Administrator") [Lando Calrissian](/wiki/Landonis_Balthazar_Calrissian "Landonis Balthazar Calrissian"), who happened to be Solo's friend, to make a deal. Calrissian, whose [tibanna](/wiki/Tibanna "Tibanna") [mining](/wiki/Mining "Mining") operation was keen to evade Imperial attention, agreed to help him capture the ship in exchange for them leaving his people and his interests alone.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

 [![Vader duels his son, Luke.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/DarthVader2020-10-Sprouse-textless.png/revision/latest?cb=20210525004234) [![Vader duels his son, Luke.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/DarthVader2020-10-Sprouse-textless.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/230?cb=20210525004234)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/DarthVader2020-10-Sprouse-textless.png/revision/latest?cb=20210525004234) 

Vader duels his son, Luke.

 

When the *Falcon* arrived, Luke was not among them, but Vader knew he could use his friends to lure his son to Bespin. Escorted by Fett, Vader waited for Solo, Organa, Chewbacca, and Calrissian.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) Whilst waiting in the [Rinetta dining room](/wiki/Rinetta_dining_room "Rinetta dining room"), he was barged in upon by the [Lepi](/wiki/Lepi "Lepi") smuggler [Jaxxon T. Tumperakki](/wiki/Jaxxon_T._Tumperakki "Jaxxon T. Tumperakki"), who quickly left after the Dark Lord and the smuggler stared at each other. A team of stormtroopers was then dispatched to arrest Tumperakki.[[260]](#cite_note-Fake_It_Till_You_Make_It-260) When the Rebels arrived, Vader had them surrounded by stormtroopers, imprisoned—and, in the case of Captain Solo, tortured. Much to Calrissian's displeasure, Vader altered their deal, agreeing to let Fett take Solo and collect Jabba's bounty on him. Afterward, he inspected one of the city's [carbon-freezing chambers](/wiki/Carbon-freezing_chamber "Carbon-freezing chamber"), and deemed it adequate if crude, to freeze Luke for his journey to the Emperor, but at the danger of it being fatal, he had the facility tested on Captain Solo.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

On his orders, Solo was frozen in [carbonite](/wiki/Carbonite "Carbonite"); as he survived, Vader handed Solo over to Fett and ordered Organa, Chewbacca, and C-3PO taken to his ship, while he awaited Luke at the facility. Once his son was separated from R2-D2 and made his way to the carbon-freezing chamber, Vader appeared before him, and the two [dueled](/wiki/Duel_on_Cloud_City "Duel on Cloud City"). Luke held his own for much of the duel, but he was ultimately no match for Vader:[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) as they moved to a reactor shaft and a catwalk,[[417]](#cite_note-SYWtBaJ?-417) Luke managed to cut Vader's shoulder, only for Vader to slice off his right hand, which along with his old lightsaber fell through the shaft.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

 [![Vader telling Luke that he is his father](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/VadersRevelation-TESB.png/revision/latest?cb=20220611230805) [![Vader telling Luke that he is his father](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/VadersRevelation-TESB.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220611230805)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/VadersRevelation-TESB.png/revision/latest?cb=20220611230805) 

Vader telling Luke that he is his father

 

Vader beckoned Luke to join him in the dark side, but Luke vehemently refused. Vader then told Luke that Kenobi had hidden from him the truth about his father, Anakin Skywalker, before revealing that he was, in fact, his father. Luke refused to believe the truth, but Vader continued to tempt his weakened son, offering Luke the chance to destroy the Emperor and "bring order to the galaxy,"[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) just as he tried to do with Padmé on Mustafar.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) He even pleaded with his son to come with him.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) In Vader's ideal world, his son would have taken his hand, accepting him as his father.[[418]](#cite_note-DV_2020_32-418) However, Skywalker instead chose to throw himself into the shaft, possibly facing death to avoid joining Vader.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

While Luke was rescued by his friends on the *Millennium Falcon*, Vader returned to the *Executor*. As the freighter was unable to [escape](/wiki/Escape_from_Cloud_City "Escape from Cloud City") due to its deactivated hyperdrive, Vader and Piett waited for the *Falcon* to enter tractor-beam range. During the pursuit, Vader reached out to Luke through the Force, telling him it was his [destiny](/wiki/Destiny "Destiny") to come with him, calling him "son." Yet, the *Falcon* made the jump into hyperspace, thanks to R2-D2 reactivating the hyperdrive. Although Piett feared Vader would kill him for his failure, Vader merely turned away from the viewport,[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) not in anger, but in sadness.[[417]](#cite_note-SYWtBaJ?-417)

Upon learning that Vader had allowed Fett to take the carbon frozen Solo back to Jabba, ISB agent [Andressa Divo](/wiki/Andressa_Divo "Andressa Divo") was frustrated that the smuggler would not be brought to Imperial imprisonment, although she also decided she had no position to question Vader's orders.[[419]](#cite_note-Scum_and_Villainy_Case_Files-419)

#### Search for answers

:   "*You served Padmé. You want revenge as well. But you* fear *me. Good. Let that fear* guide *you. I will* always *triumph. And if you serve me, so will you. Together, we can* find *them.*"
:   ―Darth Vader, to Sabé[[420]](#cite_note-DV_2020_2-420)

 [![Darth Vader returned to Tatooine to search for answers about his son's life.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/VaderAndZED67OnTatooine-2020DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200206080601) [![Darth Vader returned to Tatooine to search for answers about his son's life.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/VaderAndZED67OnTatooine-2020DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200206080601)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/06/VaderAndZED67OnTatooine-2020DarthVader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200206080601) 

Darth Vader returned to Tatooine to search for answers about his son's life.

 

Following the *Falcon*'s escape, Vader took a shuttle with several [death troopers](/wiki/Death_trooper "Death trooper") and a forensics droid named [ZED-6-7](/wiki/ZED-6-7 "ZED-6-7") with him on a mission to learn who had hidden his son from him. After modifying ZED's motivator, he took the shuttle to Tatooine. There, he met with Lieutenant [Ardo Banch](/wiki/Ardo_Banch "Ardo Banch") and his stormtroopers. Vader went on to the Lars Moisture Farm to search for clues about Skywalker's early life. Vader also reminisced about the attempted rescue of his mother and her funeral. Vader was informed by Lieutenant Banch of several transmissions, but came under attack by gangsters who wanted his shuttle. Vader and his death troopers killed the gangsters before he took his shuttle to Coruscant and returned to Amidala's apartment. There, ZED-6-7 discovered that someone had planted a [scout transmitter](/wiki/Scout_transmitter "Scout transmitter"), which led to [Vendaxa](/wiki/Vendaxa "Vendaxa").[[421]](#cite_note-DV_2020_1-421)

At some point, Vader also returned to the Imperial Palace and met with Palpatine, who ordered him to hunt down the remnants of the Rebel fleet while it was scattered, believing he may be the only officer in the Empire who could lead such a hunt despite it interrupting his quest to find his son. Unwilling to abandon that search, Vader instead proposed they give the mission to Tarkin's protégé, [Ellian Zahra](/wiki/Ellian_Zahra "Ellian Zahra"). Contacting her via hologram, Vader granted her permission to return to active duty to try and redeem herself for a past failure under Tarkin, making it clear she had no room to fail him and the Emperor.[[422]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_8-422) Shortly after the *Falcon*'s escape and its vital role in the [Battle at Rendezvous Point Delta-Three](/wiki/Battle_at_Rendezvous_Point_Delta-Three "Battle at Rendezvous Point Delta-Three"), Vader chastised Zahra for attempting to destroy the vessel during the engagement, stating that while Leia Organa would be an acceptable casualty, another passenger was of value to him. Vader further threatened consequence to Zahra should she report further of "partial success" before dismissing her.[[423]](#cite_note-SW2020_1-423)

Before journeying to Vendaxa, the Sith Lord traveled to a [cantina](/wiki/Cantina "Cantina") and confronted a [man](/wiki/Unidentified_Luke_Skywalker_impostor "Unidentified Luke Skywalker impostor") who claimed to be his son Luke Skywalker. Vader quickly found that the man was a liar, telling him that it did not matter who the man was. Because by tomorrow, no one would remember that he ever lived. Vader then killed the impostor and told the people who were about to hire him that he would let them live. That way, they would be witnesses for what the man had done. The Sith then stated that whoever claimed the name of Luke Skywalker would also claim the crimes he had committed against the Empire. After leaving the cantina, Vader admonished the Imperial officer who had given him the information on the alleged Luke Skywalker, telling him his information was worthless and that he had simply wasted his time.[[424]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_5-424)

 [![Darth Vader travels to Tempes to speak to the spirit of the Grand Inquisitor, who remained forced to serve the Sith, even in death.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/VaderAndGrandInquisitor-2020StarWars6.png/revision/latest?cb=20231119014415) [![Darth Vader travels to Tempes to speak to the spirit of the Grand Inquisitor, who remained forced to serve the Sith, even in death.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/VaderAndGrandInquisitor-2020StarWars6.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20231119014415)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f1/VaderAndGrandInquisitor-2020StarWars6.png/revision/latest?cb=20231119014415) 

Darth Vader travels to Tempes to speak to the spirit of the Grand Inquisitor, who remained forced to serve the Sith, even in death.

 

When Luke Skywalker met [Verla](/wiki/Verla "Verla") on [Serelia](/wiki/Serelia "Serelia"), she told him about Order 66 and the Imperial Inquisitors, describing Vader as pure, true evil. Shortly thereafter, she discovered through the force that Vader was Luke's father,[[424]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_5-424) but Skywalker proved to her he was not like his forebear. Before Vader continued his personal mission, he felt through the Force, during a conversation with Zahra, that the trap he had placed within a Jedi outpost on Tempes had been activated. He ordered his pilot to set course for Tempes, but when he arrived there, he found nothing but the spirit of the Grand Inquisitor, who had recently been defeated by Luke Skywalker. When asked by the Grand Inquisitor if he would ever be freed from Vader's service, the Sith Lord refused to do so, saying that the Inquisitor was merely a tool for him. Vader then abandoned his cursed servant, who was slowly engulfed by the ghostly flames around his body.[[313]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_6-313)

Upon arriving on Vendaxa, Vader was confronted by "[Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Sab%C3%A9 "Sabé")."[[421]](#cite_note-DV_2020_1-421) Amidala, revealed to be former [Naboo Royal Handmaiden](/wiki/Naboo_Royal_Handmaidens "Naboo Royal Handmaidens") Sabé, was briefly choked by Vader before they came under attack by several [Vendaxan land squids](/wiki/Vendaxan_land_squid "Vendaxan land squid"). Together, they eliminated the squids, allowing Sabé to give her slain soldiers a proper burial. Sabé also revealed her true motives; to investigate the death of her former queen. Vader agreed to assist her in her mission so long as she obeyed him.[[420]](#cite_note-DV_2020_2-420)

Following Sabé's guidance, Vader returned to the planet Naboo to retrieve security recordings stolen from Amidala's quarters on Coruscant. Upon entering the Naberri Lake Retreat, they were met by Gregar Typho and [Tonra](/wiki/Tonra "Tonra"), who agreed to help them retrieve the stolen recordings. Taking a [submarine](/wiki/Submarine "Submarine"), the four of them left for the recordings' location, while Sabé expressed regret at her inability to save either her queen or Anakin Skywalker's mother. After surviving an attack by a [colo claw fish](/wiki/Colo_claw_fish "Colo claw fish"), they reached their destination and found the recordings, which showed Sabé forming the [Amidalans](/wiki/Amidalans "Amidalans") and swearing to find and destroy their queen's murderers. She then accused Vader of murdering Amidala himself, to which Vader said he did before attacking the Amidalans.[[425]](#cite_note-DV_2020_3-425)

 [![Darth Vader stands over the grave of his wife.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8c/VaderAndPadmeReunite-2020DarthVader5.png/revision/latest?cb=20231113100406) [![Darth Vader stands over the grave of his wife.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8c/VaderAndPadmeReunite-2020DarthVader5.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20231113100406)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8c/VaderAndPadmeReunite-2020DarthVader5.png/revision/latest?cb=20231113100406) 

Darth Vader stands over the grave of his wife.

 

However, the fight was quickly interrupted by a [sando aqua monster](/wiki/Sando_aqua_monster "Sando aqua monster"), which attacked Vader and allowed the Amidalans to escape. After slaying the monster along with his death troopers, Vader found the rest of the Amidalans in the jungles of Naboo, where they were led into battle by Ric Olié.[[426]](#cite_note-DV_2020_4-426) In the [battle at Padmé's tomb](/wiki/Battle_at_Padm%C3%A9%27s_tomb "Battle at Padmé's tomb"),[[427]](#cite_note-Marvel_Vader_30-427) Vader and his death troopers eliminated most of the Amidalans and incapacitated Olié before moving onto their next destination: the [Tomb of Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Tomb_of_Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Tomb of Padmé Amidala"). But before they could enter the tomb, they were surrounded by Sabé and other members of Amidala's surviving handmaidens: [Eirtaé](/wiki/Eirta%C3%A9 "Eirtaé"), [Rabé Tonsort](/wiki/Rab%C3%A9_Tonsort "Rabé Tonsort"), [Saché](/wiki/Sach%C3%A9 "Saché"), and [Dormé](/wiki/Dorm%C3%A9 "Dormé"). The handmaidens fought bravely, but were easily defeated by Vader, who then opened the door to Amidala's tomb.[[426]](#cite_note-DV_2020_4-426) In truth, the handmaidens had known they would be unable to defeat the Sith Lord, but instead made sure Eirtaé could tap into his armor with her staff. Doing so got Eirtaé an incomplete set of code, which the handmaidens hoped would one day get them the *Executor*'s self-destruct codes.[[428]](#cite_note-DV_2020_30-428)

In the meantime, unaware of Eirtaé's success[[428]](#cite_note-DV_2020_30-428) and ignoring Sabé's protests, Vader proceeded into the tomb and allowed ZED-6-7 to scan Amidala's sarcophagus. The droid then discovered a [med implant](/wiki/Med_implant "Med implant"), which he traced back to the asteroid field [Polis Massa](/wiki/Polis_Massa "Polis Massa"). Upon reaching the asteroid field, they entered the [Polis Massa Base](/wiki/Polis_Massa_Base "Polis Massa Base") and uncovered data that Amidala had been flown to the base by Obi-Wan Kenobi in an effort to save her life. However, Vader and his forces were then [attacked](/wiki/Battle_on_Polis_Massa "Battle on Polis Massa") once more by the Amidalans, whom he managed to defeat once and for all. Along with ZED-6-7, Vader entered the base's maternity ward and allowed the droid to access the memory bank of a damaged [Chroon-Tan B-Machine](/wiki/Chroon-Tan_B-Machine "Chroon-Tan B-Machine"). He then watched a recording of Amidala speaking with Kenobi in her final moments of life. When ZED-6-7 commented that Kenobi must have been important to her, Vader promptly destroyed the droid[[429]](#cite_note-DV_2020_5-429) in one-thirtieth of a second.[[428]](#cite_note-DV_2020_30-428) The recording then ended with Amidala stating that she knew there was still good in Vader, leaving the Sith to mull over his wife's last words.[[429]](#cite_note-DV_2020_5-429)

#### Test on Mustafar

:   "*I have turned his pain into fear…and his fear into anger. But he has learned and forgotten these lessons before. So this time I will send him a reminder. Through Ochi of Bestoon…assassin of the Sith…I will turn his anger back to fear…and his fear back to pain…as many times as it takes.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[430]](#cite_note-DV_2020_6-430)

 [![Darth Vader is left to burn on Mustafar by his Sith Master on the same river bank where he lost to Obi-Wan Kenobi.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/HeBurnsAgain-2020DarthVader6.png/revision/latest?cb=20231113100140) [![Darth Vader is left to burn on Mustafar by his Sith Master on the same river bank where he lost to Obi-Wan Kenobi.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/HeBurnsAgain-2020DarthVader6.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20231113100140)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ab/HeBurnsAgain-2020DarthVader6.png/revision/latest?cb=20231113100140) 

Darth Vader is left to burn on Mustafar by his Sith Master on the same river bank where he lost to Obi-Wan Kenobi.

 

After learning of Vader's personal mission, the Emperor summoned his apprentice to the Imperial Palace, where he sensed his apprentice was filled with mourning instead of hate. Intending to reteach him the dark side, Sidious began to torture him with Force lightning.[[429]](#cite_note-DV_2020_5-429) Vader fought back against his master, but was overwhelmed again by two Royal Guards led by Mas Amedda. While Vader did manage to choke the three of them with the Force, he in turn was then choked by the Emperor, who mocked the Jedi title of "Chosen One" before telling Vader to forget everything from his past and ravaging his body, leaving him with only one of his hands intact. The Emperor then brought his apprentice to Mustafar and left him on the very shore where Kenobi left him at the end of their duel. The Emperor instructed Vader to rebuild himself without using the Force before leaving with Mas Amedda.[[430]](#cite_note-DV_2020_6-430)

Remembering how Kenobi had left him on the same shore and how he later cut the Jedi Master down on the Death Star, then picturing Sidious in Kenobi's place in the latter memory,[[430]](#cite_note-DV_2020_6-430) Vader resolved to crawl from the shore towards the facility where he murdered the Separatist leaders years before, remembering the time his master had sent him to the base to wipe out the Separatist leadership. Promising himself that he would bring suffering to the Emperor when he recovered and spotting a figure laughing at him in the distance, he entered the base and, after spotting the corpse of Nute Gunray and remembering his actions against the Separatists and Jedi younglings alike, found a few mouse droids, which he rewired to weld old battle droid limbs to his body. However, he was then confronted by the figure he had seen: [Ochi of Bestoon](/wiki/Ochi "Ochi"), a Sith assassin sent by the Emperor to test his apprentice. With his new limbs, Vader fought the assassin and bested him. He then demanded to know what his master's greater plan was before being interrupted by a distant voice. Vader followed the voice into a cave, which Ochi trapped him inside of after stealing his lightsaber.[[431]](#cite_note-DV_2020_7-431)

 [![Vader repairing his old green Eta-2 interceptor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/02/ShipRepair-2020DarthVader9.png/revision/latest?cb=20240112010312) [![Vader repairing his old green Eta-2 interceptor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/02/ShipRepair-2020DarthVader9.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/256?cb=20240112010312)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/02/ShipRepair-2020DarthVader9.png/revision/latest?cb=20240112010312) 

Vader repairing his old green Eta-2 interceptor.

 

As Vader fought his way through the cave, the voice taunted him with riddles about what he wanted and who he truly was. Eventually, Vader reached the source of the voice; an ancient being known as the [Eye of Webbish Bog](/wiki/Eye_of_Webbish_Bog "Eye of Webbish Bog"). Vader demanded the answers to his questions about his master, to which the Eye granted him a [Sith wayfinder](/wiki/Sith_wayfinder "Sith wayfinder"). After leaving the cave, Vader came upon his old Jedi interceptor, where he was then met by Ochi and his [Droid Crush Pirates](/wiki/Droid_Crush_Pirates_of_Bestoon "Droid Crush Pirates of Bestoon").[[432]](#cite_note-DV_2020_8-432)

While fighting off the pirates, Vader cornered Ochi and knocked him out before reclaiming his lightsaber. He then finished off the pirates and used their parts to repair the damaged interceptor. Once the ship was repaired, Vader used the now captured Ochi to access the wayfinder, which showed the way to a planet called [Exegol](/wiki/Exegol "Exegol"). With Ochi trapped in a capsule beneath the ship, Vader flew the interceptor away from Mustafar and used a [hyperspace transport ring](/wiki/Hyperspace_transport_ring "Hyperspace transport ring") to journey toward his next destination.[[433]](#cite_note-DV_2020_9-433)

#### Finding Exegol

:   "*Unlimited power. Beyond* anything *you have ever experienced. All in* my *hands. You feel it* burning *your flesh and mind. Ready to* incinerate *you in an instant. And you know you cannot fight it. So how…*how *can you* claim *it?*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Darth Vader[[434]](#cite_note-DV_2020_11-434)

After exiting hyperspace, Vader and Ochi found themselves in the [Red Honeycomb Zone](/wiki/Red_Honeycomb_Zone "Red Honeycomb Zone") as the Sith attempted to locate Exegol. However, they were then met by a massive, tentacled space-faring creature related to the [Summa-verminoth](/wiki/Summa-verminoth "Summa-verminoth").[[433]](#cite_note-DV_2020_9-433) Before Vader could react, he was attacked by a fleet of Star Destroyers led by [Sly Moore](/wiki/Sly_Moore "Sly Moore") and Admiral [Corleque](/wiki/Corleque "Corleque"). Vader fought against the fleet's TIE fighters until he had an idea. Changing his course, he flew toward the massive creature and allowed the TIE fighters to follow until they were crushed by the creature's tentacles. As Vader flew past the creature, Moore warned him that it would break his mind. Ignoring the Umbaran's warning, he continued on until he and Ochi were both hit by mental attacks. Vader experienced several traumatic visions from his past, which concluded with a vision of his son killing him in battle and taking his place by the Emperor's side.[[435]](#cite_note-DV_2020_10-435)

 [![Atop the Summa-verminoth, Darth Vader arrives on Exegol and declares himself to be a Sith Master.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/77/IAmNoLongerTheLearner-2020DarthVader11.png/revision/latest?cb=20220626002351) [![Atop the Summa-verminoth, Darth Vader arrives on Exegol and declares himself to be a Sith Master.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/77/IAmNoLongerTheLearner-2020DarthVader11.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220626002351)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/77/IAmNoLongerTheLearner-2020DarthVader11.png/revision/latest?cb=20220626002351) 

Atop the Summa-verminoth, Darth Vader arrives on Exegol and declares himself to be a Sith Master.

 

Upon escaping the Red Nebula, Vader finally reached the planet Exegol, where he and Ochi promptly crashed. Breaking free from the wrecked interceptor, they were both met once again by the creature. But this time, however, Vader did not run away. Disobeying his master's command, he reached out with the dark side and used it to bring the creature down, thus allowing him and Ochi to continue on towards the Emperor's [Sith Citadel](/wiki/Sith_Citadel "Sith Citadel").[[435]](#cite_note-DV_2020_10-435) Standing atop the creature, Vader commanded his master to show himself. And once he did, Vader rode the creature into battle. In turn, the Emperor summoned two crustaceous monsters to attack the creature, though they were both quickly crushed. When Vader told his master that he was no longer his apprentice, the Emperor merely scoffed and reached out with the Force himself, twisting and contorting the creature until it broke apart. Forced to return to ground level, Vader followed the Emperor into the Citadel, where his greatest secrets lie in wait.[[434]](#cite_note-DV_2020_11-434)

Once inside, Vader was greeted by a menagerie of horrors forged by his master. All around him were large vats containing [bioengineered organisms](/wiki/Strand-Cast "Strand-Cast") strong in the dark side of the Force. Along with these organisms were large Sith statues, dozens of [Tanker guards](/wiki/Tanker_(Exegol) "Tanker (Exegol)"), [Sith cultists](/wiki/Sith_cultist "Sith cultist"), and a jar containing a severed hand. Vader was quickly attacked by the guards and cultists, but he managed to defeat them all before venturing further into the Citadel. Ochi caught up with Vader and attempted to dissuade him, but the Sith carried on until he reached a level beneath the Citadel. This level was lined with hundreds of Star Destroyers, each armed with a [planet-destroying cannon](/wiki/Axial_superlaser "Axial superlaser"). Showing no fear, Vader continued on into a massive chamber, which held a dome filled with red light and piercing screams. As Ochi tried to dissuade him once more, the Sith entered the dome and stepped into the burning light.[[434]](#cite_note-DV_2020_11-434)

Within the dome was a subterranean mountain of Kyber crystal, bled red by the Sith cultists who kept it in constant pain. The Emperor explained that he did this in order to power the cannons of his fleet. When the crystal was cut, it screamed in pain again and sent out a wave of power, knocking off Ochi's helmet and burning his unprotected eyes. Vader suffered as well while his master mocked him for attempting to claim his power. The Emperor told his apprentice that if he chose to walk with him, he would never escape his pain. But only by walking with him would he be able to share his power. The Emperor then asked his apprentice if he had chosen, to which Darth Vader replied that Sidious was his master. Even though he experienced a vision, in which Luke Skywalker told him that he would, one day, kill the Emperor,[[434]](#cite_note-DV_2020_11-434) Vader had seen the power Sidious commanded on Exegol, so he fully decided to return to his master's service,[[436]](#cite_note-DV_2020_12-436) departing Exegol with Sidious, Ochi, Mas Amedda, and Sly Moore.[[434]](#cite_note-DV_2020_11-434)

#### Hunting Luke Skywalker

##### A new target

:   "*You could still be strong, my son. I know there is power in you. But I have seen the true might and purpose of the Sith. And there is no room for another. So* this *time…you will die.*"
:   ―Darth Vader[[436]](#cite_note-DV_2020_12-436)

 [![Back in the service of the Emperor, Darth Vader recruits Palpatine's assassin Ochi of Bestoon to his quest to hunt down Luke Skywalker.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/VaderSelectsOchi-2020DarthVader12.png/revision/latest?cb=20240330083731) [![Back in the service of the Emperor, Darth Vader recruits Palpatine's assassin Ochi of Bestoon to his quest to hunt down Luke Skywalker.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/VaderSelectsOchi-2020DarthVader12.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240330083731)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/VaderSelectsOchi-2020DarthVader12.png/revision/latest?cb=20240330083731) 

Back in the service of the Emperor, Darth Vader recruits Palpatine's assassin Ochi of Bestoon to his quest to hunt down Luke Skywalker.

 

Upon returning to Coruscant, Vader was brought to the very building where he had been transformed to undergo repairs. A medical droid told him to prepare for shutdown, but Vader refused, choosing instead to remain conscious throughout the procedure. Once he was fully repaired, Vader asked the Emperor his will, to which his master told him to decide that for himself. Vader then called over Ochi, who had just been given a [cybernetic visor](/wiki/Cybernetics "Cybernetics") so he could continue to see. With Ochi at his side, Vader left Coruscant in a Lambda-class shuttle and decided that he would hunt down and kill his son, believing that there was no place for him as an apprentice after the power he had seen on Exegol.[[436]](#cite_note-DV_2020_12-436) Truthfully, however, Vader still wished Skywalker had joined him on Cloud City.[[418]](#cite_note-DV_2020_32-418) Traveling to a remote outpost somewhere in the Outer Rim, Vader and Ochi met with a Hutt named [Bokku](/wiki/Bokku "Bokku"). When Ochi asked for the whereabouts of Han Solo, Bokku reported that he had been stolen and assured the assassin that Jabba would recover him. However, Ochi then told Bokku that he would recover Solo himself in exchange for power. Bokku then asked Ochi if he served the Emperor, to which Ochi replied that they both served Vader now.[[436]](#cite_note-DV_2020_12-436)

Vader was then attacked by a group of Gamorrean guards, which the Sith Lord slew with ease. Bokku quickly apologized for not recognizing Vader and reiterated that he did not know where Solo was. From this, Ochi determined that Jabba had likely hired someone to find Solo and asked Bokku for their identity. Bokku expressed fear at the idea of betraying Jabba until Ochi pried into Bokku's willingness to take over the [Grand Hutt Council](/wiki/Grand_Hutt_Council "Grand Hutt Council"). Bokku then revealed that he had been tracking the hunters who had taken Jabba's bounty and that one crew of droids had gone in a different direction from the others. Bokku told Vader the droids were deep in the heart of Hutt Space and that it would be better to go in Bokku's barge so as not to scare them away. On their way to the droids' location, Bokku inquired as to his compensation for his assistance, to which Vader assured him that he would be rewarded. Under the piloting of Bokku's [nav droid](/wiki/Nav_droid "Nav droid") [Gak-Sixtoo](/wiki/Gak-Sixtoo "Gak-Sixtoo"), they arrived at [Zee-Nine City Seven](/wiki/Zee-Nine_City_Seven "Zee-Nine City Seven") while Vader and Ochi boarded their Lambda shuttle. But as they approached the city, their ship's engines were shut down, causing them to crash.[[437]](#cite_note-DV_2020_13-437)

After escaping the wreckage, Vader and Ochi were confronted by the Droid Crush Pirates, who expressed shock at Ochi's service to Vader. When Ochi claimed he had picked the winning side, the [droid captain](/wiki/Ought-Six "Ought-Six") told him he had picked wrong as IG-88 revealed himself and fired upon both Ochi and Vader. As Vader deflected IG-88's attacks, the droid reminded his target that he had sustained damages while IG-88 himself had not. Vader informed the droid that he had information he required and commanded him to lay down his weapons, to which IG-88 replied that Vader would only access his information by downloading it from his severed head. Vader went to attack IG-88, but the droid then took out a remote and used it to slice into Vader's armor, taking control of the Sith Lord. As IG-88 forced Vader to hold his own saber to his head, Vader demanded to know who had given the droid the code to breach his armor.[[437]](#cite_note-DV_2020_13-437)

 [![Darth Vader claims the remote control device from IG-88, intending to force the droid to destroy himself.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/70/VaderClaimsRemote-2020DarthVader13.png/revision/latest?cb=20240330082520) [![Darth Vader claims the remote control device from IG-88, intending to force the droid to destroy himself.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/70/VaderClaimsRemote-2020DarthVader13.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240330082520)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/70/VaderClaimsRemote-2020DarthVader13.png/revision/latest?cb=20240330082520) 

Darth Vader claims the remote control device from IG-88, intending to force the droid to destroy himself.

 

IG-88 responded that the terms of his employment prevented him from sharing that information. While the droid was distracted, Vader used the Force to take the device from him, allowing him to use it against his attacker. Vader then forced IG-88 to hold his own blaster to his head and pull the trigger, incapacitating him. Vader then continued his fight against the pirates until Bokku's barge [fired](/wiki/Aerial_bombardment "Aerial bombardment") upon him. Vader blocked the blasts with his lightsaber and redirected the energy at the pirates, knocking them back along with Ochi. As the pirates retreated, Vader took IG-88's hand and used it to access a terminal he had been using earlier. Upon activating the terminal, Vader and Ochi discovered various dead ends that the droid had been chasing, as well as the symbol of crime syndicate [Crimson Dawn](/wiki/Crimson_Dawn "Crimson Dawn"). After acquiring IG-88's information, Vader returned to Bokku's barge and confronted him over his betrayal. When Vader asked the Hutt what he had learned, Bokku conceded that the Sith Lord could not be defeated.[[437]](#cite_note-DV_2020_13-437)

##### Pursuing Crimson Dawn

:   "*What you see is what you get with Ochi of Bestoon. I'll always obey the most powerful. So as long as that's really* you*…*"  
    "*Always.*"
:   ―Ochi and Darth Vader[[438]](#cite_note-DV_2020_15-438)

Investigating Crimson Dawn's involvement, Vader sent Ochi to [Arkanis](/wiki/Arkanis "Arkanis") to gather information on the syndicate. As Ochi prepared to sneak into a bar, Vader told him to walk in the front door instead. After a brief scuffle, Ochi retrieved an invitation sent out by the syndicate and showed it to Vader. He and Vader then returned to Bokku's lair to interrogate him over the invitation. The Hutt revealed that Crimson Dawn was holding an auction for Solo and that Jabba would repurchase him. However, Vader told Bokku that he would bid against Jabba and lose. This would humiliate him and make Jabba lose all fear of him, allowing Bokku to betray him. Once Bokku agreed, Vader and Ochi returned to the Lambda-class shuttle and began to take off. But before they could leave the planet, Vader grabbed Ochi and dropped him from the ship. Once Ochi hit the ground, Vader ordered him to find out who else Bokku was working for. Later that night, Vader observed as Ochi was offered a place in Crimson Dawn by a group of assassins. However, Ochi rejected their offer and managed to eliminate them.[[438]](#cite_note-DV_2020_15-438)

 [![Darth Vader and Ochi battle the hooded warriors of Crimson Dawn.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a2/VaderOchiFight-2020DarthVader15.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230612044950) [![Darth Vader and Ochi battle the hooded warriors of Crimson Dawn.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a2/VaderOchiFight-2020DarthVader15.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230612044950)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a2/VaderOchiFight-2020DarthVader15.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230612044950) 

Darth Vader and Ochi battle the hooded warriors of Crimson Dawn.

 

Vader then approached Ochi, who quickly realized that Vader already knew that Bokku was working with Crimson Dawn. He had only wished to test the Ochi's loyalty. As more assassins surrounded them, Ochi reaffirmed he would always obey Vader as long as he remained the most powerful. Vader assured Ochi that he always would be as the two of them set about eliminating the assassins.[[438]](#cite_note-DV_2020_15-438) After discovering that Sly Moore had hired IG-88, Vader and Ochi returned to Coruscant to find her, her [court](/wiki/Umbaran%27s_Court "Umbaran's Court") and the rebuilt droid bounty hunter in [Administrative Temple Garden 313A](/wiki/Administrative_Temple_Garden_313A "Administrative Temple Garden 313A"). As Vader struck down IG-88 once more, Moore and her court fled into a nearby temple. As they attempted to escape into the streets, Vader used the Force to close the door in front of them. However, Moore then took out another remote and used it to freeze Vader in his own armor, allowing her and her court to open fire on the Sith Lord. But this did not last as Vader overcame the Umbaran's control and struck down her entire court. Moore tried once more to take control of Vader, but Ochi revealed that Vader had fixed that vulnerability in his armor. Vader then knocked the remote out of Moore's hand and told her that she could not bend his will.[[439]](#cite_note-DV_2020_14-439)

Moore responded that she only wanted to see if Vader was still plagued by fear, to which Vader said that the only fear in that place was hers. Moore conceded that he could kill her effortlessly, but also pointed out that doing so would do nothing to save him from Luke Skywalker. When Vader asked the Umbaran what she knew of Skywalker, she stated that the key to finding him, his friend Han Solo was currently being sold by Crimson Dawn. She also pointed out that if she secured Solo for Vader, then the Emperor would not learn of his plans. When Ochi asked Moore why Vader should trust her, the Umbaran answered that she would be delighted to reunite Vader with the only person who could kill him, to which Vader agreed.[[439]](#cite_note-DV_2020_14-439)

##### Auction for Han Solo

:   "*Who trained you? Who was your master?*"  
    "*Someone who knew quite a bit about you, Lord Vader. And* your *master as well.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Lady Qi'ra duel aboard the Vermillion[[440]](#cite_note-WOTBH_3-440)

Shortly after, Ochi and Sly Moore left with a few Imperial officers to attend the [Auction for Han Solo](/wiki/Auction_for_Han_Solo "Auction for Han Solo"). However, this was merely a ruse to humiliate the Umbaran in the Emperor's eyes. Amidst the bidding, Vader himself arrived at the auction on [Jekara](/wiki/Jekara "Jekara") along with a pair of death troopers. After cutting down a few Crimson Dawn guards, Vader infiltrated the [*Vermillion*](/wiki/Vermillion_(Crimson_Dawn) "Vermillion (Crimson Dawn)")[[439]](#cite_note-DV_2020_14-439) just as Crimson Dawn's leader, [Lady](/wiki/Lady "Lady") [Qi'ra](/wiki/Qi%27ra "Qi'ra") sold Solo to Jabba the Hutt.[[441]](#cite_note-DA_2020_12-441) Vader then declared that Solo belonged to him.[[442]](#cite_note-WOTBH_2-442) Vader's presence sent Doctor Aphra,[[441]](#cite_note-DA_2020_12-441) who had infiltrated the auction on behalf of the [Tagge Corporation](/wiki/Tagge_Corporation "Tagge Corporation")[[443]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2020)_11-443) with the smuggler [Sana Starros](/wiki/Sana_Starros "Sana Starros"), falling to the ground in a brief panic attack, but she managed to escape the room with Starros before the preoccupied Sith Lord could spot her. After his attention was briefly diverted to the sounds of Aphra's panicked fall, he turned his attention back to his mission at hand.[[415]](#cite_note-Aphra_(2020)_13-415)

As Vader ordered the death troopers to transport Solo to his flagship, Jabba pointed out that he had already laid claim to the smuggler. Moore attempted to explain the situation, but Vader chastised her for her failure and warned her that the Emperor would hear of it. The Sith Lord then told Jabba that he and everyone else within the Empire belonged to the Emperor, to which Jabba feigned amusement. Vader went on to point out that the Empire could easily replace the Hutts, while also pointing out the fear he could sense in Jabba and the rest of the attending Hutts. When Bokku angrily interrupted, Vader asked Jabba who he was, to which Jabba said that he was no one. Jabba then finally conceded and allowed Solo to be taken with his compliments and regards to the Emperor. As Vader approached Solo, Lady Qi'ra informed him that she would not get in his way, but also still required the one million credits she was promised. When Vader told her she was owed nothing, Qi'ra inquired if the Empire was too poor or cheap to pay its debts. Out of patience, Vader drew out his lightsaber, to which Qi'ra bared her own pair of blades.[[440]](#cite_note-WOTBH_3-440)

 [![Darth Vader duels Crimson Dawn leader Qi'ra, taking note of her skill in Teräs Käsi and Sith fighting style.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/34/QiraDuelsVader-2020StarWars16.png/revision/latest?cb=20240328071517) [![Darth Vader duels Crimson Dawn leader Qi'ra, taking note of her skill in Teräs Käsi and Sith fighting style.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/34/QiraDuelsVader-2020StarWars16.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240328071517)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/34/QiraDuelsVader-2020StarWars16.png/revision/latest?cb=20240328071517) 

Darth Vader duels Crimson Dawn leader Qi'ra, taking note of her skill in Teräs Käsi and Sith fighting style.

 

As they [dueled](/wiki/Duel_on_the_Vermillion "Duel on the Vermillion"),[[440]](#cite_note-WOTBH_3-440) Vader recognized that she was no threat to him, yet nonetheless found her level of skill, which included knowledge of the [Teräs Käsi](/wiki/Ter%C3%A4s_K%C3%A4si "Teräs Käsi") fighting form, notable, and recognized Qi'ra's fighting style as that of his master's.[[444]](#cite_note-CR_5-444) When Vader asked her who had trained her, Qi'ra only replied that she had been trained by someone who knew quite a bit about both Vader and his master;[[440]](#cite_note-WOTBH_3-440) in truth, she had been trained by Maul as part of his revenge plot against the Sith.[[444]](#cite_note-CR_5-444) Vader then pointed out that she did not have the Force and warned that her skill would not save her. After a brief struggle, Vader pushed Qi'ra back with the Force, knocking her into Solo. Stating she would pay the price for her foolishness, he raised his lightsaber and prepared to strike her down. But he was suddenly distracted the arrival of Luke Skywalker, whose presence he sensed through the Force.[[440]](#cite_note-WOTBH_3-440)

While Qi'ra retreated, Vader was informed by General Romodi that Piett had established a secure channel to Skywalker's starfighter. Accessing the channel, Vader told Skywalker he had Solo in his possession. He then warned his son that if he did not come to him, then he would cut his friend in half.[[445]](#cite_note-SW_16-445) Skywalker refused however, telling Vader to come to him. Vader conceded to this, ordering Romodi to bring Solo aboard his Star Destroyer and to prepare his fighter.[[446]](#cite_note-WOTBH_4-446)

##### Chase above Jekara

:   "*I will leave you now, young Skywalker. My goal here is complete. I sense your* terror *at the idea of facing me again. Your skill in the Force does not matter. Only your* fear*. Because of it, you cannot threaten me, and you cannot threaten the Empire.* You are no Jedi*.*"  
    "*That's true, Vader. But the next time we meet…I will be.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker[[447]](#cite_note-WOTBH_5-447)

 [![Darth Vader chases his son over Jekara during the return of Crimson Dawn.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9e/VaderChasingLuke-WOTBH5.png/revision/latest?cb=20240331135323) [![Darth Vader chases his son over Jekara during the return of Crimson Dawn.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9e/VaderChasingLuke-WOTBH5.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240331135323)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/9e/VaderChasingLuke-WOTBH5.png/revision/latest?cb=20240331135323) 

Darth Vader chases his son over Jekara during the return of Crimson Dawn.

 

After boarding his TIE Advanced, Vader took off in pursuit of his son. During the chase, Skywalker used his X-wing to kick up a wave of water, which instantly froze and collided with Vader's fighter. Though Vader crashed, he was able to lift his ship out of the water with the Force and resume his pursuit.[[448]](#cite_note-SW_2020_17-448) After freeing his X-wing from a group of pirates, Vader fired at Skywalker, damaging one of his ship's stabilizers and causing him to crash back down onto the planet below. As Vader closed in on Skywalker, he was contacted by Sly Moore. When Vader stated that he did not require her assistance, Moore informed him that she was not helping him. Vader was then attacked by the Droid Crush Pirates, who landed on his ship and began to tear it apart.[[449]](#cite_note-DV_2020_16-449)

After causing some damage to the Sith's fighter, the pirates fell onto Skywalker's X-wing and quickly repaired it for him, allowing him to take off from the planet. As Vader continued his chase while fending off the pirates, he was informed by Ochi that the Hutts were going after the Imperial shuttle transporting Solo.[[449]](#cite_note-DV_2020_16-449) Vader was then contacted by Admiral Piett, who informed him of the Hutts' attack on the *Executor*. However, Vader chastised Piett for disturbing him, claiming that the activities of the Hutts were irrelevant to him. He then warned Piett that if Solo was not aboard his flagship by the time he returned, he would require an explanation in person. Later in the fight, Piett contacted Vader again and told him that he had appraised the Emperor of the situation. Since the Emperor considered the Empire's arrangement with the Hutts to be valuable, he wished for it to be preserved by having Vader eliminate the Grand Hutt Council. Vader conceded to the Emperor's wishes and abandoned his pursuit of Skywalker, reminding his son that he was no Jedi, though the boy then claimed that the next time they met, he would be. [[450]](#cite_note-DV_2020_17-450)

 [![Vader personally dealt with the Hutt Council.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/db/HuttSlaughter-2020DarthVader17.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250314141536) [![Vader personally dealt with the Hutt Council.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/db/HuttSlaughter-2020DarthVader17.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/260?cb=20250314141536)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/db/HuttSlaughter-2020DarthVader17.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250314141536) 

Vader personally dealt with the Hutt Council.

 

Vader then boarded the Hutt Council's ship and summarily slaughtered them all, including Bokku. Before his death, Bokku revealed his allegiance to Crimson Dawn and had Gak-Sixtoo blow up their own ship in an attempt to kill Vader, which the Sith survived by using the force to rip apart the ship and use the metal pieces to form a large protective cocoon in which he was protected from the blast and then fell back down to Jekara.[[450]](#cite_note-DV_2020_17-450) With the Hutt Council eliminated, the Hutts ceased their attack on the *Executor* while Fett reclaimed Solo from the Empire and delivered him to Jabba on Tatooine.[[447]](#cite_note-WOTBH_5-447) Shortly after, Vader was informed by Lieutenant [Jyala Haydenn](/wiki/Jyala_Haydenn "Jyala Haydenn") that Beilert Valance had infiltrated the *Executor*. He then found Valance trying to escape on a [ship](/wiki/Edgehawk_(starship) "Edgehawk (starship)") and used the Force to pull him from space, rendering him unconscious and taking him prisoner.[[451]](#cite_note-BH_17-451)

### Killing the Dawn

#### Hunting the new menace

:   "*Crimson Dawn has barely shown its strength. To get this far, it must have agents at every level throughout the Empire. Find these infiltrators, Lord Vader…and show them who is stronger.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Darth Vader[[450]](#cite_note-DV_2020_17-450)

With the Hutts dealt with, Vader returned to the *Executor* to confront Sly Moore, who had been captured by Ochi during the battle for trying to help in Skywalker's escape. When Moore revealed that the Emperor had wanted Skywalker alive, Vader revealed that the boy had fled from him, declaring that he was not who the Emperor believed he could be. When Moore pointed out that Skywalker was still free and could still fight, the Sith Lord choked her and stated that his hope would not be enough. Vader was then contacted by Darth Sidious, prompting him to release the Umbaran and kneel before him. After restating his loyalty to his master, Vader was instructed by Sidious to hunt down and eliminate Crimson Dawn's agents within the Empire. Shortly after, Vader was met on the *Executor* by Romodi, who presented him with all of the troops he would need to destroy Crimson Dawn. Vader then instructed Ochi to meet with the [Assassin's Guild](/wiki/Assassin%27s_Guild "Assassin's Guild") and inform them that they would be serving him now.[[450]](#cite_note-DV_2020_17-450)

 [![Darth Vader stands over the healed Beilert Valance, declaring that the bounty hunter will return to Imperial service.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1b/ValanceReturnedToEmpire-BountyHunters17.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20211104153724) [![Darth Vader stands over the healed Beilert Valance, declaring that the bounty hunter will return to Imperial service.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1b/ValanceReturnedToEmpire-BountyHunters17.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20211104153724)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1b/ValanceReturnedToEmpire-BountyHunters17.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20211104153724) 

Darth Vader stands over the healed Beilert Valance, declaring that the bounty hunter will return to Imperial service.

 

In secret, Ochi swore himself to Qi'ra's service after he arrived at the Assassin's Guild base,[[450]](#cite_note-DV_2020_17-450) although the assassin would later claim he was acting as an Imperial double agent.[[452]](#cite_note-DV_2020_22-452) Following Ochi's departure, Vader had Valance repaired and waited for him to awaken. Once he did, he was shocked to find himself restored to his former appearance. When Valance asked Vader what he had done to him, Vader explained that he had had Valance fixed since he would now be serving him.[[451]](#cite_note-BH_17-451) Valance then realized that his heart was gone, to which the Sith informed him that it had been removed and replaced with cybernetics, along with further upgrades to his body. Valance attacked Vader, but Vader cut him in half before leaving him and telling a medical droid to put him back together. Once Valance was repaired, Vader, alongside Haydenn, informed him that he would be assassinating Crimson Dawn's agents within the Empire. For if he did not, the Empire would kill those he cared about.[[453]](#cite_note-BH_18-453)

While he meditated aboard the *Executor*, Vader was informed by Haydenn that Valance had completed his first assignment in killing the alleged Crimson Dawn mole [Tarl Sokoli](/wiki/Tarl_Sokoli "Tarl Sokoli"). Vader then revealed that there was no connection between Sokoli and Crimson Dawn. Sokoli had been publicly dissatisfied with the Empire and Vader had decided that killing someone from Valance's childhood would be a good test for the bounty hunter. The Sith then told Haydenn to alert Ochi that Valance was ready to join them.[[454]](#cite_note-Bounty_Hunters_19-454) Vader also came to realize that Ochi had joined with Crimson Dawn but, deciding he could use it to his advantage in the hunt for the syndicate, kept his deduction a secret.[[455]](#cite_note-DV_2020_21-455)

#### Confronting the Knights of Ren

:   "*You…and your rabble…you are…the Knights of Ren? Pathetic.*"
:   ―Darth Vader, to Ren[[456]](#cite_note-CR_4-456)

 [![Darth Vader returned to his fortress on Mustafar to confront the Knights of Ren, killing Knight Fyodor right away.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/FyodorsDeath-CrimsonReign4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220502144419) [![Darth Vader returned to his fortress on Mustafar to confront the Knights of Ren, killing Knight Fyodor right away.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/FyodorsDeath-CrimsonReign4.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220502144419)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/27/FyodorsDeath-CrimsonReign4.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220502144419) 

Darth Vader returned to his fortress on Mustafar to confront the Knights of Ren, killing Knight Fyodor right away.

 

Vader learned that Zahra's campaign against the Rebellion ended in failure[[444]](#cite_note-CR_5-444) during the [Battle of Panisia](/wiki/Battle_of_Panisia "Battle of Panisia").[[457]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_24-457) Sometime after that engagement,[[458]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_2-458) Vader investigated the [assassination of the Emperor's Royal Guard](/wiki/Assassination_of_the_Emperor%27s_Royal_Guard "Assassination of the Emperor's Royal Guard") on Coruscant,[[456]](#cite_note-CR_4-456) which was secretly carried out in part by Ochi.[[458]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_2-458) During the investigation however, he was informed by Vaneé that a band of thieves had infiltrated Fortress Vader. The Dark Lord quickly returned to Mustafar and confronted the intruders in his castle; a group of dark side marauders known as the [Knights of Ren](/wiki/Knights_of_Ren "Knights of Ren"), who were secretly working with Crimson Dawn. After Vader killed one of them, [Fyodor](/wiki/Fyodor "Fyodor") with a Force choke, their [leader](/wiki/Ren_(human) "Ren (human)") fought him with a [lightsaber](/wiki/Ren_(lightsaber) "Ren (lightsaber)") while the rest of them retreated. The leader said he had taken the blade from his [predecessor](/wiki/Ren_(Ren%27s_predecessor) "Ren (Ren's predecessor)"), from whom he also inherited his name; Ren.[[456]](#cite_note-CR_4-456)

Vader expressed pity for how far the Knights of Ren had fallen before Ren leapt from a window with a device known as the [Screaming Key](/wiki/Screaming_Key "Screaming Key"). As Ren gloated below, Vader used the Force to pull the key back up toward his hand, prompting the knights to open fire on him. Ren then pulled the key back down into his own hand before escaping with the knights on speeders. As the knights sped away, Vader stepped outside to study the remains of his slaughtered troops.[[456]](#cite_note-CR_4-456)

#### Rooting out the Dawn

:   "*Crimson Dawn is just a* symptom*. I will destroy the* disease*.*"
:   ―Darth Vader[[25]](#cite_note-DV_2020_19-25)

While thinking in his mediation chamber, Vader reflected on his promise to his son on Cloud City that they would bring order to the galaxy. Vader concluded that his master had only brought about chaos and decided to set out on a new quest to establish order, whether or not he had his son by his side. Resolving to destroy Crimson Dawn as the first step, Vader left with Ochi to assist the Empire in hunting down Dawn agents on various planets, including [Vincorba](/wiki/Vincorba "Vincorba") and [Calior](/wiki/Calior "Calior"). While on Vincorba, they fought alongside a group of mercenaries known as the [Revengers](/wiki/Revengers "Revengers"). With [Vader's crew](/wiki/Vader%27s_crew "Vader's crew") established, Ochi commented that they would serve well as expendable assets, to which Vader reminded him that he was expendable as well.[[459]](#cite_note-DV_2020_18-459) After finishing on Calior, Vader, Ochi, and the Revengers rendezvoused with Valance and a few other assassins on [Laecor](/wiki/Laecor "Laecor") to continue their hunt. When Valance asked Vader why he was there instead of leading [Dark Squadron](/wiki/Dark_Squadron "Dark Squadron"), the Sith Lord simply told him to do as he was told. As a squad of stormtroopers attempted to move a group of civilians, the civilians refused to comply, prompting the stormtroopers to fire on them. However, Vader then jumped in to deflect their blaster bolts and slaughter them. When Ochi showed confusion over his master's actions, Vader revealed that the stormtroopers served Crimson Dawn. As the group carried on, Vader came upon a statue, which the locals said was of their village guardian who was killed fighting Crimson Dawn.[[25]](#cite_note-DV_2020_19-25)

 [![Darth Vader and his servants uncover a list of Crimson Dawn agents.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/98/VaderValanceOchiList-2020DarthVader19.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220222225731) [![Darth Vader and his servants uncover a list of Crimson Dawn agents.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/98/VaderValanceOchiList-2020DarthVader19.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220222225731)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/98/VaderValanceOchiList-2020DarthVader19.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220222225731) 

Darth Vader and his servants uncover a list of Crimson Dawn agents.

 

Upon locating more of the Dawn's agents, Ochi opted to use the Revengers as bait to lure them out of their stronghold. Vader then used the Force to grab Ochi and throw him toward the Revengers, using him as bait as well. As the agents surrounded them, Ochi requested that Vader bomb the stronghold. But Vader refused and instead mounted [Gee-Ninety](/wiki/G-90 "G-90"), balancing himself atop the droid as they rolled themselves to the stronghold's front entrance. Vader then stormed the stronghold along with Ochi, who the Sith stopped from killing all of the agents inside. When Ochi expressed more confusion, Vader explained that Crimson Dawn was just a symptom and that he would destroy the disease. He then discovered a layout of every Dawn agent within the Empire, which Ochi and Valance noted went all the way to the top.[[25]](#cite_note-DV_2020_19-25) Following this, Vader and his followers returned to Coruscant. Valance, the assassins, and the Revengers left for the [Zanchal Estate](/wiki/Zanchal_Estate "Zanchal Estate") while Vader and Ochi left for the Imperial Palace.[[460]](#cite_note-DV_2020_20-460)

Upon entering the Palace, they [struck down](/wiki/Purge_of_suspected_Crimson_Dawn_collaborators "Purge of suspected Crimson Dawn collaborators") all of the Royal Guards and aides in the Emperor's throne room, except for Sly Moore. Unfazed by this, Sidious pointed out Vader should have kept one of them alive for questioning. When Vader asked him if they were loyal, Sidious said they were loyal to strength, which Vader showed them. However, only one of them was Crimson Dawn, meaning that Vader's list was flawed. When Sidious questioned if his apprentice already knew that, Vader hesitated before assuring his master that he would bring him order. Vader and Ochi then left for the Zanchal Estate to confront [Baron](/wiki/Baron "Baron") [Espis Zanchal](/wiki/Espis_Zanchal "Espis Zanchal") for his loyalty to the Dawn. Upon arriving, Vader was thanked by a pair of hostages who the Revengers had rescued from the Baron. As he returned to his shuttle, Vader informed Ochi that the list was a plant, which Vader himself had deduced when Ochi could only confirm that half of the names on it were Crimson Dawn. Vader told Ochi to find out what connected every other person on the list. That way, they would find out who planted it and why.[[460]](#cite_note-DV_2020_20-460)

#### Hidden enemy

:   "*Ochi of Bestoon.* You *spoke with* Romodi*…and then he* attacked *my* soldiers*…as if he knew they were coming.*"  
    "*Uh…I did* tell *you…that he…he…Million hands, my ass!*"
:   ―Darth Vader reveals Ochi's betrayal[[455]](#cite_note-DV_2020_21-455)

 [![Aware of Ochi's service to Crimson Dawn and Sabé's alliance with it, Darth Vader decided that he could use the syndicate to his advantage.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/IAmTheDawn-2020DarthVader21.png/revision/latest?cb=20230617184342) [![Aware of Ochi's service to Crimson Dawn and Sabé's alliance with it, Darth Vader decided that he could use the syndicate to his advantage.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/IAmTheDawn-2020DarthVader21.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230617184342)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/IAmTheDawn-2020DarthVader21.png/revision/latest?cb=20230617184342) 

Aware of Ochi's service to Crimson Dawn and Sabé's alliance with it, Darth Vader decided that he could use the syndicate to his advantage.

 

Later on the *Executor*, Vader was informed by Ochi that Romodi and his soldiers were not Crimson Dawn after all. However, Ochi warned him that Romodi did not understand the Sith and would come for Vader someday. Stepping out of his chamber, Vader asked Ochi what connected the false names on the list. Ochi revealed that they had all undertaken a mission for Romodi to execute the Amidalans on Naboo. Following this development, Vader and his team of assassins traveled to [Tranchar](/wiki/Tranchar "Tranchar") to capture and interrogate Lieutenant [Grapa](/wiki/Grapa "Grapa") about the mission. After fighting their way through stormtroopers and [DT-series sentry droids](/wiki/DT-series_sentry_droid "DT-series sentry droid"), the assassins discovered civilians being tortured by the Imperials. Gee-Ninety broke from the mission to free the civilians, prompting Vader to destroy the droid as punishment. Vader went on to interrogate Grapa about her mission to kill the Amidalans.[[455]](#cite_note-DV_2020_21-455)

As she claimed to Vader that they were all dead, [Tanka](/wiki/Tanka "Tanka") blasted her in the head for revenge. Vader then realized that the Imperials had known they were coming. When Vader asked Valance who had sent the droids, Valance confirmed they were from Romodi's command. Vader then remembered that Ochi had spoken with Romodi prior to their departure. When he confronted Ochi with that fact, Ochi tried to stammer out an explanation before giving up and running away while Valance fired at him. After stealing a spare ship, Ochi escaped from Tranchar and eventually arrived on Naboo to meet with Sabé. Vader followed the assassin in his TIE Advanced. As soon as Ochi stepped out of his ship, Vader revealed himself and destroyed it with his TIE. After landing in front of Ochi, Vader revealed he had known of his allegiance to the Dawn and gave the assassin an out by commending him for leading him to Sabé, which Ochi went along with and claimed was his plan all along. As Vader confronted Sabé, he took her Crimson Dawn badge from her and claimed that he was the Dawn.[[455]](#cite_note-DV_2020_21-455)

#### Recruiting Sabé

:   "*Does nothing scare you, handmaiden?*"  
    "*Why should I be scared of Anakin Skywalker?*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Sabé[[452]](#cite_note-DV_2020_22-452)

Following this, Vader took Ochi, Sabé, and ZED-6-7 to the carcass of the sando aqua monster he had slain. He then threw Ochi and Sabé out of the shuttle and watched as they were attacked by a pack of [ravenous creatures](/wiki/Unidentified_six-legged_horned_creature "Unidentified six-legged horned creature"). Ochi attempted to assure Vader of his loyalty, but Vader silenced him and asked Sabé why she believed in Crimson Dawn. As she defended herself, she said that she had merely infiltrated the syndicate. Ochi fought alongside her and claimed he had done the same for the Empire. When Vader asked Sabé if she also intended to serve the Empire, Sabé said she did not as long as the Empire served chaos. Sabé went on to claim that she and Vader wanted the same thing: order.[[452]](#cite_note-DV_2020_22-452)

 [![After another battle against the Dawn, Darth Vader learned that Sabé has deduced his past identity.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2c/SabeVader-2020DarthVader23.png/revision/latest?cb=20240327112114) [![After another battle against the Dawn, Darth Vader learned that Sabé has deduced his past identity.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2c/SabeVader-2020DarthVader23.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/230?cb=20240327112114)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2c/SabeVader-2020DarthVader23.png/revision/latest?cb=20240327112114) 

After another battle against the Dawn, Darth Vader learned that Sabé has deduced his past identity.

 

To this, Vader levitated the creatures with the Force and told Sabé that if she killed one monster, a thousand more would replace it. He then explained that one would have to either make the monsters agree or deal with them all. With that, Vader threw the creatures at a group of [long-necked beasts](/wiki/Unidentified_long-necked_creature "Unidentified long-necked creature") as they sprouted from the ground. Understanding Vader's plan, Sabé brought him to a Crimson Dawn outpost while Ochi returned to the *Executor* to speak with Romodi. Upon arriving at the outpost, Sabé informed the Dawners there that they served Vader now. To this, the Dawners attacked Vader and were easily cut down by the Sith Lord. Vader then had Ochi use Valance and the assassins as bait to draw the remaining Dawners and Romodi's forces to [Oro Sankeria](/wiki/Oro_Sankeria "Oro Sankeria"). As the Dawners and Imperials fought one another, they were suddenly wiped out by a pulse bomb, thus eliminating many of Vader's enemies. Vader informed Sabé that Crimson Dawn and Romodi feared him now. When he asked Sabé if she was scared, Sabé asked him why she should be scared of his true self, Anakin Skywalker.[[452]](#cite_note-DV_2020_22-452)
