Upon assembling his army, Vader returned to Mustafar with several of the droids, including ZED-6-7, Arex, and members of the Crush Pirates. Other droids from his new army were brought to the *Executor* for repairs.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) In his castle, he tested himself against a training droid and requested another when he destroyed it.[[479]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_1-479) He also tested his control over the Force, but one of his attempts resulted in his power exploding out without control as soon as he tried.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) However, thanks to the Zaly Shield, Vader was slowly but surely regaining control over his powers.[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) Unknown to all, a new threat was emerging:[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) when Vader and Sidious left the Amaxine Station, they left behind the disc dropped by the Fermata Cage, allowing the Spark Eternal to flee into it.[[257]](#cite_note-HE_5-257) The merging of the Spark and the ancient droid created a new threat: the [Scourge](/wiki/Scourge "Scourge"). The Scourge quickly corrupted the droids of *Imperial I*-class Star Destroyer[[479]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_1-479) [*Chelator*](/wiki/Scourge_01 "Scourge 01"),[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488) which had been sent by Palpatine to collect everything from the station,[[479]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_1-479) and then spread across the galaxy by corrupting droids as the "[scourge of the droids](/wiki/Scourge_crisis "Scourge crisis")."[[489]](#cite_note-220_Launchpad-489)

 [![A Scourge-infected DT-series droid ambushes Darth Vader while he is within his Fortress Vader bacta tank.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/ScourgeAttacksVader-DarkDroids3.png/revision/latest?cb=20240103173818) [![A Scourge-infected DT-series droid ambushes Darth Vader while he is within his Fortress Vader bacta tank.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/ScourgeAttacksVader-DarkDroids3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240103173818)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/ScourgeAttacksVader-DarkDroids3.png/revision/latest?cb=20240103173818) 

A Scourge-infected DT-series droid ambushes Darth Vader while he is within his Fortress Vader bacta tank.

 

The Scourge soon set its sights on assimilating organics[[490]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_2-490) and controlling the Force itself. Thus, it targeted Vader, whose cyborg nature left him liable to the corruption,[[480]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_Target_Vader-480) after Luke Skywalker namedropped Vader as a cyborg who could use the Force to a Scourge-corrupted C-3PO. After taking a moment to sit atop his throne,[[490]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_2-490) Vader removed his armor and rested within his bacta tank, where he was guarded by two Royal Guards. In secret, the Scourge, using information collected from Imperial databanks and from across its minds, [infiltrated](/wiki/Scourge_attack_on_Fortress_Vader "Scourge attack on Fortress Vader") Fortress Vader via a mouse droid that contained a [spider-droid](/wiki/Spider-droid "Spider-droid"),[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488) with which the Scourge could spread itself,[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) and infected several [DT-series sentry droids](/wiki/DT-series_sentry_droid "DT-series sentry droid") stationed in the castle. As Vader rested within his bacta tank, two DT-series units ambushed the Sith Lord by murdering the guards and shattering the bacta tank, dragging the out-of-armor Sith Lord across the floor via straps used to suspend him within the tank.[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488) While his control over the Force was still lacking,[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486) Vader tried to summon his nearby lightsaber, which was instead caught by one of the DT units despite causing some minor damage to their back.[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488)

One of the DT droids then punched Vader before both threw him against the wall. However, the Scourge suddenly had to refocus its conscious on the *Chelator*, which it had renamed '*Scourge* 01 and turned into its command ship, upon realizing the vessel was under [attack](/wiki/Attack_on_Scourge_01 "Attack on Scourge 01") from the[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488) [warrior-priest droid](/wiki/Warrior-priest_droid "Warrior-priest droid")[[491]](#cite_note-Uncover_Dark_Droids-491) [Ajax Sigma](/wiki/Ajax_Sigma "Ajax Sigma") and his [Second Revelation](/wiki/Second_Revelation "Second Revelation") followers.[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488)

 [![Vader lifts himself with the Force and crushes his attackers.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c1/VaderDefeatsScourgedDroids-DarkDroids3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231018194403) [![Vader lifts himself with the Force and crushes his attackers.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c1/VaderDefeatsScourgedDroids-DarkDroids3.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/280?cb=20231018194403)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c1/VaderDefeatsScourgedDroids-DarkDroids3.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20231018194403) 

Vader lifts himself with the Force and crushes his attackers.

 

With the droids before him distracted as the Scourge debated where to focus itself, an angered Vader began to levitate with the Force and stared down his attackers, crushing both with the Force just as the Scourge totally refocused itself on fighting off Sigma's attack. Afterward, Vader rested against the wall, only to snap to focus when the spider-droid jumped at him: after its victory over Sigma, the Scourge, which learned the secret to controlling organic life was turning its transmission into a heart-beat-like frequency, refocused itself on Vader and attempted to infect him, but Vader crushed the small spider-droid with the Force, leaving him alone in the room with destroyed droids. While the Scourge had found cyborgs in the form of Magna Tolvan, Beilert Valance, and [Lobot](/wiki/Lobot "Lobot"),[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488) it continued to lust after Vader,[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486) whose memories, knowledge, and sensitivity to the Force made him especially valuable.[[488]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_3-488)

#### Conflict for the *Executor*

:   "*Lord Vader! Something's happened to the droids! They've been* possessed*! And if they get close enough, they will compromise* your *droids!*"  
    "*Do not presume, Admiral Piett…that I would repeat* your *failures.*"
:   ―Firmus Piett and Darth Vader[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26)

Back in his armor and outside, where he was joined by his own droid followers, Vader continued testing his control of the Force without holding the Kyberite Zay shield. He managed to suspend Ought-Six in the air for 2.3 seconds before losing control and destroying him, marking some progress in controlling the Force again. Arex suggested meditating like the Jedi to increase his concentration, which Vader decried as weakness. ZED-6-7 then interrupted Vader to inform him of a call from Amedda, who relayed an order from the Emperor to secure the hijacked *Executor*:[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) in its second attempt[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486) to get to Vader, the Scourge had infiltrated the Sith Lord's flagship and corrupted the members Vader's new droid army aboard. The corrupted droids slaughtered the Imperial crew and forced the survivors to flee to the bridge, from which the droids hoped the organics would call Vader once he came aboard. On Mustafar, Vader also revealed to Amedda he had reprogrammed the droid uprising and demonstrated his powers by blasting apart Ought-Six and another crush pirate with the Zaly Shield, promising he had never been stronger. Ordered by Amedda to reach out when they arrived at the *Executor* and with ZED-6-7 promising Ought-Six the destroyed units would be rebuild once again, Vader made his way back to his castle before leaving for the *Executor* in the droids' ship.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26)

As Vader and his droid servants flew towards the *Executor*, ZED-6-7 discovered that the majority of the flagship's crew had been killed before a group of TIE fighters piloted by Imperial astromech droids attacked their transport, firing upon it as a distraction before crashing into it. Refusing Ought-Six's request to retreat, Vader then rammed their ship into the side of the *Executor*, boarding the hijacked dreadnaught and getting contact from Piett, who informed him of the droid "possession." Armed with the Zay shield, Vader fired blasts at the corrupted battle droids and led his droid servants in battle towards a command center, where Vader shorted out several B1s, but also the control panel, with his staff. Without the hours needed to repair the command line to shut down all droids aboard, as Piett and the crew had mere minutes by ZED-6-7's count, Arex urged Vader to remember his Jedi training and repair the panels, as he had with himself on the river moon of Al'doleem. Vader gave ZED-6-7 the Zaly Shield and attempted to repair the machinery with the Force, only to fail before Arex again encouraged him to remember his Jedi past. Bombarded by visions of his past, Vader lashed out in anger and crushed Arex after another failed attempt to repair the panels.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26)

 [![Darth Vader leads his forces in a direct attack against the corrupted droids on the Executor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/VaderShieldBlast-2020DarthVader37.png/revision/latest?cb=20240323182001) [![Darth Vader leads his forces in a direct attack against the corrupted droids on the Executor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/VaderShieldBlast-2020DarthVader37.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240323182001)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/VaderShieldBlast-2020DarthVader37.png/revision/latest?cb=20240323182001) 

Darth Vader leads his forces in a direct attack against the corrupted droids on the *Executor*.

 

Without the ability to shut off the droids via the command line, Vader decided to lead his droids in a direct attack against the possessed droids. Vader and his minions fought a horde of corrupted B1s and B2s[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) until Vader directed Gee-Ninety and a rebuilt Arex to cover ZED-6-7 and Ought-Six, who together worked on repairing the command line. Although Vader would find himself swarmed by the corrupted battle droids, he kept up his defense until ZED-6-7 brought him a message from Piett; amid the battle, an Imperial fleet of five Star Destroyers had approached the *Executor*[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) and moved in to destroy Vader's flagship to contain the Scourge on the orders of Amedda,[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) who lacked faith in Vader and argued the ship was lost[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) due to the lack of contact from the Sith Lord or the ship's rapidly dying crew.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) Above those reasons, however,[[492]](#cite_note-DV_2020_41-492) Amedda believed he had a chance to kill Vader once and for all[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486) with the Scourge as a convenient excuse.[[492]](#cite_note-DV_2020_41-492) Vader, however, ordered Piett to stand his ground before re-engaging the attacking droids. Fortunately for the *Executor*'s crew, the outside fleet was under the command of Admiral Corleque,[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) the very same admiral Vader had clashed with during his race to Exegol,[[435]](#cite_note-DV_2020_10-435) who delayed the order to destroy the *Executor* to instead rescue Piett and company, intending to fire on the *Executor* once his former commanding officer was clear.[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487)

Corlque's rescue team, however, only succeeded in supplying the Scourge with a supply of KX-series security droids, which the Scourge used to murder the rescuers as Vader picked off the last of the corrupted battle droids. After wiping out the last battle droids with a blast from the Zaly Shield, Vader took a moment to recompose himself before requesting an update from ZED and Ought-Six, who were nearly finished with the failsafe. Suddenly, however, the Scourge used a surviving RA-7 series droid to taught Vader and offer him a chance at assimilation, distracting the Sith Lord while a spider-droid tried to drop on Vader. After ZED destroyed the spider-unit, the Scourge attacked Vader and his droids its KX-series droid bodies until the ZED activated the signal on Vader's order, shutting down all droids aboard the *Executor*, including themselves. Vader took the moment to survey the battlefield his ship had become. While Piett and his crew contacted Corleque, who expressed surprise at Vader's survival, the Sith Lord departed for Mustafar aboard his TIE Advanced with the heads of ZED, Ought-Six, Arex, and Gee-Ninety, intending to rebuild them once more. Just as Corleque tried to confirm Vader's destination for Amedda, the Scourge attacked his bridge with corrupted B2s, forcing the *Executor* and the fleet to destroy Corleque's flagship,[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) the *[Unbreakable](/wiki/Unbreakable "Unbreakable")*.[[387]](#cite_note-Rise_and_Fall-387)

#### Who to hate

:   "*You finally looked* deep enough*… to find* yourself*… the person you* hate *the* most*.*"  
    "*Yes, master. And then I looked* deeper*.*"  
    "*Eh? Ah, then I will see you soon.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious speaks to Darth Vader through the Force[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486)

Vader returned to Mustafar and handed off the heads of his droid minions to another droid before leaving, much to the confusion of the droid he met upon landing, to meet with the Eye of Webbish Bog for help in securing control. Reminded that he was a Sith by the Eye and should be taking whatever he wanted by force, Vader attacked the Eye with a blast of electricity from his staff to try and regain his control, which the Eye promised would yield no results. Instead, the Eye advised Vader to go after Sidious by reminding him of the Tragedy of Darth Plagueis the Wise. Vader agreed with the plan and united with his rebuilt droid minions, minus ZED-6-7, by a *Lambda*-class T-4a shuttle for a journey to Palpatine's Palace on Coruscant,[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) waiting to depart until ZED returned.[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486) However, ZED had been overtaken by the Scourge, which in turn used him to find the lost [Techno Union droid factory](/wiki/Techno_Union_droid_factory "Techno Union droid factory") and corrupt a massive Octuptarra tri-droid.[[487]](#cite_note-DV_2020_38-487) As Vader and his droids tried to contact ZED, Arex raised the possibility to Vader that ZED had been corrupted, which was confirmed when the Scourge [appeared as ZED and the Octuptarra](/wiki/Attack_on_Vader "Attack on Vader"), which was protected against Vader's electrical staff and Zaly Shield blasts.[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486)

 [![Darth Vader attempts to defend himself against the Scourge's octuptarra body](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fd/VaderAttacked-2020DarthVader39.png/revision/latest?cb=20240323183001) [![Darth Vader attempts to defend himself against the Scourge's octuptarra body](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fd/VaderAttacked-2020DarthVader39.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240323183001)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fd/VaderAttacked-2020DarthVader39.png/revision/latest?cb=20240323183001) 

Darth Vader attempts to defend himself against the Scourge's octuptarra body

 

Unable to simply tear the Octuptarra apart with the Force as he still lacked control, Vader tried to defend against the machine's stomps with the shield before being kicked into a wall. Vader re-engaged the Octuptarra, using the Zaly shield to block a blaster shot, as the Scourge taunted him about its plan to infect him. Arex attempted to attack the corrupted ZED but was grabbed by the throat and studied by the Scourge, which learned the Jedi teaching "hate leads to suffering" from Arex's databank. The remark reminded Vader of his belief that hate actually led to power, only for the Sith Lord to be kicked back again. From Vader's remark, however, Arex decided to increase Vader's hate by attacking him with Gee-Ninety, which Ought-Six decided to stay out of. Their attempt failed, with Vader simply responding to them with random Zaly shield blasts, so Arex asked him to consider what he truly hated; as a volley of blasts from the Octuptarra destroyed the ground under him and he tried to defend himself with the kyberite shield, Vader remembered the Jedi Order's failure to free himself and his mother, his own failure to save his mother, and his Force choking of Padmé Amidala.[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486)

Using his hatred of himself as fuel, Vader regained control of the Force and threw the Octuptarra back on its side, allowing him to slice it apart with his lightsaber. While ZED's form was damaged, the Scourge spoke to Vader as he approached it, assuming that Vader had used a hatred of it to regain his Force powers. In response, Vader silently decapitated ZED as Arex declared the Scourge was nothing. Vader then lifted Arex into the air, where the droid claimed the Force was everything. Vader responded by striking Arex, but not destroying him, with his lightsaber to prove that it was actually himself who was everything. Vader then returned to his castle and entered his bacta tank under the protection of two Royal Guards. As he healed, Vader reached out to Sidious on Coruscant through the Force to reveal he had looked even deeper in himself, which taught him he hated his master more than he hated even himself.[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486) Vader made his way to Coruscant aboard his TIE Advanced, with a collection of Scourged disc droids aboard the fighter,[[493]](#cite_note-DV_2020_40-493) to teach his master a lesson.[[486]](#cite_note-DV_2020_39-486)

### The Past's struggles

 [![Vader force chokes a one-armed wampa while fighting off an entire pack.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1b/VaderVsWampas-ReturnToHoth.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250220161325) [![Vader force chokes a one-armed wampa while fighting off an entire pack.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1b/VaderVsWampas-ReturnToHoth.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250220161325)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1b/VaderVsWampas-ReturnToHoth.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250220161325) 

Vader force chokes a one-armed wampa while fighting off an entire pack.

 

At one point, Vader was contacted by an Imperial General, who informed him that one of the remaining probe droids on Hoth had been destroyed. When the General suggested sending an Imperial detachment to investigate, Vader said he would go himself. The General offered to send backup with him, though Vader insisted that he would be enough. Upon arriving at the ruins of Echo Base, Vader discovered the probe, as well as the wampas that had destroyed it. His suit damaged during the struggle, Vader barely managed to escape the pack of wampas and cut his way inside of an abandoned AT-AT. As the wampas surrounded him, Vader regained his strength and leapt out of the wreckage before slaying the wampas with his lightsaber. He was then retrieved by his forces and repaired aboard the *Executor*. Following this, the General remarked to Vader that he should have brought backup like he suggested, to which Vader snapped his neck with the Force.[[494]](#cite_note-Return_to_Hoth-494)

At another stage, Vader, seemingly on a mission to wipe out all knowledge of his deceased wife, made his way back to Naboo, entering and destroying the lake side retreat where Amidala had once lived[[495]](#cite_note-Legacy4-495) and that he had visited with Sabé during their post-Cloud City journey together.[[425]](#cite_note-DV_2020_3-425) In his rampage, he allowed the flood waters to claim the building, which would remain standing but was left in a ruined state. Vader then made his way across Naboo and slaughtered any who dared to invoke Amidala's memory. The people of Naboo would go onto remember Vader as a spirit of death who had descended upon their world, with many choosing to abandon the entire segment of Naboo where the lakeside retreat stood, lest they bring back the "demon," which left the old building totally abandoned. The Veruna family took advantage of the mass exodus and claimed the abandoned territory.[[495]](#cite_note-Legacy4-495)

### Redemption

#### Gambit in the Endor system

:   "*Obi-Wan once thought as you do. You don't know the power of the dark side. I* must *obey my master.*"  
    "*I will not turn, and you'll be forced to kill me.*"  
    "*If that is your destiny.*"  
    "*Search your feelings, father. You can't do this. I feel the conflict within you. Let go of your hate!*"  
    "*It is too late for me, son. The Emperor will show you the true nature of the Force.* He *is your master now.*"  
    "*Then my father is* truly *dead.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Luke Skywalker[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

With his designs against his master having failed,[[496]](#cite_note-DV_2020_50-496) Vader resigned himself to servitude: to Vader, Sidious was simply too powerful for him to overthrow, which the defeated Vader felt left him no choice but to obey his Sith Master. Vader and Sidious also plotted to turn Skywalker to the dark side; as Vader understood the current plan, Skywalker was to be turned to the dark side as a third member of the Sith Order, who was to be trained by Sidious. In truth, however, Sidious hoped to replace Vader as his apprentice with Skywalker.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) Vader was eager to search for his son[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) and believed his son had no choice but to serve the Emperor, just as he thought about himself.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

Per his master's plan to counter the Alliance operation that sought to destroy the [DS-2 Death Star II Mobile Battle Station](/wiki/DS-2_Death_Star_II_Mobile_Battle_Station "DS-2 Death Star II Mobile Battle Station")[[100]](#cite_note-Ultimate_SW-100) Vader was sent to the [Endor system](/wiki/Endor_system "Endor system") to notify Moff [Tiaan Jerjerrod](/wiki/Tiaan_Jerjerrod "Tiaan Jerjerrod") of the Emperor's arrival, and that he was to complete its construction on time, even if he needed more men.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) Indeed, the Emperor arrived weeks later and was greeted by Vader, Jerjerrod, hundreds of officers and stormtroopers lined up to honor him. Satisfied with the Death Star's state, the Emperor sensed Vader's wish to continue his search for his son, but told him to have patience, much to Vader's displeasure.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33)

 [![According to a story told later in galactic history, Vader fought zombies aboard the second Death Star.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/VaderKillingZombies-TalesFromTheDeathStar.png/revision/latest?cb=20240315131913) [![According to a story told later in galactic history, Vader fought zombies aboard the second Death Star.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/VaderKillingZombies-TalesFromTheDeathStar.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240315131913)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/VaderKillingZombies-TalesFromTheDeathStar.png/revision/latest?cb=20240315131913) 

According to a story told later in galactic history, Vader fought zombies aboard the second Death Star.

 

According to a story told by the [Espirion](/wiki/Espirion_(species) "Espirion (species)") [Saan](/wiki/Saan "Saan"), Vader's demand to complete the Death Star without supplying more men began to be met when an Imperial engineer named [Aklin](/wiki/Aklin "Aklin") used a [Sith ring](/wiki/Unidentified_ring "Unidentified ring") stolen from Palpatine's collection to resurrect dead workers as zombies. According to the story, as Vader met with Jerjerrod to mention that the Emperor was pleased, he noticed a strange looking Imperial officer—in truth one of the zombies—so ignored Jerjerrod to investigate. Vader entered a room to see a Death Star trooper being attacked by a horde of the zombies. Vader killed many of the zombies with his lightsaber and eventually found Aklin. Vader took the Sith ring Aklin used but let the zombies remain, intending to keep the zombies "alive" until the station was complete. As they attacked Aklin, Vader left to return the ring to Palpatine's collection.[[497]](#cite_note-TftDS-497)

Vader complied with Palpatine's orders and remained on the *Executor* despite intelligence reports of the [Alliance Fleet](/wiki/Rebel_Alliance_Navy "Rebel Alliance Navy") massing near [Sullust](/wiki/Sullust "Sullust"). During his stay on the Super Star Destroyer, the Rebel shuttle *[Tydirium](/wiki/Tydirium "Tydirium")* requested permission to land on the [forest](/wiki/Tree "Tree") moon of [Endor](/wiki/Endor "Endor"); Vader allowed it sensing Luke's presence in it.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

 [![Luke surrendered himself to attempt to turn his Father to the light.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2a/IWillNotTurn-Transformations.png/revision/latest?cb=20200724144704) [![Luke surrendered himself to attempt to turn his Father to the light.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2a/IWillNotTurn-Transformations.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200724144704)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2a/IWillNotTurn-Transformations.png/revision/latest?cb=20200724144704) 

Luke surrendered himself to attempt to turn his Father to the light.

 

Restless after sensing his son,[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) Vader returned to his master's side and reported the shuttle's arrival and his son's presence with it. The Emperor allowed him to land on Endor at the [shield generator base](/wiki/Death_Star%27s_shield_generator "Death Star's shield generator"), where he was to await Luke, who according to the Emperor, would come to him. He complied with his orders and landed on Endor with the [*Lambda*-class T-4a shuttle](/wiki/Lambda-class_T-4a_shuttle "Lambda-class T-4a shuttle") *[ST 321](/wiki/ST_321 "ST 321")*; as predicted by Sidious, during the night Luke surrendered himself in an attempt to talk to him and bring him back to the [light side](/wiki/Light_side_of_the_Force "Light side of the Force"). Although Vader complimented his son's skills with the Force and his skills in building a lightsaber, he refused his son's pleas. Rebuffed, Luke said his father's identity as Anakin Skywalker was "truly dead" as Vader sent Luke to the Emperor.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

#### One last duel

:   "*Your thoughts betray you, Father. I feel the good in you, the conflict.*"  
    "*There is no conflict.*"  
    "*You couldn't bring yourself to kill me before, and I don't believe you'll destroy me now.*"  
    "*You underestimate the power of the dark side. If you will not fight, then you will meet your destiny!*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Darth Vader[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

 [![Father and son fight as the Emperor watches.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e8/RotJ-DeathStarDuel.png/revision/latest?cb=20140411235719) [![Father and son fight as the Emperor watches.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e8/RotJ-DeathStarDuel.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/287?cb=20140411235719)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e8/RotJ-DeathStarDuel.png/revision/latest?cb=20140411235719) 

Father and son fight as the Emperor watches.

 

Vader escorted his son to the Death Star and into the [Emperor's throne room](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Throne_Room "Emperor's Throne Room"). Shortly afterward, the Alliance Fleet arrived to find that the [SLD-26 planetary shield generator](/wiki/SLD-26_planetary_shield_generator "SLD-26 planetary shield generator")[[100]](#cite_note-Ultimate_SW-100) was still operational and protecting the Death Star. As the [battle](/wiki/Battle_of_Endor "Battle of Endor") between the Imperial and Rebel fleets raged, and the Endor strike team sought to destroy the Endor base, the Emperor tempted Luke to give in to his anger. In a moment of weakness, Luke lashed out, but Vader stopped his strike and dueled him once again. Throughout the duel, the two seemed to be evenly matched, but Vader was not trying to kill Luke, only to lead him closer to the dark side. This succeeded when Luke used the dark side to overwhelm his father and kick him down several stairs. When the Emperor told him to use his anger again, Luke realized what he had done and took a more defensive position. Eventually, Vader telepathically sensed the existence of his daughter and Luke's twin sister, Leia, and threatened to corrupt her instead. Only then did his son lose control and viciously attack him, cutting Vader's right hand off and knocking him down.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

Vader was then betrayed by the Emperor, who demanded Luke to finish Vader and take Vader's place at his side.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) Vader waited for Luke to kill him, as it was the way of the Sith to destroy the weak, and believed that Luke would replace him, just like Vader had replaced Dooku decades earlier.[[4]](#cite_note-backstories-4) Luke, realizing that he was becoming what he sought to destroy,[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) threw his [lightsaber](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker%27s_green_lightsaber "Luke Skywalker's green lightsaber") aside and declared himself a Jedi, just as Anakin Skywalker had been before him. Infuriated, the Emperor unleashed continuous streams of Force lightning against Luke, intending to torture him to death. Luke begged Vader to save him.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) Vader knew that his son would die, viewing it as the price Luke would pay for his weakness. However, he began to question whether it was really weakness, since Luke had shown him mercy. He also saw how Luke still believed that there was good in him.[[4]](#cite_note-backstories-4) Vader became conflicted over whether to save his son, or continue to serve his master,[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) similar to when he chose Sidious over Windu 23 years earlier.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

 [![Darth Vader has a change of heart when he sees his son being tortured by his master.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/DarthVaderEyes-LINEWebtoon.png/revision/latest?cb=20241022134249) [![Darth Vader has a change of heart when he sees his son being tortured by his master.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/DarthVaderEyes-LINEWebtoon.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/287?cb=20241022134249)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/DarthVaderEyes-LINEWebtoon.png/revision/latest?cb=20241022134249) 

Darth Vader has a change of heart when he sees his son being tortured by his master.

 

Hearing his son's plea for help again, Vader returned to the light and chose to save Luke. He grabbed the Emperor with what was left of his arms and lifted his master high in the air, lumbering toward the reactor shaft.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) Surprised[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) but angered by his apprentice's betrayal, the Emperor turned a yet more powerful lightning attack on Vader, now Anakin once again; in his hatred, his only thought was to cause his now-former apprentice more pain, even though he could still have used his powers to save himself.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) At the cost of the Emperor heavily damaging his life-supporting armor, Anakin hurled his former master down into the reactor to his death. The persona of Darth Vader was no more, and Anakin Skywalker, Jedi Knight, was reborn. By killing Darth Sidious and ending the Sith's reign,[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) the redeemed Jedi brought balance to the Force and thus fulfilled his destiny as the Chosen One, which Qui-Gon Jinn had projected 35 years earlier.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33)

#### Death

:   "*Now, go, my son. Leave me.*"  
    "*No. You're coming with me. I'll not leave you here. I've got to save you!*"  
    "*You already have, Luke. You were right. You were right about me. Tell your sister you were right.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker and Luke Skywalker — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/4f/YouWereRight.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250408140447)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:YouWereRight.flac "File:YouWereRight.flac"))[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

 [![Anakin Skywalker in his final moments with his son](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/aa/Anakinredeemed.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017145623) [![Anakin Skywalker in his final moments with his son](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/aa/Anakinredeemed.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/291?cb=20201017145623)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/aa/Anakinredeemed.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017145623) 

Anakin Skywalker in his final moments with his son

 

Just before Calrissian on the *Falcon* and Wedge Antilles destroyed the Death Star's main reactor, Skywalker was carried by his son to the Imperial shuttle *ST 321*,[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) where he asked Luke to remove his mask; for a moment, Anakin looked upon his son's face for the first and only time.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) He finally saw him not as a Jedi, or a threat, or a mistake, but as his and Amidala's son, and gave Luke a real smile—the smile that only his wife ever saw.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) As Kenobi and Yoda appeared to Anakin behind Luke, smiling down at the redeemed Skywalker,[[498]](#cite_note-Line_Webtoon-498) Luke insisted that he had to save him, but Skywalker told him he already had and asked him to tell his sister he had been right about him. He smiled at his son.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

As he died, Skywalker tried to speak to Amidala, telling her of how their son had saved him before trying to apologize, but he passed on before he could finish the thought,[[498]](#cite_note-Line_Webtoon-498) dying in the arms of his son while Imperial forces panicked around them, unconcerned with the fate of their former lord. However, Anakin's soul would survive death;[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) his heroic sacrifice allowed his spirit to be preserved in the Force by Kenobi and Yoda.[[32]](#cite_note-DB-bio-32) With the death of Anakin Skywalker, Luke took his father's body aboard the shuttle and escaped just before the Death Star's destruction. Back on Endor, Skywalker built a funeral pyre for his redeemed father, and [cremated him](/wiki/Funeral_of_Anakin_Skywalker "Funeral of Anakin Skywalker") in the manner of a [Jedi's funeral](/wiki/Jedi_funeral "Jedi funeral") in solitude,[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) for the sight of Vader's helmet consumed by fire would be cause for rejoicing to everyone but him.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) Having fulfilled his destiny and saving his son, Anakin joined Yoda and Obi Wan, once again a hero,[[3]](#cite_note-TSWB-3) though unsung to everyone except in the eyes of Luke.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33)

### Post-death

#### Appearing on Endor

As his son set the pyre ablaze to burn his armor,[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) he was found by C-3PO and R2-D2, who invited him back to an [Ewok](/wiki/Ewok "Ewok") [village](/wiki/Bright_Tree_Village "Bright Tree Village") to celebrate their victory.[[498]](#cite_note-Line_Webtoon-498) As Luke rejoined his friends and sister, Leia at an amid the celebrations, Skywalker returned from the [Netherworld of the Force](/wiki/Netherworld_of_the_Force "Netherworld of the Force") in his pre-fall form alongside Yoda and Obi-Wan Kenobi.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) All three at peace for balance had returned to the Force, they smiled at Luke—pleased to know that, despite the best efforts of the Emperor, the Jedi had returned. Each thought to warn Luke about the future, as each saw that there was yet much danger ahead for him and more darkness to overcome; instead, they decided not to burden him with this then. Luke, in turn, saw them and felt their approval and their sense of peace.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33)

Skywalker then asked his two mentors whether Luke would end up alright. Kenobi responded, noting that it was possible, given that he had been alright thus far.[[498]](#cite_note-Line_Webtoon-498) For the next years, Anakin's spirit, alongside Obi-Wan and Yoda, continued to guide Luke.[[499]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-499)

#### Ghosts of Vader's castle

 [![Upon fulfilling his destiny as the Chosen One, Anakin Skywalker learned how to retain his individuality after death.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5b/AnakinGhost-GhostsOfVadersCastle5.png/revision/latest?cb=20211025001242) [![Upon fulfilling his destiny as the Chosen One, Anakin Skywalker learned how to retain his individuality after death.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5b/AnakinGhost-GhostsOfVadersCastle5.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/214?cb=20211025001242)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5b/AnakinGhost-GhostsOfVadersCastle5.png/revision/latest?cb=20211025001242) 

Upon fulfilling his destiny as the Chosen One, Anakin Skywalker learned how to retain his individuality after death.

 

Following the Battle of Endor, Vader's castle remained standing on Mustafar, and his former servant, Vaneé, was freed from the captivity the Sith Lord had placed him into when two young Mustafarians, [Tuttel](/wiki/Tuttel "Tuttel") and [Giggek](/wiki/Giggek "Giggek"), tried to destroy the fortress. Surviving the blast[[226]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_Vader's_Castle-226) but breathing in the unfiltered [lava fumes](/wiki/Lava_fume "Lava fume") of Mustafar, Vaneé began to hallucinate that which he feared the most, his master; Vaneé thought he was hearing the voice of Vader and that he could help resurrect his master. After using nightmares to lure [Lina Graf's crew](/wiki/Lina_Graf%27s_crew "Lina Graf's crew") to Fortress Vader, Vaneé began the process to restore Vader, yet Rebel officer [Lina Graf](/wiki/Lina_Graf "Lina Graf"), having realized that the servant was only hallucinating, pretended as if she was the reborn Vader to be freed, then turning on Vaneé and freeing her companions.[[500]](#cite_note-Ghosts_5-500)

Vaneé was again left imprisoned in Fortress Vader, forced to breath in the lava fumes and hallucinate nightmarish visions of Vader. Meanwhile, Graf tried to use the lightsaber given to her by Vaneé to lead her crew out of the castle, yet the blade failed to activate when she needed it. Instead, the true Force spirit of Anakin Skywalker intervened, appearing in the fumes and making a lightsaber appear in his hands. Unable to see the face of their savior, the crew assumed it was Graf and followed the light of the blade outside to safety. As the crew left Mustafar aboard the *[Rabbit's Foot](/wiki/Rabbit%27s_Foot "Rabbit's Foot")*, they were left to speculate whose lightsaber they had seen in the fumes; Skywalker, standing on the surface of Mustafar with the lightsaber he had summoned still drawn, laughed to himself when Graf claimed she knew ghosts did not exist.[[500]](#cite_note-Ghosts_5-500)

#### Encountering Ahsoka Tano

##### Final training session

:   "*Tell me what's going on.*"  
    "*I'm here to finish your training.*"  
    "*It's a little late for that.*"  
    "*One is never too old to learn, Snips.*"
:   ―Ahsoka Tano and Anakin Skywalker[[501]](#cite_note-Part_Five-501)

 [![Anakin Skywalker completed Ahsoka Tano's training in the World Between Worlds](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/Anakin_Ahsoka_Training.png/revision/latest?cb=20230926175015) [![Anakin Skywalker completed Ahsoka Tano's training in the World Between Worlds](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/Anakin_Ahsoka_Training.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230926175015)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/Anakin_Ahsoka_Training.png/revision/latest?cb=20230926175015) 

Anakin Skywalker completed Ahsoka Tano's training in the World Between Worlds

 

Around [9 ABY](/wiki/9_ABY "9 ABY"),[[502]](#cite_note-Ahsoka_date-502) after Luke Skywalker and Ahsoka Tano had met whilst the former began his Jedi Academy, Tano engaged on a quest to find a compass that would lead to Peridea, the rumored location of Grand Admiral Thrawn, in the hope of preventing the beginning of another war and the return of the Empire. Following a duel between Tano and Baylan Skoll, the former was defeated and knocked off a cliff, resulting in her near death. However, Tano awoke in the World Between Worlds, where Anakin Skywalker awaited her. Skywalker greeted her, though her back was turned causing her to call out in confusion. Skywalker then stated that he was not expecting to see her so soon. Tano finally turned around and saw Skywalker, before saying his name in shock, causing Skywalker to smile.[[503]](#cite_note-Part_4-503) Tano once again said his name, before claiming that he looked as she remembered him. Skywalker responded that she had grown old, which Tano chuckled about before stating that it was a part of life.[[501]](#cite_note-Part_Five-501)

When Tano asked why she had come to the World Between Worlds, Skywalker reminded Tano that she had lost her fight with Baylan Skoll and told her that he was there to finish her training. While Tano stated her belief that it was too late for Skywalker to teach her, he asserted that one was never too old to learn. When Tano asked what her lesson would be, Skywalker ignited his lightsaber and attacked Tano, telling her that it was time to live or die. When Tano told her old master that she would not fight him, Skywalker said that he had [heard that before](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker"); as Skywalker continued his assault, Tano ignited her lightsaber and defended herself. As Tano and Skywalker continued their duel in the World Between Worlds, Tano held her own and suggested that perhaps her master didn't have anything left to offer her. Skywalker, smiling, said that he hadn't taught her everything before slicing the platform beneath Tano, sending her falling into the depths below.[[501]](#cite_note-Part_Five-501)

 [![Skywalker would present the Clone Wars to Ahsoka, where the two would revisit their past](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/Acme-VisionsofthePast.png/revision/latest?cb=20240416001148) [![Skywalker would present the Clone Wars to Ahsoka, where the two would revisit their past](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/Acme-VisionsofthePast.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20240416001148)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/75/Acme-VisionsofthePast.png/revision/latest?cb=20240416001148) 

Skywalker would present the Clone Wars to Ahsoka, where the two would revisit their past

 

Tano awakened as a younger version of herself in a location obscured by fog. As clone troopers in Phase I armor, many of the 501st legion, ran by her, she was greeted by Skywalker, now wearing armor and appearing as he did when she first met him; he confirmed that they were witnessing a battle from the Clone Wars. Tano didn't understand why they would be experiencing one of her first missions, which Skywalker said was the problem; as her master headed into battle, Tano ignited her original green lightsaber and followed him for answers. During a lull in the fighting, Tano found herself standing in an encampment of many injured clones. Finding a clone on a stretcher with a bandaged head, Tano rested her hand on the trooper, who reached with his own hand.[[501]](#cite_note-Part_Five-501)

Skywalker found her and warned that more Separatist battle droids were approaching. Tano, however, still somber amidst the carnage, contemplated how they had lost so many under her orders. Skywalker offered masterly insight; he reminded Tano that they were in a war and that it was a Jedi's job to lead, but affirmed that the mistakes and losses weighed heavy on him. Skywalker explained how he had to teach his Padawan to be a soldier despite his upbringing as a keeper of the peace. Tano wondered if fighting was the only thing she would have to teach her own Padawan one day, but Skywalker pushed that fighting was how one survived. As explosions appeared in the distance, Tano mused that she might want to stop fighting, which Skywalker said would mean that she would die. As Skywalker advanced once more into battle, his appearance flashed between his Jedi self and his Sith identity of Darth Vader.[[501]](#cite_note-Part_Five-501)

 [![Anakin and Ahsoka revisited the Siege of Mandalore.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/43/Anakin_and_Ahsoka_at_the_siege_of_Mandalore.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230915205335) [![Anakin and Ahsoka revisited the Siege of Mandalore.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/43/Anakin_and_Ahsoka_at_the_siege_of_Mandalore.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230915205335)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/43/Anakin_and_Ahsoka_at_the_siege_of_Mandalore.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230915205335) 

Anakin and Ahsoka revisited the Siege of Mandalore.

 

As Tano continued to relive her past, she battled Mandalorian super commandos at the Siege of Mandalore alongside clone troopers of the 332nd company. Clone Commander Rex spotted Tano, complementing her on her work before charging forward. Tano paused, surveying the battle as Skywalker approached her, saying that he did not recognize the battle currently unfolding. Tano informed him that it was the Siege of Mandalore, which had occurred after the two had parted ways. Skywalker proudly affirmed that Tano did well. Though Skywalker explained that Tano was the culmination of Skywalker's knowledge and the legacy of masters before him, Tano believed that her part of that legacy was one of death and war. Skywalker asserted that both he and Tano were more than that, but Tano recalled how Anakin had been more powerful and dangerous than anyone could have realized. At the mention of his fall, Skywalker said that Tano had learned nothing and reminded her of the choice he had given her: to live or to die. Skywalker ignited his lightsaber again, revealing a red blade and yellow eyes. Tano once again attempted to refuse a fight, but Skywalker pressed on, and the two dueled viciously.[[501]](#cite_note-Part_Five-501)

Skywalker kicked Tano back into the inky darkness of the World Between Worlds as his form shifted back and forth to his helmeted Sith persona. Enraged by Tano's lack of conviction, Skywalker battered down Tano with strike after strike, claiming that it was time for her to die. Tano outmaneuvered Skywalker and took his lightsaber, holding it to his neck; however, she dropped the lightsaber into the void, saying that she chose to live. Satisfied, Skywalker smiled, bowing his head as his eyes returned to their normal state, and said that there was hope for her yet. As the World Between Worlds rumbled, Skywalker disappeared, and the mysterious plane slowly filled with water, enveloping Tano as she closed her eyes. Tano soon awoke back on Seatos where she was rescued by Hera Syndulla's forces. Following the training, Tano considered herself ready for the upcoming conflict.[[501]](#cite_note-Part_Five-501)

##### A distant galaxy

:   "*What is it?*"  
    "*I just felt... Nothing. Just shadows in the starlight.*"
:   ―Ahsoka Tano and Sabine Wren, as Anakin Skywalker watched over them[[504]](#cite_note-Part_Eight-504)

 [![Anakin Skywalker's spirit appears on Peridea to watch over Ahsoka Tano.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f4/AnakinSkywalkerPeridea-PartEight.png/revision/latest?cb=20231011011136) [![Anakin Skywalker's spirit appears on Peridea to watch over Ahsoka Tano.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f4/AnakinSkywalkerPeridea-PartEight.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20231011011136)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f4/AnakinSkywalkerPeridea-PartEight.png/revision/latest?cb=20231011011136) 

Anakin Skywalker's spirit appears on Peridea to watch over Ahsoka Tano.

 

A short time later, after Tano followed the [pathway](/wiki/Pathway_to_Peridea "Pathway to Peridea") to [another galaxy](/wiki/Peridea "Peridea") in pursuit of Grand Admiral Thrawn and to rescue Sabine Wren and Ezra Bridger, Tano found herself stranded with Wren in the far away galaxy. As they settled into their exile and looked toward the stars, Skywalker watched over both. After Wren sensed something through the Force but brushed it off as shadows in the starlight, Tano sensed something as well[[504]](#cite_note-Part_Eight-504) and spotted Skywalker's spirit.[[505]](#cite_note-Part_Eight_Highlights-505) With that, Tano walked away in content as Skywalker continued to watch on.[[504]](#cite_note-Part_Eight-504) Skywalker's appearance, along with that of the convor Morai, proved to Tano that she was where she needed to be.[[505]](#cite_note-Part_Eight_Highlights-505)

#### Coming to his son's aide

:   "*Remember, my son, no matter how dark the night may grow, you are never alone. You will know what to do, my son. Let the Force guide you. Let it flow through you as it flows through me. Use that power, and your instincts, for they are one and the same.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker, to Luke Skywalker[[506]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-506)

In [21 ABY](/wiki/21_ABY "21 ABY"),[[507]](#cite_note-SOTS_Date-507) Skywalker's son, Luke began [searching](/wiki/Quest_for_Exegol "Quest for Exegol") for Exegol and came into conflict with nine paranormal Sith wraiths. When Luke found himself against impossible odds, a ghostly blue figure appeared, whom the Jedi initially mistook for his master Obi-Wan Kenobi. After fighting off the wraiths with his lightsaber, the figure turned, revealing himself as none other than Anakin Skywalker. Skywalker reached out his hand and Luke took it, and then found himself back on Tython as if he had never left.[[506]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-506)

At Tython, Skywalker's figure flashed in and out and shifted between him as a young Jedi and him as the old man Luke had seen behind the mask of Darth Vader. Luke noticed that he seemed to be in pain and afraid. Skywalker explained that there was a disturbance in the Force that was a shadow from an ancient time. He also clarified that the seeing stone had sent a part of Luke to Exegol and that it had taken everything in him to bring him back. Anakin reminded Luke that he could divert the path of the Force if he needed to, and that no matter how dark things seemed he was never alone as long as he allowed the Force to be his guide. Skywalker then disappeared.[[506]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-506)

### Legacy

#### Remembered by the galaxy

:   "*Forgive me. I feel it again. The pull to the light. Supreme Leader senses it. Show me again, the power of the darkness, and I will let nothing stand in our way. Show me, Grandfather, and I will finish what you started.*"
:   ―Kylo Ren, to the mask of Darth Vader — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8a/ThePullToTheLight.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250403184900)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:ThePullToTheLight.flac "File:ThePullToTheLight.flac"))[[508]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-508)

 [![Darth Vader was remembered as a symbol of fear throughout the galaxy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/StarWars55.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180724184936) [![Darth Vader was remembered as a symbol of fear throughout the galaxy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/StarWars55.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20180724184936)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8e/StarWars55.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180724184936) 

Darth Vader was remembered as a symbol of fear throughout the galaxy.

 

Following the events of the Battle of Endor, Luke Skywalker confirmed his father and the Emperor's death over Endor to the Alliance,[[509]](#cite_note-Aftermath-509) which in turn, sent word of the battle's outcome in mass communications claiming to be the new power in the galaxy. Furthermore, in wake of the deaths of the Emperor, his top enforcer and many high-ranking officers during the battle, as well as the resulting power vacuum, the Galactic Empire collapsed due to internal power struggles and its fragmentation into several factions.[[354]](#cite_note-LS-354) The Imperial remnant implemented disinformation campaigns, leading to only rumors being spread that both Vader and the Emperor were dead, in some parts of the galaxy.[[510]](#cite_note-Uprising-510) Among those who knew the truth, there were sympathizers who tagged [graffiti](/wiki/Graffiti "Graffiti") stencils of Vader's helmet with the phrase "Vader lives" beneath it, as on Taris[[509]](#cite_note-Aftermath-509) and [Coronet City](/wiki/Coronet_City "Coronet City").[[511]](#cite_note-Life_Debt-511)

The [Acolytes of the Beyond](/wiki/Acolytes_of_the_Beyond "Acolytes of the Beyond") was a group of [Sith cultists](/wiki/Sith_cultist "Sith cultist") and fanatics with an interest in Vader,[[509]](#cite_note-Aftermath-509) whom they considered to be greater than the Empire.[[511]](#cite_note-Life_Debt-511) They purchased a lightsaber they believed to be Vader's from a [Kubaz](/wiki/Kubaz "Kubaz") named [Ooblamon](/wiki/Ooblamon "Ooblamon"), intending to destroy it and return it to him in death.[[509]](#cite_note-Aftermath-509) Months after the Battle of Endor, the Acolytes organized a [revolution](/wiki/Coronet_City_revolution "Coronet City revolution") on Coronet City, Corellia, during which they attacked a [Peace and Security station](/wiki/Peace_and_Security_Headquarters "Peace and Security Headquarters") in order to access a [museum's](/wiki/Unidentified_Coronet_City_museum "Unidentified Coronet City museum") basement and steal a red-bladed lightsaber for unknown reasons.[[511]](#cite_note-Life_Debt-511) Another [Sith cult](/wiki/Sith_cult "Sith cult"), the [Alazmec of Winsit](/wiki/Alazmec_of_Winsit "Alazmec of Winsit"), established a colony in the [Corvax Fen](/wiki/Corvax_Fen "Corvax Fen") amidst the ruins of Fortress Vader. There they revered Vader as their Dark Lord and the galaxy's "true father" and ruler.[[512]](#cite_note-TROS_JN-512)

While Vader had once been a secretive figure kept away from public knowledge, his reputation had grown over the course of the Galactic Civil War and after his death.[[513]](#cite_note-Propaganda-513) By the time of his death, Vader had become, in the words of the later Jedi Padawan [Rey](/wiki/Rey_Skywalker "Rey Skywalker"), the "most hated man in the galaxy."[[514]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-514) Like its stormtroopers and other military forces, Vader was left to become a symbol of the fallen Empire he had helped enforce.[[515]](#cite_note-Mando_Manga-515) [Decades](/wiki/Standard_decade "Standard decade") after his death, Darth Vader remained a despised and controversial figure in the New Republic[[516]](#cite_note-Bloodline-516) who had left a shadow that stretched across the entire galaxy.[[517]](#cite_note-Legacy_Vol._1-517) When it was publicly revealed that Organa was his biological daughter, her reputation was ruined, which eventually led to her resignation from the [Galactic Senate](/wiki/New_Republic_Senate "New Republic Senate"). The message, which had been recorded by Bail Organa for Leia and which explicitly revealed that Vader had once been the Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker, was made public by [Centrist](/wiki/Centrists "Centrists") Senator [Ransolm Casterfo](/wiki/Ransolm_Casterfo "Ransolm Casterfo"), under the machinations of [Carise Sindian](/wiki/Carise_Sindian "Carise Sindian"), an agent of the [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order").[[516]](#cite_note-Bloodline-516)

The cruel actions of her father were also used against Leia by the Quarren general Nossor Ri during diplomatic negotiations between her and the king of Mon Cala, [Ech-Char](/wiki/Ech-Char "Ech-Char"), about potential support for the [Resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance") from Mon Cala[[255]](#cite_note-Allegiance_2-255) in [34 ABY](/wiki/34_ABY "34 ABY").[[518]](#cite_note-Allegiance_date-518) The former Imperial stormtrooper, Terex, having become an agent of the [First Order Security Bureau](/wiki/First_Order_Security_Bureau "First Order Security Bureau"), remained unintimidated by Captain [Phasma](/wiki/Phasma "Phasma"), feeling she was not as threatening as Vader.[[265]](#cite_note-PD11-265)

 [![Ben Solo was the grandson of Anakin Skywalker.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/BenSolo-SWTLC.png/revision/latest?cb=20230401012208) [![Ben Solo was the grandson of Anakin Skywalker.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/BenSolo-SWTLC.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20230401012208)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/30/BenSolo-SWTLC.png/revision/latest?cb=20230401012208) 

Ben Solo was the grandson of Anakin Skywalker.

 

Anakin's grandson, [Ben Solo](/wiki/Ben_Solo "Ben Solo"), born to his daughter, Leia and her husband, Han Solo, inherited his mother's connection to the Force and was sent to [study](/wiki/Jedi_training "Jedi training") under his uncle Luke. Under the influence of the mysterious [Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"), Ben took on the name of Kylo Ren after he became a master of the Knights of Ren and a warlord of the First Order and vowed to finish the work that Vader had started a generation earlier[[508]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-508)—and to succeed where Vader and his sentimentality had failed.[[519]](#cite_note-TFA-novel-519) Unknown to all, Snoke was a puppet of the surviving Darth Sidious,[[520]](#cite_note-217_End-520) whose spirit had taken root in a clone body on Exegol when Vader destroyed his original body.[[521]](#cite_note-Episode_IX_Expanded-521) Vader's betrayal was a learning moment for Palpatine, who used Snoke as a puppet instead of an apprentice.[[520]](#cite_note-217_End-520)

One of those times, where Ren wanted to surpass Vader, was when he [fought](/wiki/Battle_against_the_Benathy_(First_Order) "Battle against the Benathy (First Order)") the Benathy—just like Vader did years before him—to prevent them from expanding their territory. He took [Ruthford](/wiki/Ruthford "Ruthford"), the last survivor from Vader's battle that was still alive, with him and had a short conversation with [Kristoff](/wiki/Kristoff "Kristoff"), the successor of the king that Vader had killed many years ago, about how Vader was taller and had seemed more impressive than Ren. Following that, Ren killed him with his lightsaber. He then went on to fight the Benathy and although Ruthford suggested retreating, Ren kept on fighting, talking to Ruthford about how Vader also did not retreat. When the god of the Benathy, a Zillo Beast, appeared, Ruthford warned Ren extensively and stated that he could not prove anything to a dead man. Ignoring that, Ren took a shuttle and let the beast swallow him—killing it to Ruthford's surprise from the inside and succeeding where Vader had failed. With their king and their god dead, Ren had control over the Benathy and even the rather skeptical Ruthford admitted that Ren had won the competition against his grandfather.[[281]](#cite_note-Age_of_Resistance_Kylo-281)

In his crusade, Ren decided to seek Snoke and betray the [Jedi Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order"), and was the cause of Skywalker's subsequent exile in search of the [first Jedi Temple](/wiki/First_Jedi_Temple "First Jedi Temple") on [Ahch-To](/wiki/Ahch-To "Ahch-To").[[508]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-508) After losing his apprentices in the [destruction of his Jedi Temple](/wiki/Destruction_of_the_Jedi_Temple "Destruction of the Jedi Temple") and Solo falling to the dark side in the same night, Skywalker came to believe that the Jedi Order should end with his death as the last Jedi. By then, he held the Jedi responsible for the training and creation of Darth Vader.[[514]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-514) As a consequence of shutting himself off from the Force, Luke lost the guidance of Anakin's spirit.[[499]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-499)

 [![The legacy of Darth Vader inspired his grandson, Kylo Ren, to destroy the last remnants of the Jedi Order.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/79/Kylo_Ren_Vader_Helmet_Chamber.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160420020932) [![The legacy of Darth Vader inspired his grandson, Kylo Ren, to destroy the last remnants of the Jedi Order.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/79/Kylo_Ren_Vader_Helmet_Chamber.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160420020932)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/79/Kylo_Ren_Vader_Helmet_Chamber.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160420020932) 

The legacy of Darth Vader inspired his grandson, Kylo Ren, to destroy the last remnants of the Jedi Order.

 

Ren was also in possession of Vader's disfigured helmet, which had been scavenged from his funeral pyre on Endor. A silent symbol of both the dark side's power and its weakness, it remained within Ren's private quarters aboard the *[Finalizer](/wiki/Finalizer "Finalizer")*;[[522]](#cite_note-TVD-522) Ren communed with it whenever he felt drawn to the light. Another object that once belonged to him—the lightsaber he built after the First Battle of Geonosis, the one carried by his son until their duel on Bespin—resurfaced in [Maz Kanata](/wiki/Maz_Kanata "Maz Kanata")'s possession and called to Rey, a young scavenger from [Jakku](/wiki/Jakku "Jakku"), who ended up using it to duel Ren during the [Battle of Starkiller Base](/wiki/Battle_of_Starkiller_Base "Battle of Starkiller Base") and win.[[508]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-508) When Ren changed [quarters](/wiki/Kylo%27s_chambers "Kylo's chambers") from the *Finalizer* to Snoke's flagship the *[Supremacy](/wiki/Supremacy "Supremacy")*, he left Vader's charred helmet behind him because he was not ready to face Vader's "visage" until he recovered from his failure on [Starkiller Base](/wiki/Starkiller_Base "Starkiller Base"). Ren's master, Snoke, owned a [ring](/wiki/Snoke%27s_ring "Snoke's ring") with obsidian taken from Vader's castle.[[523]](#cite_note-TLJ:TVD-523) Captured by Gardulla Besadii the Elder on Tatooine and under the influence of hallucinogens, Ren had a vision of Vader cutting down Rebel soldiers. Ren admired Vader as magnificent and asked for his help. Vader turned to Ren and responded that everything he did that made him magnificent, he did alone. Empowered by his idol's words, Ren drew upon the Force and broke free of his restraints to escape the Hutt's torture chamber.[[524]](#cite_note-LoV3-524)

#### Balance preserved

:   "*Rey. Bring back the balance, Rey, as I did. The Force surrounds you, Rey. Let it lift you.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker, to Rey[[514]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-514)

After Skywalker's death, a group of Alazmec cultists established a settlement in the Corvax Fen region of Mustafar near Fortress Vader, and began to worship Vader alongside [Lady Corvax](/wiki/Corvax "Corvax"). At some point, they acquired an ancient Sith [wayfinder](/wiki/Vader%27s_wayfinder "Vader's wayfinder") that once belonged to Vader.[[525]](#cite_note-IX_Visual-525) In [35 ABY](/wiki/35_ABY "35 ABY"),[[526]](#cite_note-TROS_Date-526) Kylo Ren led a [massacre](/wiki/Mission_to_Mustafar_(First_Order) "Mission to Mustafar (First Order)") of the Alazmec cultists and stole Vader's wayfinder from the ruins of the battle. When Ren discovered Exegol using this [wayfinder](/wiki/Wayfinder "Wayfinder") and confronted the surviving Darth Sidious, Palpatine used the voice of Darth Vader to speak to Ren in his head.[[527]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-527)

 [![With Ben Solo's death, the bloodline of Anakin Skywalker ended.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/The_Skywalkers.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220502025527) [![With Ben Solo's death, the bloodline of Anakin Skywalker ended.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/The_Skywalkers.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220502025527)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/The_Skywalkers.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20220502025527) 

With Ben Solo's death, the bloodline of Anakin Skywalker ended.

 

As Leia Organa Skywalker Solo prepared to release the last of her strength to reach her son, Ben Solo, she allowed the voices and faces of her family to surround her. Among the voices she heard was that of Anakin Skywalker, whose apology she finally accepted, returning his love in a way she had never before.[[512]](#cite_note-TROS_JN-512) Skywalker's voice was later heard by Rey among the voices of many Jedi of the past who aided her with destroying Darth Sidious during the [Battle of Exegol](/wiki/Battle_of_Exegol "Battle of Exegol"), telling Rey to restore the balance as he did. He and the many Jedi used their eternal power to help Rey bring Sidious down once and for all and the balance Anakin had created was maintained. Ren, who had assumed the identity of Ben Solo once again, sacrificed himself to save Rey, following in his grandfather, Anakin's path of redemption. While Solo was the last of the Skywalker bloodline, Rey took on the name Skywalker, and Anakin was reunited with his family in the afterlife at long last.[[527]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-527)

## Personality and traits

It is requested that this article section [be expanded](/wiki/Special:EditPage/:Anakin_Skywalker "Special:EditPage/:Anakin Skywalker"). *Please improve it in any way that you see fit, and remove this notice once the article section is more complete.*

### Jedi of the Republic

:   "*What would have surprised people was how kind he was. He cared deeply about his friends, and looked out for them until the end.*"
:   ―Ahsoka Tano[[212]](#cite_note-Shroud_of_Darkness-212)

 [![Anakin Skywalker was a gifted yet unorthodox Jedi Knight who rose to prominence during the Clone Wars.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/46/TheChosenOne-SWE.png/revision/latest?cb=20160914010553) [![Anakin Skywalker was a gifted yet unorthodox Jedi Knight who rose to prominence during the Clone Wars.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/46/TheChosenOne-SWE.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/180?cb=20160914010553)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/46/TheChosenOne-SWE.png/revision/latest?cb=20160914010553) 

Anakin Skywalker was a gifted yet unorthodox Jedi Knight who rose to prominence during the Clone Wars.

 

As a child, Anakin Skywalker showed kindness and generosity, as exemplified by his willingness to risk his life in a podrace to help Qui-Gon Jinn and Padmé Amidala depart Tatooine at a time of need.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) He made a number of friends, and his best friend was a fellow slave boy named Kitster Banai.[[267]](#cite_note-HC_4-267) He was not shy to express how he felt and showed a reluctance to leave those he loved behind. Indeed, Skywalker had a deep-seated fear of loss, especially in regards to his mother, which Master Yoda sensed when he was being tested by the Jedi Council.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) This fear of loss would follow Skywalker throughout his life and eventually led him down the path of the dark side,[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14)[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) particularly after the death of his mother, Shmi, carrying sadness, anger, and guilt in his heart for years to come.[[59]](#cite_note-Overlords-59)

He also felt that fear towards his friends, noticing when he believed that Obi-Wan was killed by the bounty hunter Rako Hardeen, leading him to the dark side.[[122]](#cite_note-Deception-122) But upon discovering that he was a ruse to prevent Chancellor Palpatine's kidnapping, he felt betrayed for not telling him sooner, and thus began to distrust Obi-Wan and the Jedi.[[163]](#cite_note-Crisis_on_Naboo-163)

After he left his mother, Skywalker—feeling the brunt of childhood abandonment and losing the only person who had ever cared for him before meeting the Jedi—clinged onto anyone close to him. First, it had been Qui-Gon Jinn, but he then lost the Jedi Master as well. Afterward, he clinged onto others in his life, like Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padmé Amidala, and Ahsoka Tano.[[37]](#cite_note-There_is_Always_Another-37) Similarly, his experiences as a slave would leave him with a deep resentment towards slavers.[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158) Skywalker would mostly keep these feelings to himself, very rarely talking about them, even with those he trusted,[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158)[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19) as he struggled to put his past behind him,[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158) making an effort not to think about it.[[42]](#cite_note-OW&A_3-42)

As he grew older, Skywalker became cocky,[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) reckless,[[92]](#cite_note-Jedi_Crash-92) impatient,[[121]](#cite_note-R2_Come_Home-121)[[42]](#cite_note-OW&A_3-42) willful,[[59]](#cite_note-Overlords-59) and cavalier,[[47]](#cite_note-The_Big_Bang-47) despite Kenobi's efforts to train him as best as he could.[[59]](#cite_note-Overlords-59) Confident and bold, he demonstrated a lack of subtlety, which Plo Koon once noted, was one of the many traits his Padawan, Ahsoka Tano, had adopted from him during her younger years.[[119]](#cite_note-Lethal_Trackdown-119) Another was his tendency to disobey orders,[[143]](#cite_note-Voices-143) which he did whenever he thought they were not the best way to solve problems,[[147]](#cite_note-The_Citadel-147) and his cockiness.[[150]](#cite_note-Padawan_Lost-150) Despite his many failings, Skywalker remained selfless,[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159) willing to lay down his life for others,[[92]](#cite_note-Jedi_Crash-92) and showed commitment to things greater than himself—the Jedi, the Republic, his friends,[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159) and his wife.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

Similarly, his relentless determination was rivaled by none,[[156]](#cite_note-Shadow_Warrior-156)[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159) except perhaps by that of his Padawan. When Tano was missing in action and taken to the moon of Wasskah,[[150]](#cite_note-Padawan_Lost-150) Skywalker blamed himself, believing he had failed to protect his student,[[149]](#cite_note-Wookiee_Hunt-149) and relentlessly searched for her possible location on star charts, though Plo Koon suggested he trust in her abilities.[[150]](#cite_note-Padawan_Lost-150) Indeed, Tano survived and led others to safety, and, upon her return to Coruscant, she told her master there was no need to apologize; she explained he had already done all he needed to, as she had used his lessons to survive. When Skywalker was unsure of how to respond, she thanked him for that guidance, so Skywalker responded with "You're welcome, my Padawan."[[149]](#cite_note-Wookiee_Hunt-149) In some aspects, his journey as a mentor to Tano allowed him to mature and become more responsible. Skywalker's emotional balance, however, was disrupted by the High Council's decision to expel Tano, when she was suspected of treachery, and her subsequent decision not to return to the Order when invited back.[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174) Though he greatly missed her,[[196]](#cite_note-In_Search_of_the_Crystal-196) Skywalker respected her wish to stay away from the Order when he sensed her aboard the *Silver Angel* by allowing the ship to pass by his *Venator-class Star Destroyer*[[199]](#cite_note-Deal_No_Deal-199)

 [![Skywalker was an impulsive but dedicated mentor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ae/AnakinSkywalkerDedicatedMentor-CM.png/revision/latest?cb=20200317053413) [![Skywalker was an impulsive but dedicated mentor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ae/AnakinSkywalkerDedicatedMentor-CM.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200317053413)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ae/AnakinSkywalkerDedicatedMentor-CM.png/revision/latest?cb=20200317053413) 

Skywalker was an impulsive but dedicated mentor.

 

His heroic feats during the Clone Wars eventually made him the symbol of the Jedi Order, held by many as the warrior-savior of the Galactic Republic, earning the nickname of the "[Hero With No Fear](/wiki/Hero_With_No_Fear "Hero With No Fear")" as he was fostered and liked by Supreme Chancellor Palpatine, applauded by the Galactic Senate and popularized on the [HoloNet News](/wiki/HoloNet_News "HoloNet News").[[144]](#cite_note-SWCVD,NE-144) With a penchant to show off,[[120]](#cite_note-Death_Trap-120)[[196]](#cite_note-In_Search_of_the_Crystal-196)[[209]](#cite_note-On_the_Wings_of_Keeradaks-209) Skywalker was a something of a maverick, though not in the same way as his late informal Jedi Master Qui-Gon Jinn, known among the Jedi for being passionate and impulsive.[[59]](#cite_note-Overlords-59)[[111]](#cite_note-Legacy_of_Terror-111) Most of his peers trusted him, and his ingenuity, although some Jedi did consider him to have a simplistic approach to logic.[[110]](#cite_note-Weapons_Factory-110)[[145]](#cite_note-Citadel_Rescue-145) The 501st Legion and its captain, Rex, considered his tactics reckless and unorthodox, but appreciated the fact that he would never risk their lives without risking his as well.[[528]](#cite_note-The_General-528) Whenever Skywalker, who believed a true military leader should always lead from the front,[[65]](#cite_note-501_Plus_One-65) threw caution to the wind, Rex was always by his side and had full trust in his general's instincts.[[208]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-208) Skywalker cared about his troops and even befriended Rex.[[65]](#cite_note-501_Plus_One-65) Skywalker also showed eagerness and dedication to ending the Clone Wars, which he believed, by their final days, were destroying the principles of the Republic.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

Though he was committed to the Jedi Order ever since he joined, Skywalker was deeply conflicted about it, wanting to walk away from the Order at several points before[[41]](#cite_note-OW&A_1-41) and during the Clone Wars,[[178]](#cite_note-To_Catch_a_Jedi-178) particularly because of his love and secret marriage to Padmé Amidala,[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) whom he believed he could not live without.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) Overprotective and prone to jealousy, Skywalker's affection for her was suspected by some of his peers and, at least, Obi-Wan Kenobi and Rush Clovis knew for certain that he was attracted to her.[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184) Ahsoka Tano also came to realize her master and Amidala had formed a relationship,[[529]](#cite_note-HC_52-529) and Rex knew for certain, with Skywalker trusting his captain to look out for passerby's as he spoke with Amidala.[[208]](#cite_note-A_Distant_Echo-208) Another source of conflict was his dwindling trust and increasing resentment toward the Jedi High Council, which he felt distrusted him and was not treating him with enough respect.[[163]](#cite_note-Crisis_on_Naboo-163)[[100]](#cite_note-Ultimate_SW-100) These fears and resentments were further fomented by Palpatine's manipulations, and some of the Council's (and Kenobi's) decisions,[[178]](#cite_note-To_Catch_a_Jedi-178)[[122]](#cite_note-Deception-122) as well as his friendship with Chancellor Palpatine, of whom the Council was wary and kept secrets from.[[200]](#cite_note-Dark_Disciple-200)[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) Kenobi and the Jedi Council not standing with Ahsoka Tano during her trial angered him.[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174)

 [![Anakin Skywalker was a man who forged deep connections with his friends, looking out for their wellbeing at all times.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c4/Anakin-Rex-Ahsoka.png/revision/latest?cb=20230319155807) [![Anakin Skywalker was a man who forged deep connections with his friends, looking out for their wellbeing at all times.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c4/Anakin-Rex-Ahsoka.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230319155807)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c4/Anakin-Rex-Ahsoka.png/revision/latest?cb=20230319155807) 

Anakin Skywalker was a man who forged deep connections with his friends, looking out for their wellbeing at all times.

 

As the Clone War came to its end, Skywalker was faced with many burdens on his emotional wellbeing; he had lost Tano, only to then lose clone troopers Tup and Fives shortly thereafter, making it seem like his personal life was falling apart.
