The only constant in his life was his wife,[[181]](#cite_note-FactFile_Kenobi_112-181) whom he hoped would never leave him after he lost his Padawan.[[179]](#cite_note-Skywalker:_A_Family_at_War-179) Unlike other Jedi, Skywalker struggled to keep his emotions in check,[[44]](#cite_note-Jedi_vs_Sith-44) especially his anger.[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14)[[158]](#cite_note-Kidnapped-158)[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184) He cared deeply about his friends, and, as noted by Ahsoka Tano, "looked out for them until the end."[[212]](#cite_note-Shroud_of_Darkness-212) Loyal to a fault, Skywalker was willing to do anything to protect those he cared about, often resorting to the dark side of the Force to do so.[[112]](#cite_note-Brain_Invaders-112)[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159)[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174)[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) Throughout the Clone Wars, as Palpatine had planned, Skywalker's anger would push him ever closer to the dark side, but his fall was ultimately triggered by his fear of loss after experiencing visions of Amidala dying in childbirth[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) and his desire to obtain enough power to save his loved ones.[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) He would justify his immoral and ruthless actions as all being necessary to bring peace, justice, and order to the galaxy.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

As a teenager, he liked to explore and see new places,[[43]](#cite_note-OW&A_2-43) and fix things.[[42]](#cite_note-OW&A_3-42) Sometimes, when he felt troubled during his time as a Jedi, Skywalker would retire to his highly customized quarters in the Temple, wherein he would tinker with droids to pass the time.[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184) In a similar fashion, he would keep the ship *Twilight* during the Clone Wars,[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19)[[170]](#cite_note-The_Lawless-170) since the freighter offered Skywalker plenty of opportunities for tinkering with machinery.[[530]](#cite_note-DB-Twilight-530) As Vader, he would continue to repair his starfighters himself,[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) and the act of repairing things would be akin to a form of meditation for him.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) Thinking of Vader's life as a Sith Lord and his life before he had fallen to the dark side, Sabé believed that Anakin Skywalker was someone who had never truly controlled his own life and destiny. As such, she hoped to give him a chance to take control of his own existence: when she said as such to Vader during the Force Wave event, she was unable to finish her sentence upon being forced back by a blast of Vader's out-of-control power.[[468]](#cite_note-DV_2020_33-468)

 [![For all the blame that could be pointed at other people, Anakin Skywalker was ultimately the one responsible for the choices he made.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fc/Vader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100509194546) [![For all the blame that could be pointed at other people, Anakin Skywalker was ultimately the one responsible for the choices he made.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fc/Vader1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20100509194546)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/fc/Vader1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20100509194546) 

For all the blame that could be pointed at other people, Anakin Skywalker was ultimately the one responsible for the choices he made.

 

Alternatively, Kenobi levied the blame for Skywalker's fall at Skywalker himself,[[531]](#cite_note-Master_and_Apprentice_(short_story)-531) although Kenobi had endured[[303]](#cite_note-Part_VI-303) a long period[[532]](#cite_note-Part_I-532) of blaming himself.[[303]](#cite_note-Part_VI-303) For ten years after their duel on Mustafar,[[532]](#cite_note-Part_I-532) Kenobi blamed himself for Skywalker's fall and apologized to his former disciple after their duel on a barren moon. Vader, however, rebuked Kenobi and took credit for "killing" Anakin Skywalker,[[303]](#cite_note-Part_VI-303) trying to believe that the Jedi Knight he had once been was dead.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) Finding himself able to move on after Vader's comment,[[303]](#cite_note-Part_VI-303) Kenobi noted how Skywalker had all the tools needed to choose the path of the light but made the conscious decision not to. He reminded the spirit of Qui-Gon Jinn that, no matter what level of fault each of them held, the final decision had been Skywalker's alone.[[531]](#cite_note-Master_and_Apprentice_(short_story)-531) All the same, Kenobi greatly missed his friend.[[37]](#cite_note-There_is_Always_Another-37) Vader himself was filled with rage and despair after his conversion into a cyborg upon realizing that, indeed, the fault was all his own: it was his own choices that had led him to his new reality.[[231]](#cite_note-Insider228-231)

### Dark Lord of the Sith

:   "*Darth Vader wasn't afraid of becoming a* monster*, after all... that had happened a long time ago.*"
:   ―Vaneé[[226]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_Vader's_Castle-226)

 [![Skywalker's desire to save his wife led him to do terrible things and become the Sith Lord, Darth Vader.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/eb/VaderAnakin-DV5cover.png/revision/latest?cb=20230401034352) [![Skywalker's desire to save his wife led him to do terrible things and become the Sith Lord, Darth Vader.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/eb/VaderAnakin-DV5cover.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/265?cb=20230401034352)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/eb/VaderAnakin-DV5cover.png/revision/latest?cb=20230401034352) 

Skywalker's desire to save his wife led him to do terrible things and become the Sith Lord, Darth Vader.

 

Upon his conversion to the dark side, Skywalker's arrogant streak became even more prominent, and for a short time, he believed himself to be even more powerful than Palpatine. During his early days as a Sith, Vader believed in justice and would fight to bring it to the Empire at any cost. His impulsiveness and tendency to act in anger were both magnified as well; for instance, when he discovered that Kenobi had stowed away on his wife's ship when she came to Mustafar, he immediately assumed that she was conspiring with his former master and strangled her with the Force. Despite this, Vader did experience a significant level of regret for the decisions that he had made to save Amidala.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

However, all that changed following his defeat at Kenobi's hands. Having lost all that he had turned to the dark side to preserve, and having no other path, he fully embraced the dark side and became, in Palpatine's words, a "true Sith."[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) Believing he had become an irredeemable[[233]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_5-233) monster,[[236]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_4-236) Vader devoted himself fully to furthering the development of his relationship to the Force, learning to expand his power[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) and using the pain of Amidala's death as a fuel.[[232]](#cite_note-The_Chosen_One_1-232) All the same, the Jedi training droid Arex believed the early Vader was someone who remembered the teachings of the Jedi despite his new devotion to the Sith.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) Both due to what Palpatine taught him about the relationship between Sith master and apprentice[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) and his own personal tendencies, Vader in his early apprenticeship was completely devoted to the Emperor.[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) In his first days as a Sith Lord, Vader was confronted by a vision of himself finding redemption to the light by killing Palpatine and apologizing to Kenobi. However, Vader refused the vision, declaring that he had lost everything else in his life and an existence as a Sith was all he could be.[[233]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_5-233) However, as his power grew and particularly after learning of his son's existence, his devotion to Sidious dwindled considerably.[[386]](#cite_note-DV25-386) Instead, he considered that his son and him could rule the galaxy together[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) as the new rulers of the Empire.[[228]](#cite_note-DV20-228)

 [![Darth Vader was the dreaded enforcer of his Sith Master and the galaxy-wide empire they forged.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d0/Holding-Hope.png/revision/latest?cb=20220613010735) [![Darth Vader was the dreaded enforcer of his Sith Master and the galaxy-wide empire they forged.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d0/Holding-Hope.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/230?cb=20220613010735)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d0/Holding-Hope.png/revision/latest?cb=20220613010735) 

Darth Vader was the dreaded enforcer of his Sith Master and the galaxy-wide empire they forged.

 

Vader held contempt for those who betrayed the Empire, such as when he accused Leia Organa of being a traitor.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) According to an Imperial captain who worked with Vader, the Sith Lord was always violent but would "mature" over the years. Vader at first simply murdered those who annoyed him. However, he eventually came to wait for those he wanted to murder to make a mistake: even if it was a minor error, it gave Vader an excuse to carry out the execution.[[262]](#cite_note-Shadow_Fall-262) Indeed, over the years since his fall to darkness,[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) Vader developed a new, more hardened and disciplined persona. He became utterly ruthless,[[359]](#cite_note-SW1-359) refused to retreat,[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) and was virtually devoid of mercy.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) Even though he once thought to himself that his master's punishment of the most loyal Imperials only hurt their efforts to establish order,[[459]](#cite_note-DV_2020_18-459) Vader was known to occasionally kill his own officers for their failures.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) The fear felt by members of the Imperial ranks was so great that some chose [death](/wiki/Death "Death") rather than face the wrath of the Sith Lord. [The Grand Inquisitor](/wiki/The_Grand_Inquisitor "The Grand Inquisitor"), of the [Inquisitorius](/wiki/Inquisitorius "Inquisitorius"), and chief supervisor [Lank Denvik](/wiki/Lank_Denvik "Lank Denvik"), of the [Imperial Security Bureau](/wiki/Imperial_Security_Bureau "Imperial Security Bureau"), were examples of this, though both were unable to escape.[[312]](#cite_note-Fire_Across_the_Galaxy-312)[[313]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_6-313)[[305]](#cite_note-Survivor-305) Vader came to view the Galactic Civil War not as a war, but a series of executions, believing that wars were for lesser men than him and his Master. When confronted by Leia Organa on Vrogas Vas, he informed her of this belief and told her that her execution was long overdue, though he was unable to kill the princess due to the arrival of Commander Karbin.[[377]](#cite_note-SW14-377) Vader treated droids as disposable servants.[[479]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_1-479)

Eventually, the identity of Vader in the Empire had arisen tales of a dark armored [humanoid](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid") who served as the Emperor's most trusted enforcer and was considered to be the most feared individual in the Empire. Rumors circulated that he lived in a castle in a world of lava and that he wielded a red lightsaber, suggesting a connection to the Sith. The few who had interacted with him stated that they were unsure whether the individual behind the armor was a living person, a droid or a clone trooper. Many feared that if Vader were ever defeated, a number of duplicates would be activated in his place.[[533]](#cite_note-Dawn-533) The Sith Lord also had absolutely no qualms about using torture to accomplish his goals.[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146)

 [![Darth Vader earned the ire of Imperial officers and the love of the rank and file.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b0/Star_Wars_Darth_Vader_2_Cover.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141118210037) [![Darth Vader earned the ire of Imperial officers and the love of the rank and file.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b0/Star_Wars_Darth_Vader_2_Cover.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20141118210037)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b0/Star_Wars_Darth_Vader_2_Cover.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141118210037) 

Darth Vader earned the ire of Imperial officers and the love of the rank and file.

 

Considered to be the Empire's first terror weapon and noted to employ antiquated diction,[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) he was tenacious and unstoppable,[[228]](#cite_note-DV20-228) and made most Imperial naval officers uncomfortable.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) Even Admiral Firmus Piett, whose highly skilled abilities as a wartime officer kept him alive in Vader's service,[[61]](#cite_note-Battles_that_Changed_the_Galaxy-61) was not above being threatened with death by the Dark Lord.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) When Piett warned him of the Scourge droid infection, Vader's only response was to critique Piett for thinking he would repeat the admiral's failings.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26) Contrary to the rocky relationships he had with most Imperial officers, his rapport with his stormtroopers mirrored in many ways his former persona's relationship to the Republic's clone troopers.[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) In fact, his standing with the rank and file was such that it was known as far as Ryloth that the stormtrooper corps "almost worshiped him."[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) Additionally, Vader commanded the absolute loyalty of his servant, Vaneé, who remained stationed at his castle on Mustafar and knew Vader viewed himself as a monster.[[226]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_Vader's_Castle-226)

Part of his reputation was that he would normally be quiet (and thus his presence made for a good implied threat to others) whereas shows of passivity were not.[[368]](#cite_note-DV9-368) Indeed, it was well known that he usually preferred to oversee operations personally,[[354]](#cite_note-LS-354) using action to block out any intruding feelings.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) He was frequently at odds with those who lacked faith in the Force, finding it "disturbing"[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) or even blasphemous.[[365]](#cite_note-DV5-365)

 [![Darth Vader was a man fueled by pain, turning it into a fuel to continue his life as a Sith Lord.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a2/DarthVader-BlackWhiteRed1-virginvariant-Okazaki.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250810120955) [![Darth Vader was a man fueled by pain, turning it into a fuel to continue his life as a Sith Lord.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a2/DarthVader-BlackWhiteRed1-virginvariant-Okazaki.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250810120955)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a2/DarthVader-BlackWhiteRed1-virginvariant-Okazaki.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250810120955) 

Darth Vader was a man fueled by pain, turning it into a fuel to continue his life as a Sith Lord.

 

His self-hatred led him to think of self-destructive tendencies, such as blaming his former Master Obi-Wan Kenobi for not killing him on Mustafar, and his hatred of Kenobi for what happened on Mustafar led him to have the desire to burn his former mentor's body to the same level he burned his own. Although Vader hated Obi-Wan for being the responsible one for his extensive injuries inflicted in Mustafar,[[302]](#cite_note-Part_II-302) Vader did not hold Kenobi completely to blame for his dark fate; as he told his former master in one of their confrontations, he proclaimed that it was not Kenobi who had killed Anakin Skywalker, instead saying that himself had done it.[[303]](#cite_note-Part_VI-303) Darth Vader continued to harbor his xenophobic hatred of the Tusken Raiders race for the murder of his mother during the end of the Separatist Crisis, which gave him the motive after a negotiation with the crime lord Jabba the Hutt to attack a Tusken Raider camp located on the same planet where he saw his mother died.[[350]](#cite_note-DV1-350)

During his first days as a Sith, he claimed that his actions were justified, stating that the Sith were on the right side while the Jedi to be the real evil, as he told Kenobi during the Duel of Mustafar.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) As he grew older and lived within his suit, he claimed that he still believed in justice, claiming to be a devout believer in Imperial propaganda to bring order to the galaxy.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) Indeed, Vader would become known as the Dark Lord of order,[[534]](#cite_note-Solicit_March-534) although how much he actually believed in the quest to establish order was debatable.[[496]](#cite_note-DV_2020_50-496) During the manhunt for pacifist scientist [Galen Erso](/wiki/Galen_Walton_Erso "Galen Walton Erso"), Vader questioned the term peace, seeing violence as the true creator of order and dismissing pacifists as fools who failed to see that.[[256]](#cite_note-Vader_annual_2-256) He declared to his son that they would work together to reverse the disorder that existed in the galaxy.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15)

During the war with Crimson Dawn, Vader held contempt for his master's failure to establish order, thinking to himself that Palpatine's actions had only created the chaos they found themselves in. Even without Skywalker by his side, Vader set out on a new quest to bring order to the galaxy.[[459]](#cite_note-DV_2020_18-459) During his campaign to root out Crimson Dawn infiltrators in the Empire, Vader saw it as a way to bring about order.[[460]](#cite_note-DV_2020_20-460) Even though he thought the Emperor punishing the most loyal of the Empire as everything else collapsed to be a problem that had made chaos,[[459]](#cite_note-DV_2020_18-459) Vader allowed loyal Imperials to be executed if it meant Dawn agents would also be killed. When asked why by his agent Ochi, Vader declared it as part of his quest to bring order back to the Empire by destroying the chaos of the Dawn.[[460]](#cite_note-DV_2020_20-460) When his agent Sabé declared the end of Jul Tambor's revolution as a path to peace on Skako Minor, Vader was silent for a moment before correcting her, telling her it was more correct to say they were bringing order.[[418]](#cite_note-DV_2020_32-418) However, Sabé would ultimately come to believe Vader was, in all truth, not interested in establishing order, pointing out during the final stages of the Schism Imperial crisis that his current quest for personal power had only brought about chaos.[[496]](#cite_note-DV_2020_50-496)

 [![Darth Vader was a warrior of hatred who carried out a campaign of terror and death.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c1/Conquering-Shadow.png/revision/latest?cb=20230210023903) [![Darth Vader was a warrior of hatred who carried out a campaign of terror and death.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c1/Conquering-Shadow.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/280?cb=20230210023903)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c1/Conquering-Shadow.png/revision/latest?cb=20230210023903) 

Darth Vader was a warrior of hatred who carried out a campaign of terror and death.

 

As a Sith Lord, Vader drew power from his anger and pain, raging at the loss of his wife and unborn child, his betrayal by the Jedi, and Kenobi for his injuries.[[4]](#cite_note-backstories-4) He once razed a villa in a Mapuzo town entirely to draw out Kenobi.[[300]](#cite_note-Part_III-300) He often used pressurized meditation chambers that allowed him to remain without his helm—the neural connection to his armor—during which he felt the perpetual pain[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) that Kenobi had inflicted[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) on his flesh. During such sessions, he would meditate to use this pain to feed his hate, which in turn fed his strength,[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) and he never laughed.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) Claiming not to feel regret, and yet haunted by his past, and the screams of his wife,[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) he was determined to never talk about his old life,[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146)[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) and detested all that reminded him of his past self, whom he deemed to be weak.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) He dared not remember such a period of his life, which he hated; indeed, through the use of the dark side, he kept his memories as Anakin Skywalker buried, although it took great effort even after twenty years of practice.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33)

Although he retained access to Skywalker's memories and experience, this burial was such that he refused to even think of Skywalker as himself, referring to internally to Skywalker's memories as those of "The Jedi."[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) As such, Vader rarely thought of his former name[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) and believed no one in the galaxy should mistake him for Anakin Skywalker, wanting none to forget his status as a Sith Lord.[[270]](#cite_note-DV_2020_29-270) Still, his rapport with the stormtroopers who supported him, and the technique he displayed in wielding his crimson lightsaber, made Wilhuff Tarkin suspect the truth.[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) When the reprogrammed Arex tried to help Vader regain control of his powers during the Force Wave incident by suggesting Jedi meditation, Vader decried the Jedi Order as focusing on weakness instead of power, threatening Arex by reminding the unit of how he killed the unit's master Kirak Infil'a and demanding Arex not speak of the Jedi. After Arex, who admitted they may be presuming too much, repeatedly suggested Jedi teachings to him during the battle for the *Executor*, Vader destroyed Arex in rage and adopted a direct method of attack to regain control of his flagship.[[26]](#cite_note-DV_2020_37-26)

 [![Darth Vader desperately sought to destroy what remained of his past, regarding himself as a different person from "The Jedi" who had come before.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/00/Scariest-Servant-Vader.png/revision/latest?cb=20230128040436) [![Darth Vader desperately sought to destroy what remained of his past, regarding himself as a different person from "The Jedi" who had come before.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/00/Scariest-Servant-Vader.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/300?cb=20230128040436)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/00/Scariest-Servant-Vader.png/revision/latest?cb=20230128040436) 

Darth Vader desperately sought to destroy what remained of his past, regarding himself as a different person from "The Jedi" who had come before.

 

Upon his fateful reunion with Ahsoka Tano, Vader expressed no desire to rekindle the bond he once shared with her, boasting that he had "killed" Anakin Skywalker,[[317]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-317) just as he had said to Kenobi.[[303]](#cite_note-Part_VI-303) Although he claimed he would spare her and work alongside her once more if she helped the Empire find any hiding Jedi, he cruelly resolved to kill her when she refused his offer, and he spurned her offer of compassion.[[317]](#cite_note-Twilight_of_the_Apprentice-317) During a mission with Grand Admiral Thrawn, who had met and befriended Skywalker during the Clone Wars, Vader repeatedly declared that Skywalker was long since dead, eventually forcing the Chiss officer to admit the man he had befriended during the war was gone. Upon hearing Thrawn admit as such, Vader declared they were never to speak of the man again, although Thrawn stated he would always carry Skywalker's memory with him,[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) befitting his philosophy that someone was never truly gone if a friend remembered them.[[325]](#cite_note-Thrawn_novel-325)

Much like before, Vader remained an impatient man, although he tempered his impulses with the faithful obedience he gave to his Sith master, Sidious.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) Vader also accepted that Sidious could be even more hateful than even himself.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) Vader nevertheless remained a pained man, so he would try to hurt himself and others to relieve himself. As sensed by Yoda, Vader's presence in the Force was hard and strong, fiercely pulsing when he sensed him. However, Vader's presence also carried a great, crushing loneliness, which only increased after he killed Obi-Wan Kenobi.[[351]](#cite_note-There_is_Another-351)

### Redemption of Anakin Skywalker

:   "*I've accepted the truth that you were once Anakin Skywalker, my father.*"  
    "*That name no longer has any meaning for me.*"  
    "*It is the name of your true self. You've only forgotten. I know there is good in you. The Emperor hasn't driven it from you fully.*"
:   ―Luke Skywalker and Darth Vader on Endor[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

 [![The persona of Darth Vader ended when Anakin Skywalker sacrificed himself in order to save his son from the Emperor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a3/Vader-ROTJHD.png/revision/latest?cb=20130420050355) [![The persona of Darth Vader ended when Anakin Skywalker sacrificed himself in order to save his son from the Emperor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a3/Vader-ROTJHD.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130420050355)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a3/Vader-ROTJHD.png/revision/latest?cb=20130420050355) 

The persona of Darth Vader ended when Anakin Skywalker sacrificed himself in order to save his son from the Emperor.

 

Following the discovery of his parenthood, Vader became emotionally conflicted.[[222]](#cite_note-DV6-222) Vader's thoughts of his son, Luke, led to thoughts of his late wife, the woman he loved and destroyed—thoughts he could not allow. Memories would resurface whenever he felt Luke near him, and so, believed in erasing that part of his past. He had become afraid of his compassionate son; not because of his mastery of the Force or skill with a lightsaber, but because Luke could make him question the dark truths that had long ruled him.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) In the eve of the Battle of Endor, Vader claimed it was too late for him, even as his son stubbornly felt that there was still good left in him.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) Vader would close off the questions with the dark side,[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33) but he showed concern for his son in the end. Ultimately, it was Luke's cry for help while being tortured by Palpatine that caused Anakin to reawaken and redeem himself, showing that despite all the evil acts he has committed, there was still some good in him.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

His love for Luke also challenged his loyalty to the Emperor. Vader began to distrust him, feeling like another pawn in his game. He planned to kill him to take his throne, considering himself best a ruler alongside Luke.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) His concern over being a pawn of Sidious ended up being validated when Sidious tried to replace him with Luke, much like when he replaced Dooku[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) with Vader. Vader became surprised when he sensed that he was not the father of one child but two when he telepathically sensed his daughter, Leia, through Luke. Before dying, Skywalker told Luke to tell Leia that he was right about him as he wanted his daughter to remember him as a good person in the end. Smiling at his son, Skywalker then died in peace.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

### Relationship with Padmé Amidala

:   "*The thought of not being with you— I can't breathe.* […] *You are in my very soul, tormenting me.* […] "  
    "*We can't. It's… just not possible.*"  
    "*Anything is possible, Padmé, listen to me.*"  
    "*No, you listen! We live in the real world. Come back to it.* […] *If you follow your thoughts through to conclusion, it'll take us to a place we cannot go—regardless of the way we feel about each other.*"  
    "*You're asking me to be rational. That is something I know I cannot do.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker and Padmé Amidala[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14)

Skywalker had first met Amidala when she posed as a handmaiden and commoner at Watto's shop in Mos Espa. There, Skywalker asked if she was an angel. He was then surprised when Padmé revealed herself to be the Queen.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) Ten years later, Skywalker met with her at apartment following an assassination attempt on her. As Skywalker continued to protect Amidala from further attempts,[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) he tried to impress her and flirt with her in ways he later cringed at. However, the mistakes he and Amidala made during that time revealed who each truly was to the other,[[18]](#cite_note-Brotherhood-18) and Amidala fell in love with him. They admitted their mutual love to each other on Naboo and, following the Battle of Geonosis, married in secret.[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14)

 [![Anakin married Padmé following the Battle of Geonosis.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b0/Husband_and_wife.png/revision/latest?cb=20180211193514) [![Anakin married Padmé following the Battle of Geonosis.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b0/Husband_and_wife.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180211193514)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b0/Husband_and_wife.png/revision/latest?cb=20180211193514) 

Anakin married Padmé following the Battle of Geonosis.

 

During the Clone Wars, Skywalker and Amidala rarely saw each other due to their duties requested of them during the war as well as keeping their marriage secret. Skywalker would rescue and protect Amidala from numerous dangers such as General Grievous,[[80]](#cite_note-Malevolence_3-80) the Zillo Beast,[[107]](#cite_note-Zillo_Beast_2-107) and the Blue Shadow Virus.[[95]](#cite_note-Blue_Shadow_Virus-95) Skywalker also felt jealous towards Amidala's close friend, Senator Rush Clovis of Scipio. Despite Amidala's assurances that it was over between her and Clovis, Skywalker felt uneasy when she accepted the Jedi Council's mission to spy on Clovis. After leaving Cato Neimoidia, Skywalker assured Amidala that he never doubted her. Later, however, Skywalker did not completely trust Clovis with Amidala.[[185]](#cite_note-An_Old_Friend-185) Skywalker attacked Clovis when he tried to kiss Amidala, but Amidala thought they should not see each other for a while.[[184]](#cite_note-The_Rise_of_Clovis-184) When Clovis appeared to have rejoined the Separatists, Skywalker led his forces and personally attempted to rescue Amidala.[[186]](#cite_note-Crisis_at_the_Heart-186)

Later when Amidala revealed that she was pregnant, Skywalker had premonitions about Amidala dying in childbirth. Skywalker's fear eventually led him into the dark side; Palpatine told him of how Darth Plagueis taught his apprentice how to cheat death, but he later stated he needed Skywalker's help to learn the power.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) Being focused on the possibility that Amidala could be saved, Skywalker did not notice the contradiction.[[219]](#cite_note-Certain_POV_193-219) On Mustafar, Skywalker, now Darth Vader, Force-choked her when he believed that she brought Kenobi to kill him. Following his duel with Kenobi, Vader continued to feel Amidala. After his re-birth, however, the Emperor told Vader that in his anger he killed her.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) Realizing that his own choices alone had been what brought him to this moment,[[231]](#cite_note-Insider228-231) Vader mourned her and gave into[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) his anger and despair,[[231]](#cite_note-Insider228-231) destroying the medical droids surrounding him[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) and then attacking Palpatine, screaming that he had claimed she could be saved.[[232]](#cite_note-The_Chosen_One_1-232)

Vader believed Palpatine's lie that he had killed his wife because he remembered that he had attacked her; thus, the man who once was Anakin Skywalker was cut off from his former allies and family, instead placing the Emperor as his only source for guidance and refuge.[[219]](#cite_note-Certain_POV_193-219) As a Sith Lord, Vader tried to find ways to resurrect Amidala, yet he found Momin's portal was unable to do so. Afterward, he decided to dedicate himself fully to the dark side,[[297]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_25-297) but he still longed to restore his wife, only for his attempts to always fail.[[343]](#cite_note-Vader_VR_3-343) Even after telling a vision of Amidala that the man she loved was dead, Force choking the vision[[385]](#cite_note-DV24-385)—just as he had choked the real Amidala on Mustafar[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)—to reject her love,[[385]](#cite_note-DV24-385) he, deep down, still loved her.[[429]](#cite_note-DV_2020_5-429) He could never let go of the agony caused by killing his wife.[[33]](#cite_note-BtPotDS!-33)

Vader eventually discovered that Amidala had given birth to a son, Luke Skywalker,[[369]](#cite_note-DV10-369) and a daughter, Leia Organa.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) He even learned of Amidala's last words, which filled him with sadness.[[429]](#cite_note-DV_2020_5-429) Through Luke's actions of love, Vader later turned back to the light,[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5) fulfilling Amidala's dying words that goodness still remained in Anakin.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

## Powers and abilities

### Lightsaber abilities

:   "*If you had spent as much time practicing your saber techniques as you do your wit, you would rival Master Yoda as a swordsman.*"  
    "*I thought I already did.*"  
    "*Only in your mind, my very young apprentice.*"
:   ―Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14)

 [![Vader was a skilled duelist, having retained his former persona's proficiency in lightsaber combat.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/Darth_Vader_Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith_20_Textless.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180525183714) [![Vader was a skilled duelist, having retained his former persona's proficiency in lightsaber combat.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/Darth_Vader_Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith_20_Textless.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/237?cb=20180525183714)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/53/Darth_Vader_Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith_20_Textless.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180525183714) 

Vader was a skilled duelist, having retained his former persona's proficiency in lightsaber combat.

 

Despite being naturally extremely talented, Anakin Skywalker was initially lax with his lightsaber training, though he believed that he could rival the Jedi Masters. Despite his relative laziness, Skywalker was the best duelist in his class, even though he started later than his classmates. In his training he preferred lightsaber combat over Force mastery, and he spent more time on the physical aspects of becoming a Jedi. By the time he was nineteen, Skywalker was so gifted and skilled in dueling that he believed he already rivaled Master [Yoda](/wiki/Yoda "Yoda"). When the Clone Wars began, Skywalker was a skilled enough duelist to contend against Count Dooku, who was one of the most skilled swordsmen in the galaxy.[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) During the war, his frequent engagements in duels with individuals such as the informal Sith apprentice Asajj Ventress,[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19)[[77]](#cite_note-The_Hidden_Enemy-77)[[126]](#cite_note-ARC_Troopers-126) Savage Opress,[[138]](#cite_note-Witches_of_the_Mist-138) Count Dooku,[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19)[[163]](#cite_note-Crisis_on_Naboo-163)[[200]](#cite_note-Dark_Disciple-200) and fallen Jedi Barriss Offee[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174) allowed him to greatly improve his capabilities with a lightsaber. By the end of the war, Skywalker had the skill to single-handedly defeat Dooku in combat,[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) despite the fact that the Count was one of very few duelists who could hold his own against Yoda.[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14)

During his duel with Kenobi after his fall to the dark side, Skywalker proved to be equally matched with his former master, and was only defeated when Kenobi exploited his hubris and blinding rage to dismember him.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) Skywalker was considered by some amongst the Jedi, such as Kanan Jarrus, to have been the greatest warrior that the Order had during the Clone Wars, with the only possible exceptions being Yoda and Mace Windu. His former Padawan, Ahsoka Tano, once acknowledged Skywalker as someone powerful who rarely lost his battles.[[212]](#cite_note-Shroud_of_Darkness-212)

Skywalker was particularly skilled in [Form V](/wiki/Form_V "Form V")—both the Shien and Djem So variants.[[535]](#cite_note-Destiny_Covert-535) He was able to deflect not only blaster fire with ease,[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) but also shots from freighters.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) He made good use of Djem So's strength-based strikes and counterattacks to overpower or overwhelm his opponent.[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174) Skywalker also used [Jar'Kai](/wiki/Jar%27Kai "Jar'Kai") on some occasions: He used Kenobi's lightsaber during his first duel with Count Dooku on Geonosis,[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) he wielded Barriss Offee's own lightsaber against her along with his own,[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174) and he wielded Dooku's lightsaber in addition to his own to execute him after defeating him on the *Invisible Hand*.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

Skywalker was also adept in the use of [Form IV](/wiki/Form_IV "Form IV"), often incorporating its techniques (primarily acrobatics) into his dueling style. He was well aware that the key to deflecting the fire of multiple adversaries was fluidity of motion, which he mastered enough to having adjusted the classic techniques of Form IV to better defend against ranged attackers. He demonstrated this in a holographic recording, later found in [Kanan Jarrus' holocron](/wiki/Kanan_Jarrus%27_holocron "Kanan Jarrus' holocron").[[212]](#cite_note-Shroud_of_Darkness-212)

 [![Darth Vader wields his Sith lightsaber.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Battlefront_Vader.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20181211045721) [![Darth Vader wields his Sith lightsaber.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Battlefront_Vader.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20181211045721)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0a/Battlefront_Vader.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20181211045721) 

Darth Vader wields his Sith lightsaber.

 

After Darth Vader received his cybernetic enhancements and armor, his dueling style became visually more direct than it had been, presumably due to his armor and cybernetics affecting his physical abilities; however, Vader's style was still similar enough to how he fought as a Jedi that Admiral Tarkin was able to puzzle out Vader's former identity largely by observing him fight.[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) Vader continued to use Jar'Kai on various occasions. On Mustafar, he [Force pulled](/wiki/Telekinesis "Telekinesis") a [smuggler's](/wiki/Corvax_descendant "Corvax descendant") lightsaber and wielded it with his own to finish off the last remaining droid in [Lady Corvax's sanctum](/wiki/Corvax_Fortress "Corvax Fortress").[[30]](#cite_note-Vader_VR_1-30) Another time, Vader used his weapon with one of Darth Atrius's lightsabers against a group of thugs whom Sana Starros had hired to keep the Imperials off her back.[[358]](#cite_note-SW_annual_4-358)

A pragmatic combatant both as Skywalker and later as Darth Vader, he had the skill to throw an activated lightsaber to attack, guiding it with the Force,[[116]](#cite_note-Voyage_of_Temptation-116)[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266)[[360]](#cite_note-SW2-360)[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)[[371]](#cite_note-DV12-371)[[383]](#cite_note-DV21-383) or he would resort to lethally activating unsuspecting opponents' lightsabers. He once impressed Kenobi by telekinetically activating lightsabers (both in the arms dealer Chong's possession) and cutting him apart before pulling the lightsabers to his hands.[[196]](#cite_note-In_Search_of_the_Crystal-196)

### Force powers

:   "*The Force is unusually strong with him, that much is clear.*"
:   ―Qui-Gon Jinn, on Anakin Skywalker[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12)

 [![Vader absorbing blaster bolt energy with his hand.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/Vader_Force_Absorb_ALNL.png/revision/latest?cb=20170906035432) [![Vader absorbing blaster bolt energy with his hand.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/Vader_Force_Absorb_ALNL.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170906035432)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/67/Vader_Force_Absorb_ALNL.png/revision/latest?cb=20170906035432) 

Vader absorbing blaster bolt energy with his hand.

 

Blessed with impressive reflexes that were typical of a Jedi, Jedi Master Qui-Gon Jinn saw enormous potential in the 9-year-old Skywalker and believed him to have been conceived by the Force itself. Indeed, when his blood was tested, Skywalker's midi-chlorian count was off the scale—above 20,000, reportedly even greater than Yoda's. When he was nine, Anakin was already skilled in having quick reflexes and precognition. This was something he used to an advantage when he participated in pod racing. He was also able to sense what things were without looking at them.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) Vader was skilled at absorbing energy with his hands, using this ability to shield himself from [Han Solo's](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo") [blaster](/wiki/Blaster "Blaster") fire on [Cloud City](/wiki/Cloud_City "Cloud City")[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) and, more surprisingly, from a [weapon](/wiki/Darth_Vader%27s_electrostaff "Darth Vader's electrostaff") loaded with a [kyber crystal](/wiki/Kyber_crystal "Kyber crystal").[[496]](#cite_note-DV_2020_50-496)

In his teen years, Skywalker's Force training progressed to the point where he was able to manifest various abilities, and Kenobi thought of him as being "advanced for his age."[[43]](#cite_note-OW&A_2-43) He was very skilled at using the Force to scan his surroundings, such as when he sensed poisonous kouhuns infiltrating Senator Padmé Amidala's bedroom from standing outside.[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) He was also skilled at sensing other people's feelings[[175]](#cite_note-Sabotage-175) and disturbances in the Force.[[164]](#cite_note-Brothers-164) Skywalker also showed aptitude for precognitive dreams, as when he foresaw the deaths of both his mother and his wife in dreams,[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) but also of himself becoming a Jedi, back when he lived with his mother on Tatooine.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) However, Skywalker struggled in using the Force to control and befriend animals,[[43]](#cite_note-OW&A_2-43) noting that Kenobi was much better at it than he was.[[198]](#cite_note-Crystal_Crisis-198)

Skywalker was skilled in telekinesis.[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) Even as a late beginner, by his own admission, he was very good at it, better than any of his peers and most of the older Padawans as well.[[42]](#cite_note-OW&A_3-42) He could lift lightsabers in the air and ignite them with ease, as he did once to scare a pair of Padawans who had called him a "slave to his emotions."[[41]](#cite_note-OW&A_1-41) Despite having an exceptionally strong connection to the Force, Skywalker tended not to use it very often during lightsaber duels and focused instead on the physical aspects of combat. This tendency held even when facing opponents who made liberal use of the Force during duels, such as Count Dooku.[[163]](#cite_note-Crisis_on_Naboo-163) He also could make use of animal control.[[54]](#cite_note-Obi-Wan_&_Anakin-54)

During the Clone Wars, Anakin's power and skill continued to increase. He became capable of utilizing telekinesis to accomplish such esoteric tasks as creating air bubbles around another person's head to enable breathing underwater, as shown when he saved Padmé's life at Mon Cala.[[153]](#cite_note-Prisoners-153) During his mission to Utapau, Anakin was able to feel brain waves on a dead body,[[197]](#cite_note-A_Death_on_Utapau-197) and when he first met Grand Admiral Thrawn, he was able to feel his thoughts by reaching out to him through the Force.[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) At one point during the war, Skywalker was able to telekinetically subdue both the Son and the Daughter simultaneously. However, this empowerment was lost when the Dark side grew too powerful and disrupted the balance in the Force.[[59]](#cite_note-Overlords-59)

 [![Vader uses the Force to stop an AT-AT from crushing him on Cymoon 1.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d7/VaderStopsATAT-2015StarWars2.png/revision/latest?cb=20180824032457) [![Vader uses the Force to stop an AT-AT from crushing him on Cymoon 1.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d7/VaderStopsATAT-2015StarWars2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20180824032457)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d7/VaderStopsATAT-2015StarWars2.png/revision/latest?cb=20180824032457) 

Vader uses the Force to stop an AT-AT from crushing him on Cymoon 1.

 

After his cybernetic reconstruction, Vader's connection to the Force strengthened considerably, to the point where his master Darth Sidious once complimented his powers as being "unparalleled."[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266)[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146) Though his injuries had physically crippled him, Vader believed that the suffering that he had experienced had both perfected his spirit and freed him from the needs of the flesh, allowing him to concentrate solely on his relationship to the Force.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) He demonstrated enough telekinetic power to stop an AT-AT from stepping on him and had been in the process of tearing it apart before he was interrupted in doing so.[[360]](#cite_note-SW2-360) On another occasion he telekinetically lifted two [AT-DP](/wiki/All_Terrain_Defense_Pod "All Terrain Defense Pod") walkers off of himself without any apparent strain.[[279]](#cite_note-Siege_of_Lothal-279) He also demonstrated the ability to grab hold of an engine-damaged Twi'lek freighter and bring it to the ground,[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) and crush a *Lambda*-class shuttle's engines in midflight to take it down.[[378]](#cite_note-DV15-378) He was able to utilize a Force push in a wave-like manner that was powerful enough to blow apart numerous lyleks simultaneously, despite the fact that the creatures' carapaces were impervious to even heavy blaster fire.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266)

 [![Although he already used the Force choke as a Jedi, the use of this ability became very common for Vader, both in combat and for punishment.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5d/Vader-defeats-Cal.png/revision/latest?cb=20220608124543) [![Although he already used the Force choke as a Jedi, the use of this ability became very common for Vader, both in combat and for punishment.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5d/Vader-defeats-Cal.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220608124543)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5d/Vader-defeats-Cal.png/revision/latest?cb=20220608124543) 

Although he already used the Force choke as a Jedi, the use of this ability became very common for Vader, both in combat and for punishment.

 

Vader could also project Force barriers to protect himself and others.[[364]](#cite_note-DV4-364) These barriers were powerful enough to protect him while submerged in the lava of Mustafar, though only for a short time. Vader was able to create a barrier strong enough to protect his son, Luke Skywalker, from an attack by [Sly Moore](/wiki/Sly_Moore "Sly Moore"), who used two kyber crystal powered [weapons](/wiki/Zaly_Shield "Zaly Shield") at the same time.[[536]](#cite_note-DV_2020_49-536) On at least one occasion, he demonstrated that he was able to telekinetically manipulate targets without the need to gesture at them as virtually all other Force adepts did. This granted him the ability to throw objects with the Force whilst actively engaged in swordplay.[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) He was also capable of using the Force Stasis ability and was skilled enough in its execution that on one occasion he used it to freeze two Inquisitors simultaneously.[[286]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_20-286)

Vader was also capable of using his telekinetic abilities to perform extremely delicate, complex, and precise tasks. On one occasion, he returned his badly damaged cybernetic limbs to perfect working order by dismantling a broken droid and telekinetically repairing himself with its components.[[236]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_4-236) He also demonstrated the ability to crush internal organs with the Force. At one point during an interrogation he used the Force to inflict torturous amounts of pain on several insurgent prisoners, to the point of causing heart failure in one of them.[[146]](#cite_note-Tarkin-146)

Skywalker developed a tendency to use Force choke over the course of his time as a Jedi, especially when angered or using it as a means of interrogation when an individual was uncooperative.[[112]](#cite_note-Brain_Invaders-112)[[159]](#cite_note-Slaves_of_the_Republic-159)[[174]](#cite_note-The_Wrong_Jedi-174) Skywalker would go on to use this power to deadly effect when he assumed the name Vader, generally using the choke to kill those who insulted him or failed to meet his expectations as well to instill fear.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21)[[15]](#cite_note-Episode_V-15) He also used the technique to twist, crush, or snap his victim's neck, notably executing Commander Fox this way as well as other clone troopers and later stormtroopers.[[232]](#cite_note-The_Chosen_One_1-232)[[235]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_3-235)[[360]](#cite_note-SW2-360)

Like most Force adepts, Vader also had the ability to vastly augment both his strength and speed with the Force. He was also very skilled at [using the Force to leap](/wiki/Force_jump "Force jump") great distances.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) During the [mission to investigate Geonosis](/wiki/Mission_to_investigate_Geonosis "Mission to investigate Geonosis"), Captain Rex remarked that Jedi Knight Kanan Jarrus had yet to demonstrate Skywalker's skill with Force jumps, despite having just jumped across a chasm more than 40 meters wide.[[537]](#cite_note-GoG1-537)[[538]](#cite_note-logical-conclusion-538)

Vader demonstrated on numerous occasions the ability to [probe the thoughts of others](/wiki/Mind_probe_(Force_power) "Mind probe (Force power)"), including those of Force adepts of similar power to himself. Due to his strong connection with his son, Luke, he was able to sense his presence through the Force quite easily—as opposed to his master, who was skeptical about this ability, and quickly became able to mentally communicate with him upon Luke learning he was Vader's son.[[5]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-5)

### Other skills

:   "*I can fix anything.*"
:   ―Anakin Skywalker[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12)

Even at a young age, Skywalker demonstrated a great aptitude for piloting, mechanics, and engineering. He rebuilt the protocol droid C-3PO, an advanced droid fluent in over six million forms of communication, as well as a functional podracer.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) Although during his adulthood, he would rarely use his talent as a mechanic, he kept the skill of repairing technology.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) Vader had displayed great power in hunting and exterminating the Jedi Order, leaving his later efforts against enemies like Crimson Dawn to require far less effort.[[470]](#cite_note-HE_1-470) Once most Jedi had been killed, Tarkin believed that Vader was actively searching for stimulating opponents to challenge himself.[[283]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_18-283)

 [![Darth Vader's TIE Advanced](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/VadersTIEAdvanced-2015DarthVader2.png/revision/latest?cb=20210709040909) [![Darth Vader's TIE Advanced](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/VadersTIEAdvanced-2015DarthVader2.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/260?cb=20210709040909)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/81/VadersTIEAdvanced-2015DarthVader2.png/revision/latest?cb=20210709040909) 

Darth Vader's TIE Advanced

 

As a pilot, Skywalker showed an amazing ability that few were able to surpass, and Kenobi would later describe him to his son Luke as "the best star pilot in the galaxy."[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) Anakin was able to pilot a pod racer and was the first and only human thus far to compete in a pod race. He was also able to survive the Battle of Naboo, and he went on to improve his skills in flying and aerial combat. Throughout the Clone Wars, Anakin was known for being the best pilot in the Republic and was known for leading the charge in battles and coming out alive. He was very skilled in chasing down targets, shaking off-target locks, and outmaneuvering opponents. His strength in the Force also gave him quick reflexes, an ability that would help in dodging fire and focusing in on enemy targets. He also displayed incredible precognition, as he was capable of predicting his targets' movements during dogfights with pinpoint precision. He once managed to land the *Invisible Hand* when it was half-destroyed and breaking up in the atmosphere.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13)

After becoming Vader, he remained an exceptionally skilled pilot, as shown when he single-handedly almost destroyed Phoenix Squadron in a lone TIE Advanced x1, easily out-flying their entire fleet and forcing their command to abandon ship.[[279]](#cite_note-Siege_of_Lothal-279) He also obliterated several Alliance squadrons during the Battle of Vrogas Vas.[[373]](#cite_note-SW:VD-373) Despite this, Skywalker would occasionally be shot down during his combat piloting career,[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19) with Ahsoka Tano once proclaiming they always crashed when he flew, although Skywalker had a habit of blaming whatever ship it was he was flying.[[105]](#cite_note-Bounty_Hunters-105) Although he mainly used lightsabers, Skywalker was extremely proficient at the use of [blaster pistols](/wiki/Blaster_pistol "Blaster pistol").[[196]](#cite_note-In_Search_of_the_Crystal-196) He also had some training on the use of [staves](/wiki/Staff "Staff"), a skill he once taught to a Felucian village so that they could defend themselves.[[105]](#cite_note-Bounty_Hunters-105) Skywalker spoke [Galactic Basic Standard](/wiki/Galactic_Basic_Standard "Galactic Basic Standard"), [Huttese](/wiki/Huttese "Huttese"),[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) [Jawa Trade Language](/wiki/Jawa_Trade_Talk "Jawa Trade Talk"), and [Meese Caulf](/wiki/Meese_Caulf "Meese Caulf"),[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191) and he understood [binary](/wiki/Binary "Binary")[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) and the [Bith language](/wiki/Bith_(language) "Bith (language)").[[162]](#cite_note-Friends_and_Enemies-162) As Vader, he learned the ancient [Sith tongue](/wiki/Ur-Kitt%C3%A2t "Ur-Kittât"), and he spoke it along with his master, Sidious.[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266)

### Clothing

:   "*Your sleeves are cut to allow exaggerated movements of your arms. Likewise, the long tunic, which appears as if it would impede your movement, also allows freedom of motion. Of equal importance is the fact that in combat its swirling motion will distract an opponent's eyes.*"
:   ―Commander Thrawn analyzes Anakin Skywalker's Clone Wars-era uniform[[191]](#cite_note-Thrawn:_Alliances-191)

 [![Skywalker's Padawan attire upon being taken as Obi-Wan Kenobi's Padawan.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/AnakinsPadawanAttire-SW100Objects.png/revision/latest?cb=20230422020527) [![Skywalker's Padawan attire upon being taken as Obi-Wan Kenobi's Padawan.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/AnakinsPadawanAttire-SW100Objects.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/150?cb=20230422020527)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/AnakinsPadawanAttire-SW100Objects.png/revision/latest?cb=20230422020527) 

Skywalker's Padawan attire upon being taken as Obi-Wan Kenobi's Padawan.

 

As a slave on Tatooine, Skywalker wore a tan tunic. Equipped with tools, he was able to rebuild C-3PO and complete his own podracer. During the Battle of Naboo, he piloted a N-1 starfighter and wore a Naboo pilot's helmet. After becoming a part of the Jedi Order, he wore Jedi robes and was given a Padawan braid.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_I-12) He also kept a bit driver on himself, which he lost during the rescue of Yoda, and had his own lightsaber[[54]](#cite_note-Obi-Wan_&_Anakin-54) that was destroyed on Geonosis. Afterward, he was given a replacement saber that had a green blade for the arena battle[[14]](#cite_note-Episode_II-14) before having a new lightsaber for the Clone Wars. During the early days of the war, Skywalker wore pieces of [commander armor](/wiki/Jedi_Commander_armor "Jedi Commander armor") over his Jedi clothing.[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19) Later, he wore different Jedi robes without the armor,[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) although he had donned the armor again when he met Commander Thrawn.[[539]](#cite_note-Thrawn_Alliances_second_cover-539) Whilst undercover on the *Halcyon*, Skywalker wore a brown and grey outfit, which defined his muscular build, that included a cape.[[78]](#cite_note-HL_3-78)

 [![Darth Vader, the man who was once Anakin Skywalker, relied on a suit of life support armor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c8/FineArtPrints-Darth-Vader-The-Chosen-One.png/revision/latest?cb=20221020182220) [![Darth Vader, the man who was once Anakin Skywalker, relied on a suit of life support armor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c8/FineArtPrints-Darth-Vader-The-Chosen-One.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20221020182220)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c8/FineArtPrints-Darth-Vader-The-Chosen-One.png/revision/latest?cb=20221020182220) 

Darth Vader, the man who was once Anakin Skywalker, relied on a suit of life support armor.

 

During the Clone Wars, Skywalker flew his own Delta-7B *Aethersprite*-class light interceptor until, later in the conflict, he replaced it with the new Eta-2 *Actis*-class light interceptor.[[100]](#cite_note-Ultimate_SW-100) Both starfighters were yellow;[[86]](#cite_note-Downfall_of_a_Droid-86)[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) at least in the case of the Eta-2, the color was a tribute to his old podracer.[[100]](#cite_note-Ultimate_SW-100) Skywalker also kept the *Twilight*, the freighter stolen from Teth[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19) that allowed him to go on undercover missions. From the *Venator*-class Star Destroyer *Resolute*, the Jedi General commanded a fleet of starships.[[86]](#cite_note-Downfall_of_a_Droid-86) As a Jedi General, he could also he transported to battlefields aboard a Low Altitude Assault Transport/infantry gunship.[[19]](#cite_note-CloneWarsFilm-19) While trying to reach the Republic Center for Military Operations, Skywalker and Captain Rex flew in a [Praxis Mk. I turbo speeder](/wiki/Praxis_Mk._I_turbo_speeder "Praxis Mk. I turbo speeder").[[177]](#cite_note-The_Jedi_Who_Knew_Too_Much-177)

During his earliest days as a Sith Lord, Darth Vader continued to wear his Jedi robes and flew a green Eta-2 *Actis*-class light interceptor. After burning on Mustafar, he was given his black life support armor that was also equipped with a black cape.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_III-13) After killing Kirak Infil'a and stealing his lightsaber, Vader bled the kyber crystal to make his own lightsaber,[[233]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_5-233) which he further modified after a failed assassination attempt. As a Sith, Vader flew a personal starship during the early days of the Empire,[[245]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_12-245) black Eta-2 fighters,[[266]](#cite_note-LotS-266) and the TIE Advanced x1.[[21]](#cite_note-Episode_IV-21) Palpatine also gave Vader the old Naboo Royal Starship of Padmé Amidala.[[286]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_20-286) After being tortured by Sidious and left on Mustafar, Vader repaired his armor using parts from the remains of battle droids[[431]](#cite_note-DV_2020_7-431) and restored his green Eta-2. He also obtain an ancient wayfinder.[[433]](#cite_note-DV_2020_9-433) After again saying he would serve his Sith Master, his armor was repaired.[[436]](#cite_note-DV_2020_12-436)
